reviews.text: The food is always amazing here. The food is the reason for always choosing Cheesecake Factory. However, the staff is less than mediocre. I have never been treated so poorly by a greeter and a hostess. We had an infant with us and she stood up and started explaining to us in a loud stern voice that &#34;every body has to count for a reservation&#34;. She didn&#39;t leave us time to explain that because the baby is only 2 months old, she can&#39;t sit up so there&#39;s no need for an extra spot at the table for her. She was extremely rude. Once she realized that the baby was so tiny, she quickly tried to change her tune but we were already put off. Our waiter was nice and helpful. But we had to wait 45 minutes in between getting our check and actually paying. Maybe they are short staffed? But for the amount we pay for the food and experience, they need to figure things out a little bit more.

Thier loaded nachos are the best! I always ask for more jalapenos, because it adds a nice kick. I absolutely love there cheesecakes, i love having the choice of picking different flavors.  There smoothies are a must try!
This is how big salmon they gave me today for Almond crusted salmon salad . There is barely any almond. I have ordered this so many times over the years, today is the worst.

We waited for 2 hours for a table for 2, to be seated and told that they were out of literally everything. I asked for many different options and each time they came up<br>Empty. Love eating here! Just wish they would have told us in advance about the food shortage due to the DoorDash promotion.

Weeks and weeks ago, I was feeling incredibly famished from a day of heavy lifting and strenuous activities, I decided that it was time to quench my hunger. I said to myself &#34;Maybe it&#39;s time for The Cheesecake Factory&#34; and went on the website to place an order. Here&#39;s where I made an AWFUL mistake, I ordered the Avocado Egg Roll and burger sliders. I began my journey to 6223 S State St, Murray, UT 84107. I arrived and I got a text asking me what car and make and model I had, I tell them a hilarious funny joke over text and tell them my car&#39;s make and model, my joke is ignored as I get no reply. A worker knocks on my car&#39;s glass and doesn&#39;t even say &#34;Hello how are you Sir!!!!&#34;. They still greeted me so it&#39;s fine, this is really just personal preference <br><br>I arrive home and begin to ear my meal, I immediately feel full of sorrow and pain snd disgust. The Egg Rolls were mediocore and the sliders were that of burger king quality, which to me is below McDonalds. I wouldn&#39;t recommend these dishes but the bread that comes along with the food is great and the fries were good too!

All was well except for when I put on their special request:  celebrating my son&#39;s birthday and baby with a stroller.<br><br>You got the note about the stroller but disregard birthday celebration.  Lol why even ask the customer when you don&#39;t do anything special??<br>We still tipped our waiter good and bought cheesecake on the way out.   Still loved the food just missed on the cues.  Could at least greet with a Happy Birthday? Oh well

The food is usually always good so no issues there. My family went to this location for my husbands birthday, the hostess wanted to cram us into A tiny booth and was rude when we asked for another table. As we walked away the girls at the hostess stand were even mocking us. Not cool. The waitress knew it was his birthday and didn&#39;t acknowledge him or anything, which is fine but would a complementary Dessert kill them? Once we did purchase our cheese cake they brought the check immediately too so we couldn&#39;t even finish our meal in peace. <br><br>At the end of the day our lunch was fine but for the price tag you would assume the quality of service to be better.

What an enjoyable night we had. When going to The Cheesecake Factory you know it&#39;s not going to the quietest evening but that you&#39;ll leave with a full tummy of delicious food. <br><br>Our waitress was amazing and never left our drinks more than half empty or the table a mess. <br><br>The cucumber lemonade is amazing! I crave it in the regular. I got the Crispy Chicken Costoletta and my husband got the Chicken Alfredo. Both were delicious and highly recommended.

To start, the avocado egg roll was paired with a sweet chili sauce. The steak Dianne was cooked to a perfect medium!  Although too full for cheesecake myself, I did order a slice of Dulce de Leche cheesecake to take to another friend  I was seeing later.  She loved it!

The cheesecake factory has always been a favorite of mine, I always choose to go there for celebrations. Just always plan to have a little wait before being seated, but its so worth it! The dining area is very classy, and elegant. The have so many different kinds of cheesecake like cookies and creme, and cookie dough. If you go there you have to try the Breaded Macaroni Bites, they have absolutely delicious! There service is always impeccable, and there food is always amazing gourmet food!
Fun place for date night and family outings. Make reservations, more convenient. Food was good and dessert was great too

This gets two stars because the waiter we had was just awesome. They always are at the Cheesecake Factory! <br>The food on the other hand tasted like it was actually made at a factory. <br><br>My food experience with Cheesecake Factory has been worse and worse over past year or so. The food is often mediocre and not worth what you pay. I got the orange chicken and it was good but not $15 dollars good. I could find store bought chicken that tastes just as good. It wasn&#39;t super flavorful and didn&#39;t taste very fresh. <br><br>The really bad part was the rice. Completely over-cooked and soggy. It was just mush. Let&#39;s just say if I molded it into a ball it would be a solid. <br><br>I could go to an authentic hole in the wall restaurant and get far superior orange chicken and rice for half the price. Unfortunately this was kind of the last straw for me here. It&#39;s just overrated.<br><br>I really love how well they train their servers. Some of the best! But ours wasn&#39;t able to do anything for us when I told them about the rice.

Even with reservations this place has a huge crowd. It&#39;s always going to be noisy. Just remember if you want to go here reservations can be made through Yelp. <br><br>Given the huge crowds ago here, and the humongous menu it provides, it&#39;s no surprise that food comes to your table in no particular order, and rarely together. At least that has been our experience. Twice servers came to our table asking if we had ordered a particular item they were holding. The whole thing seem disorganized.<br><br>My husband&#39;s food was over salted. I stuck with appetizers and mine meal was fine. Of course, you come here for the cheesecake right? But it seems like the past few times that we&#39;ve ordered cheesecake to go, the slice comes out incredibly small compared to what the picture shows.

The wait times here are ridiculous!<br><br>However, I can understand why. The food here is scrumptious, and the service is great. <br><br>I usually order the Chicken Madeira or the Chicken Bellagio (which is also my daughter&#39;s favorite dish here). Both are heavenly delicious! <br><br>I would also recommend the Dulce de Leche Cheesecake... it does not disappoint.
This place has gone down from the good old days . The only thing that remains the same is their desserts .

Love this place, the food and the servers they are all awesome and know the menu which is always good because the menu is big. The brunch menu is off the chains and the cheesecake of course is the best!

Great as always. We had exceptional service with Devin. Our drinks were never empty and we had a party of 8. My husband and I split the Steak Diane, our toddler had bow tie pasta with meatballs and we got the dulce de leche cheesecake. We loved our experience. Yummy food, great atmosphere, and wonderful service.

We were surprised there was a wait for a table on a weekday night but it was !<br>Our party consisted of 4 people and the wait was just 20 min which was surprising considering their lobby was full. <br>When we got seated the waitress cam by pretty fast and asked for our drink orders. She came back quickly and with bread. <br>We ordered chicken Madeira, chicken bellagio, chopped salad and tomato, basil and cheese flat bread<br>We got our food quickly, and it was delicious. The waitress was attentive and kind. <br><br>The cons are that they are in the pricier side. Granted they have larger portions but still. The place is pretty loud  and crowded so it makes it hard to have a conversation. <br><br>Overall it was good!
We did the &#39;Covid&#39; take out. And dang does the quality differ from in person. I will not be going again as they really missed the mark.

It&#39;s ridiculous how long the wait was for this place. If I could give them zero stars I would. My family and I were out on a waiting list and told us we had to wait for 2 hours. We waited and didn&#39;t understand why after two hours they still did not have seating. Their excuse was a big family, who had already finished their meal would not stop talking and leave. My mom is diabetic, and so she almost fainted due to low blood sugar, because they couldn&#39;t accommodate us like they said they would. The Cheese Cake Factory has TERRIBLE SERVICE!! We ended up going to a small local restaurant called Joy Luck in Bountiful. They had our food ready in 20mins! I&#39;m glad our money went to a place much more deserving of it.

The food is super yummy and the service is great! I also get workers that have a huge smile on their face and seem to be happy that they are there. I love their chicken dishes and Oreo cheesecake. It is delicious. It is also in a convenient location for shopping while waiting for a table.

It shouldn&#39;t take 1 1/2 hours to order a piece of cheesecake. Had to wait in the cold the entire time. They said it would be ten to fifteen minutes. I understand if you are busy, what I don&#39;t understand is telling customers an unrealistic timeframe. Be honest and upfront. Customer service was rude and horrible.

It&#39;s terrible I have to come on and even give 1 star I wish I could leave 0. I normally love cheesecake factory but this location needs new staff. Maddie is very unprofessional and rude she&#39;s a hostess here at this location, We come in yesterday for lunch and my friend has a heart condition and as soon as we come<br>Through the door she screamed at her for not having a mask on and wouldn&#39;t let her explain her case told her she cant eat here without one and has to leave. Wouldn&#39;t Even let her explain. Will not be coming back to this location because of Maddie. Then she told me were five minutes late for our reservation so will have to Wait 20 minutes. And she also screamed at me and I had a mask on.I think she&#39;s racist!! I will be going to the the Cheesecake Factory downtown from now on business elsewhere!!! I repeat do not go to this location and save your self go downtown until they get  Maddie the hostess under control!!!!! She made me and my family and my two-year-old son very uncomfortable she kept staring and pointing and whispering to other workers in there also!!

I get it. We are in unusual times and I&#39;m sure there are people there working their ass off during this Covid bullshit. But there were people waiting there for literally 2.5 hours when they were given pickup times. What&#39;s troubling is when I went in to cancel there must have been 40+ bags just sitting there. No one touched them. No one called any names. The staff at the cheesecake bar were just giggling putting whipped cream on cake. <br><br>Absolutely ZERO management or order. I knew I should have stuck with Red Rock.

The girl at the front taking reservations (bigger girl, long wavy light brown hair) was rather rude. They made us wait until a table that could seat 3 was available even though our baby didn&#39;t need a seat and wasn&#39;t eating. Got in and our waitress forgot several things, kept clearing the bread before we had eaten it without asking if we were done, etc. My avocado sandwich had two tiny pieces of avocado on the whole thing. It was just a bad experience all around. We left quickly and skipped dessert because it was so bad.

Great food, but overpriced. I got a delicious bowl of white chicken chili, and I would definitely order it again, but $15+ is pretty expensive, and that&#39;s on the cheaper side of the menu. Lighting is pretty dark in the room, and often times there is a wait at this location because it&#39;s a popular place. The cheesecake itself is phenomenal--very rich, it can be split between two people.
I ordered a 30 dollar rib eye and the steak was no bigger then my fist..  sad. I know it&#39;s  not a steak place bbt damn!!!!  <br>Cheesecake was good.  200 dollars latter.  BOOM!

There is always a wait to get seated here.  The wait staff are never really all with it.  If you don&#39;t get a booth then your seated in the table area crammed right next to people (very awkward).  This particular visit the server was working 2 tables and just dragged.  When food arrived veggies were missing was told it&#39;s a new line cook and he forgot.  The sauce on the Steak Diane had no flavor and the pile of mashed potatoes were full of the skins and cold not very appetizing.  The artichoke cheese dip was pretty good and then the free bread is always just ok.  Overall the prices are expensive the service is always lack luster but I find myself coming back a few times a year hoping it&#39;s going to be a better experience but it&#39;s always just meh.

The food tasted great like always.<br><br>The staff at this location isn&#39;t the greatest. I have had experiences here that were normal, but this last time, our waiter was pretty bad. Didn&#39;t talk to us, and he walked away mid conversation. Didn&#39;t deserve a tip, but still gave it for the cooking staff.<br><br>City Creek Location way better.

We visited on a Sunday late night, the place was empty. We had to wait a couple of minutes to be noticed by the restaurant hostess. They were to busy talking to each other to saw that we were standing in front of their counter. First disappointment of the night. <br><br>Immediately after been sitting our waiter informed us that it was no bread. There was the second disappointment of the night. The food came promptly after ordering. My husband pasta tasted ok, nothing to rave about it. My Cuban sandwich was excellent! The cheesecakes for dessert were good as expected. <br><br>At the end we gave our credit card to the waiter with our bill/check and he didn&#39;t return it. When we asked for it, he printed a new bill/check and expect form us to paid again. We informed him that he already had our credit card. He went to look for it, but it took him a little longer to found it. That was the third and last disappointment of the night.

When you think of The Cheesecake Factory, you only think of one thing...Their cheesecake! <br><br>I love their cheesecake! My personal favorites are the Tiramisu and the white chocolate raspberry...yum! My mouth is watering thinking about it! <br><br>My friends and I recently went here for a friends Valentine&#39;s Day. We went the day after Valentine&#39;s. If you&#39;ve ever been here, you can&#39;t make a reservation directly on their site but you can on your Yelp App! I would highly recommend making a reservation because this restaurant is always busy! I mean ALWAYS! <br><br>We had a party of six, I checked in before all my friends got there and was actually seated before they had all arrived. <br><br>Our server, oh my lanta! Probably one of the best servers I have had in a long time! He was super attentive, sweet , he gave recommendations, and most importantly he was patient with us! <br><br>We ordered mimosa&#39;s for drinks and they were good! I&#39;ve tried various mimosa&#39;s and the ones I got from here were by far the best I have had! <br><br>For food, I ordered off the Skinnylicious menu. I ordered the Lemon-Garlic Shrimp. Sauteed Shrimp, Basil, Tomato and Lemon-Garlic Sauce. It was served with with Asparagus and Angel Hair Pasta. I have no complaints! I was full super full after finishing my plate. Everything was cooked perfectly! <br><br>This place is pricey but the food is worth it! I WISH they had a deal on Mimosa&#39;s but that&#39;s my inner alcoholic coming out...a girl can dream!

Ordered take out online. I was given a time for pick up and arrived at my designated time. I was the only one waiting for orders at that time. The staff came out and told me it would be a couple more minutes. 35 minutes later.... I got my order. Which consisted of one premade slice of cheesecake and two burgers. I&#39;m just as confused as you are.. pick up time 4:10pm 4:45 they bring it out to me. The lone person waiting for an order. <br><br>I understand we are in &#34;a weird time&#34; but a major restaurant should still be able to keep up with to go orders (since that&#39;s all that&#39;s available) and if they are behind - offer something for the wait. <br><br>The food was average as usual, the cheesecake delicious but the wait was unacceptable. Maybe if I hadn&#39;t received a pick up time I could be more forgiving. <br><br>Future guests. Whether you&#39;re dining in or taking out. Be prepared to spend 30 minutes past your scheduled time.

We came here, on Christmas Eve to pick up a order. I went in and said I&#39;m here to pick up an order I was only like 10 mins early, she said I couldn&#39;t pick it up until, 5:30 and so I said well it&#39;s just cheesecake and food we are kinda in a hurry and need to get somewhere. And she said I know! But you can&#39;t get it yet. And got mad, not a nice person, had terrible service, and way too busy!! Unbelievable won&#39;t come back again!!!!
Service is good, the food tho... The pretzels were burnt, and I ordered my steak rare not raw. Overall everything was ight.

My friends love this place and I keep going trying to see what they see<br><br>I&#39;m not blind but their food is just marginal in my opinion.  It&#39;s expensive too and often the wait is unreasonable<br><br>Take me to a great local place any day or time and maybe next time I can convince my friends to explore

I know COVID is going on and what not, but there was literally no one in the lobby area in Cheese cake factory and the manager made me and my 7month old daughter go outside. I had my mask on and everything and again NO one was waiting we were the ONLY ones in the area. It&#39;s almost 100 degrees outside and he told us we had to wait out there. When I asked what he thought the turn around time was her said 15 minutes like I said a few minutes ago. Which he spoke to my husband not me so I wasn&#39;t aware of the time frame. Rude....not cool and extremely inconsiderate.

I&#39;ve previously visited Cheesecake Factory restaurants in San Francisco and Chicago, and this was my second visit to this Salt Lake City location.  Unfortunately, I&#39;m pretty sure this will also be my last visit to the Salt Lake City venue.  The problem with this locale is not the food, but rather it&#39;s the wait.  And honestly it isn&#39;t even the wait itself.  No, the real problem are the conditions you endure while waiting.  Years ago, when this location was first being built, I thought that by Cheesecake Factory standards this was going to be an undersized location, which prediction has entirely come true.  <br><br>On our most recent visit we arrived just after 4:30 pm (knowing that there would be a wait, we were planning ahead) and once we fought our way through the entrance crowd and waited in line at the reception desk just to put our name in, we were already 15 minutes into an ordeal that I would rather never experience again.  We were told to check back in an hour, but to expect a 75 minute wait, so as planned we went off to the adjoining mall to kill some time.  <br><br>An hour later, as instructed, we returned and somehow is seemed as though the sardine-packed crowd had doubled in size, though nonetheless managed to squeeze into the cramped waiting area.  We checked in again and we were told it would be another 20 minutes (so now the prediction is an 80 minute wait, which would have been just lovely in retrospect).  Eighty minutes came and went, as did any semblance of personal space or dignity our foursome once had.  Honestly, McDonalds was sounding like a world class option at that point--but we survived so long that we couldn&#39;t give up.  Surrender was simply not an option.  Well, because this review is threatening to become about as long as our restaurant wait, I&#39;ll just skip ahead and reveal that it took nearly two hours to finally be seated.<br><br>Then, another 15 minutes passed before bread was delivered to our table--I literally thought my 9 year old was going to pass out from hunger.  After ordering, another 30 minutes passed before our entrees arrived.  After then ravenously scarfing down our meals, our dinner ordeal finally ended around 8:30 pm--yep, FOUR hours invested in dinner.<br><br>Although the Cheesecake Factory has decent food, and a huge variety of it, the food is simply not good enough to warrant this kind of self-inflicted food deprivation and close-quarters, standing room only high endurance waiting.  In fact, the ONLY reason we came on this occasion is that over the past 2 years we had collected FIVE Cheesecake Factory gift cards and decided it was finally time to get our free meal.  In the end, it was a mistake.  I am pretty much convinced that anyone that gives you a Cheesecake Factory gift card in Utah either (1) doesn&#39;t really like you very much, or (2) hopes you have travel plans that include a Cheesecake Factory location elsewhere.  <br><br>Absent the inexcusable wait and horrendous herded cattle/mosh pit waiting conditions, I&#39;d probably rate this location a 3-star joint based on the food.  But, alas, waiting is the name of the game here, so 1-star is all this location deserves.  Please trust me on this--there are far better restaurant choices, with much better food, and many of such places even participate in the cutting edge 1970s practice of taking reservations!  Now, THERE&#39;s an idea for you, Cheesecake Factory.  <br><br>We will not be back--no matter how many gift cards may befall us.

The manager (with the beard) at this business needs to be fired. Rudest most disrespectful person we have ever met especially to paying customers. Rude over the phone and in person. Its amazing to me that they let a person like him work at a big business like this one.

Love this place!  Went around noon and got in quick and enjoyed the Bang bang Chicken and the Chocolate Mousse Tower Cake (which was really yummy and rich)!  Our server was very helpful and always checking on us!

This restaurant visit was the result of not being able to decide a type of food we were craving- and they do have a vast amount of menu items.  <br>Parking can get crazy on weekends, Thursday evening on this occasion it wasn&#39;t too bad, I don&#39;t mind the walk.  <br>The wait time was allegedly 25-30 min (the hostess said it was more like 25). So we waited and waited.  I know it surely could&#39;ve been worse, but I don&#39;t feel like the waiting area set up is that great.  People crammed into a space, not really room for groups of 4+people.  I should&#39;ve got on the waitlist or made a reservation and seen if there was a difference in wait time.  Next time I will be doing that.  <br>So when we finally were seated it was between two large groups of 6+ people, and we could barely hear each other talk.  The lights are basically non-existent and I&#39;d suggest looking at your menu with a flashlight.  <br>Our waitress, Elaine N., saved this experience as she was attentive, polite, and friendly enough to make some menu suggestions and kept our drinks full.  Service in general was quick. <br>The food wasn&#39;t bad, but it wasn&#39;t like a blown mind experience.  I had a Parmesan and herb crusted chicken, green beans, and mashed potatoes.  My husband had some sort of crispy chicken with honey sauce and mashed potatoes.  The masked potatoes were the highlight of the meal besides the complimentary bread.  <br>The workers seem overworked, on more than one occasion I saw an exasperated expression on their faces. <br>Overall feeling is that I don&#39;t really want to go back, it is so cramped, even for a &#39;special occasion&#39; I would want to actually be able to talk to whoever I was with.  You can get kind of comfort food elsewhere for a better price.

You make a reservation and then when you arrive there is no direction as to what you do next. Line out the door. People cutting the line and going through the exit. Standing in line not sure if the people you&#39;re in line with also have reservations or if their just taking a chance at being seated. Remembering that if your 5 minutes late your reservation is gone. Kind of crazy and pretty stressful since we had to drive 40 minutes to get here. Food is ok here. Server was nice. City Creek one is all around better.

Honestly- we usually love Cheesecake Factory. We were so happy to see that they offered curbside pick up, but because of how they handled their curbside pick up during Covid, we&#39;ll never go again. No one is wearing masks (employees were but no patrons), it&#39;s just as busy as before - people acting as if there isn&#39;t a pandemic, and their curbside pick up blocks traffic and defeats the purpose of being safe and utilizing their curbside pick up. Why don&#39;t you guys use the curbside to go spots? It would clear up traffic and be safer. We had to call in and tell someone where we were here and still had to wait 30+ minutes for it. My husband had to go inside and ask someone for help - which defeats the purpose of us using to curbside option- If you&#39;re going to open during a pandemic and offer options to your patrons to avoid eating inside, then make sure the plan works. <br><br>Also- we got home and I do not recommend paying more for chicken. I literally had 3 pieces in my pasta. So glad we had a gift card and didn&#39;t have to pay $50+ for a crappy situation.
The Murray location is consistent... consistently poor service. It is unreal. Every time!
I still feel like tHey are a little over priced but then again... that cheesecake!! The raspberry and Oreo are Faves of ours!

Food is always great. Service is always a hit and miss. <br>We&#39;ve had some great waiters and we&#39;ve had a waitress who&#39;s messed up our order and gave us attitude, for some reason.<br>Meals are about $15-$20 on average. Their lower calorie menu is actually yummy, their pastas are delicious, and of course they have the greatest cheesecake (which are about $10 per slice.) <br>Atmosphere complaints from my grandma: It&#39;s very loud and it&#39;s too dark (she can&#39;t read the menu and she feels like she can&#39;t see the person sitting across from her.)

Terrible service. They completely ignored us when we walked in, 3 hour wait to get a table for 7 at 4:30 on the afternoon WTF. We went somewhere else for dinner and then went back hoping to get cheesecake to go. After ordering cheesecake, they made us leave the store as it was SNOWING OUTSIDE. They wouldn&#39;t let us even stay in the doorway. They ignored us for 15 mins while we were trying to order, and After ordering cheesecakes, we waited 45 mins for it to come outside IN THE SNOW. Absolutely terrible!

The employees at this location is unbelievable there rudeness to there customers is highly unprofessional&#39; I will never return for how they treat me an my family take your money an Business elsewhere or to the downtown location #Boycott #Wrostchessecakefactory

Came to this location for an early dinner with the family, and since I reserved a table online thru Yelp reservation, we walked in, and got seated within 10 minutes - while the rest of the walk ins had like 1.5 to 2 hours wait, at 4:45pm on a weeknight!  It&#39;s crazy how PACKED this place is, on a weeknight, and on an early dinner time too.  We have had the privilege to sit in Alex&#39;s section, and Alex was personable, friendly, and just really easy to chat with!  He happily fulfilled our wishes of never ending servings of the brown bread, with a plethora of butter plates each time!  Ordered the shrimp scampi plate, while hubby ordered his all time favorite, Chicken Louisiana pasta.  Kids ordered chicken tenders, fries, and mac n&#39;cheese.  It was a fantastic dinner and ended it with our favorite Tuxedo cheesecake (you can NEVER go wrong with this choice).  I did order the strawberry shortcake but they changed how they serve the cake now.  It used to be one big piece and then a mound of vanilla ice cream, then fresh strawberries on top.  Now they have 4 small pieces of muffin cake, then ice cream on each one, then strawberries.  The cake tastes different now, more like a biscuit instead of a pound cake taste.  Too bad they changed it - the original one tasted way better!

Food was great, I had the avocado egg rolls and the beet and avocado salad from the skinnylicious menu.  I made reservations and was seated promptly when I arrived.  Everyone I encountered was polite and efficient.  Great experience and just happy I can go out, dine in, and enjoy a great meal.

I don&#39;t know why I haven&#39;t posted for  TCF yet!!? 5 stars!!!<br>Love this place, any time of year- especially now because the pumpkin cheesecake is ahhhhhhhmazing #drooling <br>If you havent had it, better try it!

Sat at the bar tonight to try and dodge the long line. And it worked! The bartender was phenomenal, the service was great, and the food and drinks were SO GOOD. The cocktails and food just hit the spot so well. Come here!

Disappointed. <br><br>Arrived about 5:30pm on a Sunday. Got seated and the waitress informed us of no bread.Every trip to CF, we always look forward to the hot bread and butter. We love eating it with our Pasta. Then I ordered a Buffalo Blast and that dish was served BURNT! It was fried too long that the batter was turned dark and you can smell the overcooked oil. Disgusting. The kitchen and staff should take pride in their work and presentation. <br><br>Won&#39;t be visiting anytime soon. Nope!

Our waiter was very attentive and I actually like that they have such a large menu. It is super crowded and loud which is hard for people like me with anxiety. Are cups were always full and they boxed up our leftovers. I liked everything I ordered.<br>Nuestro camarero era muy atento y en realidad me gusta que tienen un gran menú. Es muy concurrido y ruidoso, lo que es difícil para las personas como yo con ansiedad. Las bebidas siempre estaban llenas. Me gustó todo que pedí.
I ordered takeout, and they cheated me of more than $20 food. I called the manager,  who promised to refund the money for that food. No refund ever came.

Absolutely love this location.  The staff really cares.  We had a mix up with a yelp reservation and the opening manager called me personally to take care of us.  Our waiter is a ten year veteran of the brand and provides 5 diamond service.  Made for a very special brunch with loved ones.  Morning, noon or night still have to go with the Bang Bang chicken and shrimp.   Hard to believe we have been able to enjoy Cheesecake Factory in Utah for a decade.  So grateful the staff and management team stay true to brand standards.

The service was prompt and nice, but that&#39;s where the good times ended. This is a standard CF, nothing special. Usual mall location so I wound up here after taking an Uber the day before a conference to grab a pair of shoes at the mall. The local spot I wanted was already closed (at 8:30) so I chose CF. The waiter was okay but the kitchen and management leave a lot to be desired.<br><br>I ordered the French onion soup and, I kid you not, it was ROOM TEMPERATURE and served with unmelted SHREDDED Parmesan cheese just floating around at the bottom. In short, TERRIBLE.<br><br>Then I decided the kitchen might not be up to standards so I ordered the tamale cake appetizer and the avocado egg rolls because they&#39;re always good, right? It didn&#39;t seem like I ordered anything that could be ruined; I was wrong. The egg rolls were undercooked too ... I don&#39;t know how this is possible as they&#39;re all frozen, the fryers should be kept on the same temp and they should be cooked for a standard period of time. Sigh. I was OVER it. I&#39;d just gotten off a 6 hour flight and was ready for bed so I asked for them to go. <br><br>Not only did the manager fail to check on me EVEN ONCE, they also didn&#39;t comp the soup-- of which I had one bite--and the egg rolls were raw again and inedible and I went to bed pissed and hungry $60 later. I loved my mango key lime cheesecake though. That&#39;s seriously in the top 2 cheesecakes I&#39;ve ever had.<br><br>However this visit was a complete failure.

As someone that loves cheesecake, I can honestly say that I never had a bad meal at this place.<br><br>I came here with some friends recently, and the food and service were excellent. I was finally able to order an alcoholic drink due to the state laws, which was a HUGE plus.  <br><br>The wait for a table was about 10 minutes which wasn&#39;t bad considering it was a Sunday afternoon and fairly busy. Once seated I knew what I wanted, cajun jambalaya. <br><br>When the food finally came, it was fantastic. The spiciness of the food was just what I needed. Not to mention that the portion size was just enough to fill me up, which is hard to do. <br><br>Sara was the server, and she did an awesome job of adhering to my parties needs. We could not have had a better server. Everything was perfect and exquisite. <br><br>If I am ever back in Utah I will make sure to stop by.
The Cajun Chicken Littles are the best chicken strips you can buy. The Red Velvet Cheesecake is incredible.

We had a great experience! Booked a reservation on Yelp a few days ago and we were seated about 10 minutes after we checked in. We got the Chicken Costoletta, it was incredible!! Huge portion, me and my husband split it and still took a piece of chicken home for leftovers!

Out of all the times we have come to Cheesecake Factory,tonight&#39;s service was second to none. And I&#39;m not one to be overly impressed by service from a restaurant chain. Max was the name of our serve. Not only was he attentive, but his social skIlls and professional yet friendly approach made our evening very enjoyable!! If you get lucky enough to receive Max as your waiter, you&#39;ll be assured to receive a 5 star service.<br><br>The only reason I&#39;m giving this review a 4 star is because we tried the reservation feature through the yelp app. We showed up not more than 3-5 minutes late due to a accident on the freeway, and they had already given our table away causing us to wait another 10 minutes before being seated. The hostess was very polite and apologized. I asked her if this was normal occurrence for reservations through the yelp app and she said no.

Hands down my favorite restaurant. Go there every year for special occasions. I get something different every time and there is nothing on their menu that isn&#39;t delicious. It&#39;s just one of those solid places that really knows what they&#39;re doing!

This place is a great place but with one caveat; clear your schedule this is a place you won&#39;t get through quickly.  It&#39;s super efficient, but crazy busy. <br><br>It&#39;s worth it!<br><br>Mac &amp;Cheese Burger<br>This delectable goodness is totally worth it.  You may be thinking it sounds like a child would buy this... well I&#39;m that adult child that loves this savory meal.<br><br>Side salad<br>I had too when you see the calories right there in front of you, you can&#39;t justify the fries, but this salad was amazing!  No joke way better than expected for a simple garden salad.<br><br>Celebration Cheesecake<br>Yes the kid inside me loves sprinkles and cake so add both of those elements to cheesecake and I&#39;m sold!<br><br>I mentioned the long wait, but the mall is right next door so we spent our hour shopping, came back and in a few minutes were seated and ready to go.  Food came so quickly and our server was awesome!
There are literally no redeeming qualities to this place. Nasty, unfriendly hosting, dirty table and utensils, rude waitress, and undercooked food. Simply horrible.

The food is always good and the portions are big. I always get the Louisiana Pasta, southwestern egg rolls, and the Tiramisu. There is almost always a wait at the door so I recommend reservations on holidays and peak times.

Lovely dining setting for my anniversary. When we arrived we arrived about 5 minutes late due to traffic and were told our table wasn&#39;t ready. We then waiting for another 20 minutes. We didn&#39;t mind too much since we weren&#39;t in much of a rush but then the waits to be able to order and then finally receiving our food got to be a bit too much. We did not receive our appetizer until after our food because we had to remind them, they had forgotten it. But the Pasta Carbonara was delicious, the Angel hair with Shrimp was good (the shrimp was fantastic), and the Fried Mac n&#39; Cheese balls were great as well as the salted caramel cheesecake. Food was overall good, but the service can always improve.

Horrible horrible restaurant. I have never experienced such prejudice. As a visitor from out of town on 04Feb2020 I had to walk out after waiting at my table for 30 minutes for service in a nearly empty restaurant. Servers very well walked past me and when I complained I got a half assed apology. While everyone apparently was enjoying thier time cackling instead of paying attn to guests. I will be calling headquarters to complain and will boycott this restaurant for the rest of my life. So utterly disgusted they donot deserve half a star

Visited this establishment for the umpteenth time and really had a great experience this visit!  I used the Yelp reservation feature (A GREAT feature by the way) and made reservations for four for 8:00 PM to beat the Saturday evening stampede.  We actually arrived ~15 minutes early and the table was waiting for us, so we sat right down and we&#39;re waited on by &#34;Gabby.&#34;<br>The family and I ordered various adult beverages, two appetizers, the breads and butter they always serve, two appetizers, and two desserts (cheesecake, natch.)  Overall, the experience was excellent hampered by just two issues:<br>1.  The always-annoying all-treble/no-bass and way too loud pop music being piped in (which was addressed my management after we asked Gabby to ask the manager to turn it down a bit...and they did!)<br>2.  Late arrival of our main course...to the tune of 60 minutes after the point we ordered the meal.  Yikes!  Thank God we had the appetizers!<br>Gabby actually brought this to the attention of the managers...which I presume were working overtime to keep the kitchen flow moving...but it didn&#39;t help our situation much.  In fact, at least two local tables were served their main course ahead of us even after arriving there 10-20 minutes after we were seated!  Probably &#34;Just Another Saturday Night at TCF,&#34; I guess.<br>Regardless, at the suggestion of one of our foursome, the kitchen manger visited us and took off the price of both Hors d&#39;oeuvres for us.  So that was a very nice gesture, and we do appreciate them recognizing their issues and compensating their clientele.<br>Oh, and Gabby did a great job (only her 5th day there as a waitress at TCF), and was compensated via a nice gratuity (for the full cost of the meal) for putting up with us.  I also stopped by and thanked the kitchen manager again for his consideration on the free Hors d&#39;oeuvres.<br>Four Stars for good food, great service, and an always excellent menu.

Mostly good food and service. However, the manager advised that the owner does not like the restaurant to be well lit...&#34;for ambiance&#34;.  My party was seated at around 7p and it was so dark that you could not read the menu or see the food. The manager did offer alternate solutions. For example, he brought 2 tea light candles in brown glasses that did absolutely nothing. Also, he suggested we turn on the flashlight feature on our phones and set our water glasses on top to make a sort of make-shift lantern. My nephew did this with his phone and it died before half the meal was over. Basically, the manager and staff at Cheesecake Factory are not allowed to touch the light switches to increase the lighting to acceptable levels for paying customers because the owner likes them barely on.

This location&#39;s service has gotten worst over the years. We always come here since it&#39;s the closest compared to the others for birthdays and special occasions. We enjoy the variety food choices and of course the cheesecakes. However, this past dinning experience has left me thinking if we should continue this tradition any longer. <br><br>To start, we got there at 530pm on a Wednesday normal night and still had to wait until 6:10 to be seated. Waited for another 10 mins to even get any service for drink orders. Food came out about 30 mins later which is decent except only for few people in our group. Mind you that food was not delivered by our server so we never got an update of when the other people&#39;s food are coming. We continue to wait another 10 mins but got too hunger and didnt want the food tonget cold. About another 5 mins passed by we finally had to waive over the server to find out when the other foods coming. She checked back with us and turns out they burnt the food and had to remake it. Meanwhile, my order was missing an item that it should come with (avacados) and really not the same without it so I asked her if it should come with this. She said I&#39;ll find out. She came back am told me yes and I said ok (my mistake here cause I assumed she was going to correct this). So I waited and waited but by this time my food is cold and I kinda gave up and lost appetite. Finally the remade food came for my daughter and I asked her if she is planning to give me the avacados, she said she thought I asked if it should come with it and that I didnt want it. Finally everyone (kids) were in melt down mode so I just wanted the check and wanted to ask to remove my order off the check. She came back and said well I got you your avacado. I said my food is cold now anyway. She answered well the avacado goes on top of your food. I was speechless at that point and just asked for the manager. Another 20 mins went by, by this time my wife already took some of the kids to the car already since they wouldn&#39;t have the patients to wait that long... the time is about 7:50 now. Almost 2.5 hrs since we got there. The manager came by and just said we took the order off and didnt really even give me a chance to explain what I am typing in on here. So after everything settle, I left the restaurant at 8pm defeated, exhausted, and hungry... anyway thanks for letting me vent on here. <br><br>I know these servers and managers are good people trying to make a living but I am just want to give this feedback so they can better improve their service for what the customers are paying for. The meals are not cheap.

Some things I didn&#39;t like.<br><br>1. Busy and crowded with long uncomfortable/awkward waiting.<br>This is a very busy location, but fine, we were there with friends so we didn&#39;t mind waiting, however it was too crowded.  There wasn&#39;t enough bench space for our party of 5 so we had to stand around in the crowded waiting area which felt like a bar because of the amount of people moving around.  Which brings me to the next item I noticed.<br><br>2.  The lighting<br>It&#39;s a little too dark in there.  This may be subjective, but when I have a tab of $100+ I&#39;d like to better see the food I purchased. The light is so low it does take away from the dining experience and feel a little like a bar experience.<br><br>3. Entitled hostess<br>Called us over to be seated, then had us waiting for a couple minutes for someone to seat us (maybe 5 minutes maybe more, not sure, it seemed like a long time). Hostess who seated us was in a hurry, not friendly, rolled her eyes at us. Wouldn&#39;t let us sit down before giving us the menus, was getting irritated when we didn&#39;t take the menus fast enough (reminder we hadn&#39;t even gotten in our seats yet).<br><br>Things I liked.<br><br>1. Waiter was solid.<br>Was able to get us an appetizer and wine well before the entrees.<br><br>2. Food was good, especially the cheesecake &amp; the wine.<br><br>3. Booth was big enough to seat 6 and seated 5, somewhat comfortably.

What is there not to like about the Cheesecake Factory right?<br><br>Well... there&#39;s the fact that when we did a pick up of cheese cake, the server dropped the cheesecake on the counter as she attempted to put it into the to go container. Smashed some of the side and then threw it in the container and covered that up with whipped cream. <br><br>Fortunately it wasn&#39;t my order, but goes to show that $8 cheesecake can&#39;t be wasted even if potentially contaminated by a surface it shouldn&#39;t have touched. But hey &#34;cover that up with whipped cream&#34; and no one is the wiser.
This place is super delicious! We love their fried zucchini appetizers and drinks!! Everything here is delicious!

We love the food here and come here several times throughout the year. We were taking a group out to celebrate a birthday and i spoke to a manager weeks in advance and they said they do not take reservations for more than 6 people. He told me to come at five o clock to put our name down. We did just that only to be told it was a 3.5 hour wait. The manager was not helpful and very dismissive when trying to explain the situation. The food is good, but not waiting-3.5 hours-good. Please figure out your reservation situation. Groups greater than 6 are the people that need reservations. You guys have this backwards. I&#39;m very frustrated with this situation and will be some time before i visit again.

Been here multiple times with my wife. Their cheesecake lives up to their name, as does the quality of most of their food. The biggest problem is that they are waaaaaay overpriced. Just went there two days ago for my wife&#39;s birthday because they finally opened after the whole COVID-19 crap. I got a 3 pieces of silver-dollar sized pieces of steak in a sauce with mushrooms, 3 pieces of shrimp with some sauce and no pasta (they called this &#34;shrimp scampi&#34; with no pasta) and some mashed potatoes. Between my meal, my wife&#39;s and two pieces of cheesecake with water to drink, we ended up spending $113. Good food, but not for the price or straight-faced blah service we got. If you&#39;re wanting to fee fancy, go somewhere else. If you want great cheesecake to go, by all means stop by.

Brunch: Finally got around to having brunch at CF. Was pleasantly surprised. Food portions are huge, as always at CF. Had the Monte Cristo and it was pretty good. Always compare this to the one at Disneyland, but it was decent. Tad to sweet for some reason. So damn full.
Service was amazing and the food was delicious. Reservation preferred because walk ins had to wait almost two hours
Bad phone service I didn&#39;t think they&#39;d keep the phone off the rack so you couldn&#39;t call in and ask questions

Garbage restaurant. They make you wear a mask for 10 seconds while they walk you to your seat. Then those pricks asked my pregnant wife to &#34;cover your full face&#34; on this 10 second journey. This enforcement is absolute bull. I will never visit this place again. It&#39;s full of virtue signaling pricks. I hate this place.

Worst customer service I&#39;ve ever experienced here.  I receive a text that says my order is ready and to come by the front door for pick up.  The line is around the building which delayed me getting my order for 25 minutes AFTER I received the text that it was ready. If we would have at least received some kind of an apology, a simple &#34;I&#39;m sorry for the inconvenience&#34; would have made the cold food at least bearable.

Yet another well run centrally located Cheesecake Factory location. Parking can be rough but isnt that common of Cheesecake factories?! Had the spicy cashew chicken and it was awesome. I loved that the chicken was slightly crunchy. Plenty of cashews and a great flavor. I recommend ordering it with white rice. Their brown bread is just fantastic.

We love The Cheesecake Factory, mainly for their cheesecake,duh. It&#39;s always super busy, and really noisy because it&#39;s always so busy. There&#39;s normally a line to the door. There&#39;s never not a line to be honest. So I highly recommend doing a reservation ahead of time. There was  one instance where we arrived at our reservation time, only to wait an additional 40 mins to be seated. So what&#39;s the point of a reservation to be honest. We didn&#39;t love our food we ordered. But the appetizers we ordered were delish, along with our cheesecake. I&#39;m giving this 4 Stars because although the atmosphere is noisy and crowded and always busy, you do have the option of coming in to get just a slice of cheesecake to go. Or ordering it online for pickup. Which is what we&#39;ve done a few times to take it home.
Horrible curbside service absolutely horrible 90 minute wait for cold food and you reply for me to contact Cheesecake Factory and use the drop down menu....

Usually this is a go to spot for dinners with my family. I&#39;ve come here for lunches and dinners with friends / family. I also buy a cake here every year for my husband&#39;s birthday... <br>today however was the worst experience I&#39;ve had and it happened to be for my sister&#39;s birthday.<br>We put the reservation for a party of 5 under my sister&#39;s husband&#39;s name, Sam.<br>They called &#34;Party of 5 for Sal.&#34; <br>We were standing by the booth and let the lady know that we were a &#34;Party if 5 for Sam&#34; not &#34;Sal&#34; and she said, &#34;well, Sal is the name.&#34; <br>We were going back and forth with her because no one else was here. <br>Another associate of hers corrected her and said, &#34;it&#39;s their party. The name should be under Sam.&#34;<br>We finally were seated. <br>Our waiter was nice, however he did not write down our orders when we put them in. He kept asking us to repeat the order.  I always feel skeptical about that because I&#39;ve had bad experiences before when this had happened. <br>My sister ordered cheeseburger spring rolls and they finally came with her order but gave us taquitos instead. We let the waiter know about the correction and they said they would fix it. <br>About 10 minutes later, another waiter came and brought my other sister her entree except my other sister ordered fettuccini with chicken and they brought us just fettuccini was with no chicken.<br>We waited until another waiter walked by to flag them down and let them know that our order was wrong. The third waiter said he would put in the correction.<br>We always say a family prayer and we do not start eating until everyone gets their food. It took over an hour for us to get our food and to get the right entrees. Then when we got our food they came out at different times. Keep in mind we have now been here for over an hour and a half. <br>Another waiter ended up serving us the rest of the night. She was nice and checked in on us for refills but it was overall a very sad experience because we have already been seated here for over an hour and a half and can barely start eating. <br>Also we ordered 3 sides of macaroni and cheese and a waiter  that brought over the 3rd macaroni and cheese thought we only ordered 2 and we told him we ordered 3. The original waiter that took our order came over and told this other waiter that we actually DID order 3. <br><br>This place has low lights in the night and it&#39;s bright during the day. It can get Very loud and it&#39;s a struggle to talk. I&#39;ve always liked the vibes, whether night or day, but such a sad night. I still tipped the waiter over $20 but overall horrible customer service.
wonderful place for a night out. The food is great and the cheesecakes are marvelous! I would give a 5 but the length of wait always is what knocks it down for me.

You know what you&#39;re getting here and I appreciate that it&#39;s always consistent. We came here for dinner before our show last night, a Friday night. We though getting in before 6pm the wait wouldn&#39;t be too bad. We arrived around 5:20 and it was packed already. Given a buzzer for a 50 minute wait. We hovered near the bar tables to see if anything came up sooner. Around 6pm we found a bar table opening and jumped on it. I personally prefer sitting at their bar tables.<br><br>My mom and I shared the Chicken Piccata (subbed the regular chicken for the cheese crusted chicken from the Chicken Romano dish) and my dad ordered the Chicken Madeira (my mom&#39;s favorite dish). Both dishes were large and flavorful. We then shared the lemon raspberry and chocolate turtle cheesecakes. <br><br>The reason I&#39;m writing this review though is for our server Tara. She&#39;s was absolutely phenomenal. On top of drinks and service despite how packed the restaurant was. She was a joy to talk to as well. She even help us with paying our bill as we split between gift cards and credit cards. Truly a gem!

A mask is required. I luckily had two so my husband and I were ok. The blond girl at the check in desk (Fashion Place Mall) was extremely rude. The food was ok. We got the bread and butter and the butter was used!!! The food was not a good as usual but ok.

Second time here and it was delicious all the way. No matter what I order from the menu they always make it right. Our server Simon is so attentive and so pleasant to deal<br>With our orders and he is very accommodating. Talking about superb customer service is definitely his a game! We tip him generously of course. Food was great! You will not regret the long wait. It is worth it! Plies the dessert! Heaven!
If you like waiting 2 hours to be seated, knock yourself out.  Food is meh at best.  Wait staff are beasts.

I came here knowing that after I ate, I would have to fast for two days to balance out the calories I consumed.   In fact, I did some research while I was waiting for my cheesecake to arrive and I discovered that there are fewer calories in a Macdonald&#39;s quarter pounder with cheese, large fries and 32 oz coke than in lost of the cheesecakes consumed at this place.  The menu is too big. Way too many choices and just confusing.  I prefer a few smaller menu.  I mean, why have a god menu anyway?  People come here for the cheesecake anyway, so just forget the food menu.  The prices are high, for what you get. But it&#39;s cheesecake!

Stopped by to grab dessert, why is it so dark, in here?!  Does the food look that bad?!  They can have ambience w/turning most of the lights off...have to use my flashlight on my IPhone to read my menu.  There&#39;s nothing romantic about a dark restaurant, not knowing if that&#39;s what you really ordered.<br>Thank goodness, all I&#39;m having is carrot cake...

Great service, bread, and dessert! We came here for cheesecake. The Godiva cheesecake is over the top and perfect for chocolate lovers. It&#39;s worth every penny. It&#39;s a little expensive but the slice is large enough you can share with 1-3 people.

We have come here for years. I must say we were more then frustrated! Came on March 12th. <br>Not only was the restaurant slowest I have ever seen due to a lot of businesses shutting down, but the service was worst we have had anywhere. <br>Day at host stand for 17minutes waiting to get sat with multiple tables empty. It took more then ten minutes to get waters, ordered our usual right away. Took 26minutes to get bread. Finally got our food, each of us at different times. Mine came out not gluten free (I am celiac, thankfully have been here before to know wat it should look like and I can smell the flour noodles). Sent it back. My bf got a burger supposed to be well done, came out bloody and pink, rare. Sent back, ordered a pizza. Got mine again the exact same. Sent back. A third time after finding two other employees to service us it came out right. By the time We received food it had been over an hour of sitting down. Mind u the restaurant is less then $40% busy. No one in bar area even. <br>The only discount on our check was 50% off my noddles.   The table four empty table near us also sent two of their plates back to kitchen for not being cooked all the way. It was surprising. And disappointing. Maybe if they had a 2hour wait to sit and eat like they usually do the service might have been better. ‍  (restaurants need to be more careful with allergies! It&#39;s not a fad! I would go to emergency room if I had eaten what was served to me even after telling my waitress twice when ordering that&#39;s it&#39;s an allergy)

The Cheesecake Factory has been a Family favorite for many years. Recently we had a  Family mini reunion and I asked the waitress what my options were for side dish options beyond don&#39;t eat toast or hash browns. She went down the list of some vegetables then she offered me BACCON! A Keto girl&#39;s dream side dish!<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory!

I ordered two pieces of cheesecake tonight online. I got the confirmation that said it would be ready by 7:29. I understood that that might be a little off so wasn&#39;t worried when it wasn&#39;t ready when I got there. I then waited 40 minutes at which point I went in to get a refund. I wasn&#39;t upset at this specific location because I thought it was probably more an issue with the ordering system. However, when I went to get my refund the person at the register, who I believe was the manager but I could be wrong, treated me with total apathy and no remorse. All I would have asked for was a little sympathy and I would have been happy with the location. I didn&#39;t get that so I&#39;m frustrated with both this location and the inaccuracy of the ordering system.
A friend recommended the Sweet Corn Tamale appetizer and it was the best thing I&#39;ve tasted in a long time. The top sauce is great

The cheese cake factory is always good we had a hamburger a steak  a steak and enchiladas everyone was happy <br>Then there was the cheese cake It was awesome we all enjoyed a piece of fresh strawberry cheesecake it was excellent

Never disappointed. Sure this place is always busy and loud, sometimes the service slow but it is  what it is. We enjoyed their awesome bread as we waited for our entree&#39;s. I love their Bang Bang chicken and shrimp, fish tacos are good too. . Left feeling full and satisfied. Will definitely come back.

We decided to have our Christmas Eve dinner here with my wife daughter and mother.  I made a reservation through help for 6:15 and was sat around 6:25 it was extremely busy so no issue there.  We we sat and promptly had our server greet us and get drinks going. We tried to order the sweet and sour cauliflower but they were out so I settled on edamame which was very good and my wife and mother enjoyed the Brussel sprouts. We then ordered mains.  I had the honey truffle chicken which was perfect very juicy and flavorful. However my side of broccoli was very cold ( the server promptly replaced it with a hot one when I asked ). My wife also had chicken and it to was fantastic. My mother had the shepherds pie and loved it however she did say it&#39;s definitely not a traditional shepherds pie.  We can&#39;t come into Cheesecake Factory and not have cheesecake so we each ordered a slice to go and enjoyed them at home.  We ordered the salted caramel, mango key lime, and the chocolate all of which were great.  Overall I enjoyed it aside from the cold broccoli the service was fantastic.  I do need to note that it was uncomfortably warm where we were seated and that definitely wasn&#39;t fun. This place is great if you want good food and a standard chain restaurant experience.  I would come back but definitely on a much quieter evening when it&#39;s not so warm in the seating area.

I love The Cheesecake Factory but this location never fails to provide a disappointing experience. I just stopped by for a late lunch today and everything just seemed to be a little &#34;off.&#34; First, it was close to 2 pm and there were two dozen customers just hanging out in the lobby waiting to be seated in the nearly empty restaurant. Never a good sign. I promptly approached the hostess stand and the hostess was very short tempered and actually quite rude when asking, exasperated and with a loud sigh, &#34;how many?&#34; I told her two, and she literally snapped back &#34;give me 10 minutes okay?&#34; Um, wow, if you are having such a bad day, maybe you need to go take a little break and chill out. That&#39;s a surefire way to run off customers. <br><br>We were seated and finally approached by our server, and she too seemed to be really annoyed like she really, REALLY hated her job. She wasn&#39;t even remotely pleasant. I&#39;ve rarely had servers that are so unhappy and unpleasant; it was so noticeable that we almost got up to leave, but we were so hungry (and I was craving avocado egg rolls) so we opted to stay. <br><br>The appetizer was good, but was haphazardly flung on our table by some other waiter. When our lunches arrived almost 20 minutes later, the plates were messy and carelessly thrown together. Talk about unappetizing. A kitchen should always take great pride in presenting a pretty dish, but both of our plates were as sloppy as they come. I had asked for sauteed spinach instead of mashed potatoes with my herb crusted chicken dish, and I was served a handful of RAW spinach just slapped on my plate! What? I had to ask for sauteed spinach and of course our waitress was annoyed but come on, RAW spinach? The vegetables were all poorly cooked, from my minuscule portion of green beans to my husband&#39;s barely steamed asparagus. I think the cooks on duty need to be trained on how to properly prepare veggies, stat!<br><br>Even worse, my chicken was SO rubbery, to the point where I had to get a steak knife just to cut it and I nearly wore out my jaw trying to chew it. I am not exaggerating. I know I should&#39;ve sent it back to the kitchen but at this point I was just so hungry and wanted to be done with this disappointing meal. <br><br>I never, ever complain about dining experiences but I feel like folks need to be aware of the problems at this location. Maybe corporate will take notice? This location needs some serious help!

We were so excited to try for the first time and support them during hard times. We order curbside pickup. We arrived and parked in the designated area. Called about 6 times to let them know we arrived, per the instructions given. No answer. After 20 minutes someone approached us and took our name. They brought our food later on. I checked the bag briefly and it seemed everything was there. My fault for not thoroughly opening every container. There were multiple add-ons that were missing and the food was cold. For what we spent, I was incredibly disappointed. I could&#39;ve got better food elsewhere for half the price.
We love the appetizers.   We go late in the evening, when there is no wait, and enjoy a late night snack.

A good restaurant. Nothing to write home about. And not even the best of the Cheesecake Factories. It is a little over-priced and the wait is always horrendously long. the food is good, don&#39;t get me wrong, but just not worth the price and hassel. Its also not food you can&#39;t get anywhere else. It&#39;s very busy and very loud, so I would not recommend going here if you are celebrating or wanting to have a conversation with the people you are eating with. <br><br>We have always been greeted by great customer service, which is nice!

I placed an order via Door Dash.  Food came hot and ready in a timely manner.  Part of my order was fried food stuffed with chicken and several of the pieces didn&#39;t have any meat in them so it was just fried batter.  I love CF and have never had this problem, but when I saw this I definitely felt like I overpaid because I didn&#39;t eat that food.

Absolutely amazing place, food is fresh and tastes great. So many options to choose from, even gluten free(which my wife greatly appreciated). I would recommend calling for a reservation because it can get busy quick. Great atmosphere and the service is awesome. Food is a bit expensive, but it&#39;s worth it. My family and I would recommend this place to anyone. We will definitely be returning.
They have THEE best chipotle chicken pasta. I could eat it for every meal! The wait staff is kind and efficient. And um  hi, who could say no to Oreo cheesecake? NO ONE!

I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factory restaurants in different cities and this one lives to the standard. Definitely a good place for brunch and awesome choice for dessert. I tried Benedict for brunch and beef for dinner. Both have good portion and are of high quality.<br>I also like its cocktails! George&#39;s peach (cocktail) is icy and fruity.

This is easily one of our favorite places to eat. It&#39;s just fancy enough that it&#39;s a special occasion, but you don&#39;t have to get dressed up to go. It&#39;s always busy, but it&#39;s worth the wait - the food is incredible. We always have great service, and the wait for the food itself is never bad. We love the Chicken Parmesan &#34;Pizza Style&#34;, and there are more than enough options to please anybody, both on the dinner menu and for dessert. Open up a few more locations in Utah already!

We came here yesterday to celebrate a birthday and we were not disappointed. This was my first time sitting down for a meal here and I have to say that I like the ambiance and how professional the waiters are. The food and service was great! Fantastic drinks as well! There was a little bit of a wait for our drink refills, but it was very busy, so I understand. The food came out quickly and the staff was very enthusiastic in helping us celebrate our special occasion! Thank you!
Followed up using the link and instructions provided in the feedback and no one from the Cheesecake Factory ever got back to me.

This is just like all other Cheesecake Factory locations. If you are going at normal dinner times expect a long wait which isn&#39;t out of the ordinary. The food was good. Our problem was once we sat it took forever to just get our orders in. Then took quite a while to get the food. Then when we asked for the check that took about 15 minutes. I understand the food taking a while but 15 minutes to print my check was a bit ridiculous. Overall it is a time thing that makes me give this place a lower rating.

I&#39;ll start this off by saying, beware food poisoning ahead. But I&#39;ll get to that later. <br><br>This is definitely not the best Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. Actually it is the worst one I&#39;ve been to. Sure, there is a decent crowd and the food is warm. Well the plates are hot for sure. Maybe because they keep it on warmers forever.<br><br>We waited 45 minutes for a seat. The front desk lady was more interested in her phone than helping us. Strange considering the place was packed and probably plenty of things she could be doing. I tried to joke with her about the wait, but she want having that either. That should have been my cue to turn my family around. <br><br>We were seated an hour later, close to 45 minutes, not quite. It appears most people were ordering takeout. I suppose they already were aware of the horrible dining experience. <br><br>Our server was nice enough, she seemed quite busy and ready to get on to the next table. It took about 30 minutes to get our drinks and appetizers -  the buffalo blasts. They were alright, but probably suspect of the food poisoning. Its hard to be certain. <br><br>Our food came out an hour later. Two of our kids took a few bites and didn&#39;t finish their meals. I tried their food and it wasn&#39;t pleasant. Overcooked and hard corndogs. Under cooked pasta. I did this because my meal didnt come out with everyone else&#39;s. I actually got my steak 30 minutes later, when I encouraged everyone to order dessert. I also tried my wife&#39;s salmon. The edges were burnt and the whole fillet overcooked. Sad sad sad. <br><br>Our server did apologize about my food coming out late, blaming another waiter for taking my plate to another customer. Swell! It didnt take away from the fact that I was still eating while she brought out the doggie bags. <br><br>Later, my wife suffered from extreme food poisoning, waking up at night with violent vomiting. It was fish or chicken, I don&#39;t know which one did it. I ate some of both and was fine. <br><br>Although we&#39;ve enjoyed many a CF dining experiences in California, this particular establishment was the worst. I won&#39;t be coming back even if they try to offer me some gift card. Their customer care department did not even reply to my complaint.
It&#39;s fine. There&#39;s always a wait, the restaurant is loud, and the food is fine. I always feel like I should have gone somewhere else.

The service here is always amazing! Food is great here. There&#39;s soo many options to pick from. My favorite is the Hibachi Steak, Avocado Eggrolls and Strawberry Shortcake desert! Hibachi steak is soft and tender with a unique seasoning and a taste of wasabi mixed in.
Food was good but the waitress wasn&#39;t good at all. Forgot to put down orders and couldn&#39;t remember anything

Amazing service, my waitress specifically was probably the nicest I&#39;ve ever had. Sat quickly. Four Starr&#39;s because the menu is just too big, and the portions were insanely huge. Food tasted great, but I was full with less than half the amount. Overheard the table next to me saying the same things I was thinking at the time. Cheesecakes are as great as ever.
Meh. I love Beyond Meat and Impossible Burgers but they managed to ruin it..my burger was dry, disappointing. And it is too expensive for what you get. The service was average.
How can you go wrong with this place.  The cheesecake is always great and the large menu always keeps me happy with my food choices.  Never a bad meal here.

Service at this location is always good. I enjoy coming here more than the City creek location because it&#39;s guaranteed that food is good and servers are always pretty friendly :) My go to&#39;s are the Fried Calamari &amp; Thai Coconut Chicken.

I love the Cheesecake Factory!!!!! I&#39;ve been coming here for years.  They always have delicious food and a nice variety to choose from as well.  Their cheesecakes are so yummy that my family buys a whole cake for the holidays to enough after our festive meals.

I love this restaurant and come here often because I work in the mall. Today was different, my boyfriend called in the order and they said it would be ready in 25 minutes, after driving 30 minutes to the restaurant (which should have been plenty of time), and never receiving a text that the order was ready we pulled up to the curb and were asked if we received a test and the man working didn&#39;t even bother to check to see if it was done. Instead he told us to park and wait for a text, finally we waited another 20 minutes and called the restaurant and they said we could pull up to the curbside pickup. After waiting a few more minutes we were greeted and then asked for our payment, and the food was brought out 1 hour after we originally called. I wasn&#39;t going to leave a review but when I opened my food it was completely cold, and definitely had been sitting for a while. Going to the mall food court would have been a better option by far. Not worth my time or money.
Decent food, definitely heavy on the oils/fats, bit pricey but they&#39;ve got a consistent quality of food &amp; service

Wow 90 minute wait.  The line just to put your name in was out the door. Get smart and open another Cheesecake down South.<br><br>You want me to come in the morning??? We work AND it was for a family birthday <br><br>Seriously come in earlier???? We came at 6 pm
delicious choses of cheesecake to choose from and each slice is large <br>best cheesecake i have ever eaten yummy!!!

Always crowded, the food is okay, and the service is slow. <br><br>I waited about 20 minutes on a weeknight to be seated. The restaurant was full and dim, so not my type of ambiance. I ordered the alfredo and it took another 10-15 minutes before it was served. The pasta was just okay, a little bland for my taste. I came mainly for the chocolate mousse cheesecake but took it to-go to enjoy my cheesecake in peace. <br><br>If you&#39;re here for the cheesecake, I&#39;d recommend takeout. If you&#39;re here for the food, then good luck waiting.
Nice atmosphere and really good food. Also the service was fantastic. I&#39;ll be a regular for sure.
Excellent food! Had the most amazing pineapple mojito here, very sweet but absolutely delicious!!!! Fast, courteous staff make it worth going over and over again.

Favorite place to eat!!!! Anything you&#39;re in the mood for they have!!! I wish they did have more seating but other than that it&#39;s such a fun vibe and usually the service is pretty good! But we go for the food!!!!

Such good food, every time. It&#39;s always busy, but the staff is usually pretty friendly and good at keeping up. I recommend bringing a hoodie or sweater, jacket or coat. It&#39;s FREEZING in there. Look around and you&#39;ll see everyone else is cold and trying to cover up with napkins lol. It&#39;s the coldest restaurant I&#39;ve ever been to. That&#39;s the only reason I won&#39;t give them five stars because it is consistently freezing every single time we go there.

Pretty good food and although the prices are somewhat high, the portions are large. The cheesecake is excellent. It can get crowded and noisy when it is busy (which is most always) but have never had a problem with service. Best time to go is early in the day.

Casey the manager is a dick I complained about an omlet and he laughed at me. Worst Cheesecake ever. My waitress was nice, there was a problem with breakfast and the manager came and was an asshole. I have only had problems with Cheesecake factories in Utah, I would avoid them at all cost. Not a good dining experience.

Super busy most likely due to the BigBang Theory. There food would be great if only they had time to cook it right. It is too expensive for the quality of food you receive. Most of the servers I have encountered the several times I have decided to eat here we not engaging and caring about weather you had good service or liked the food or service. I hope they step up their game if I decide to eat there again,

If I could give less stars I would. The most disorganized place I have ever seen with a layout that makes it even worse. My anxiety was through the roof the entire time. <br><br> I love the cheesecake factory, and the downtown location has been a place I go with my sisters every year on my birthday. <br><br>I recently moved to Murray from Ogden and was excited to live closer to a Cheesecake Factory. Nope. Do Not go to this location, if you want CF drive to the downtown location. Or if you want a night out go two stores north and eat at Brio. It&#39;s more expensive but you want want to strangle someone while you&#39;re there.<br><br>This location is INSANELY disorganized. The wait staff and crew are amazing and I&#39;m sure they are just as frustrated as we are. We called ahead and waited an hour in line for our food. we weren&#39;t even sure when were in the right line. or if there was a line. Some people were ordering, some had called in for pickup, and some had ordered online. (as an aside--the wait to be seated was 80 minutes) <br><br>After my boyfriend went to the front to ask where everybody should be she simply pointed and said &#34;the bakery&#34;. Not helpful. it would be a simple fix for them to add signage saying &#34;order here&#34; &#34;pick-up here&#34; and one that points to the hostess desk.

Worst customer service I&#39;ve ever seen. I get that things are not normal. I ordered a cheesecake and salad online. Went to pick up, and they are running an hour and a half behind. For cold items! The manager is shouting at customers. None of the employees are willing to help or answer questions. I can&#39;t even get someone&#39;s attention to tell them to cancel my order. At least give people a realistic time line of when orders will be ready. You will not create an angry mob of that had happened.

We had a good time eating at the Cheesecake Factory. The food was quite exceptional. Although it took awhile to be seated, I was surprised how shortly it took for the food to be made and given to us especially for the quality of food ordered. The customer service wasn&#39;t the best, I might add, and it was quite loud in the restaurant as well. I would compare the noise level to a Buffalo Wild Wings or any other kind of sports bar/grill. Overall, it&#39;s a good place to go to for quality food with big serving sizes just be prepared to unload the wallet.

Wanted to support one of our fav restaurants on Easter. Put our order online at 3:56 got a pickup time of 4:16. Got in line right away, an employee came out to our car to get my name and vehicle description. Got 1/2 our order around 4:20. Told them we were missing half the order and what we were missing. She said she would be back with the rest of our order. We waited 10 minutes and asked another employee and while trying to explain got rudely cut off and a sharp &#34;talk to the hand&#34; gesture basically telling me to quit talking. He assumed he knew what I was about to say and when he was wrong I had to restart and explain everything over again. He was very rude but said he would check. We waited another 15 minutes and while the food we had gotten has now been sitting and getting cold for 25 minutes!!! I had to get the attention of another employee and ask again to get the rest of our order. Finally after 40 minutes we got it. Drove the 10 minutes home. Sat down to eat and not only was the food cold but the portions were not what we are used to getting when we dine in and the quality of the food was poor. I even TIPPED! Which I regret but added that when I paid online so nothing I can do now. The only reason they deserve 1 Star is because the cheesecake was on point. We all came to the same conclusion that we would have rather saved the $90 we spent and went to a fast food joint and got much better food for 1/2 the price. My family will not be returning to support the Murray location during this quarantine and after this is over we may not ever go back unless the Cheesecake Factory makes this horrible experience right!

I ordered pork belly appetizer with fried pickle and coleslaw on it. I can see how this dish can be good but the fried pickle had fishy taste to it. I told our waiter and he did suggest maybe the cook used the same oil with the frying fish oil... made a face and walked away and did nothing to correct the situation.
