I spent $70 for two of us there and I expect my dish to be done right and service to fix the problem. He said he told the manager but nothing came of it. Really disappointing. Their quality has gone down more.

I understand the the pandemic has things a bit off but seems like these guys are using that for total disarray! We ordered through Door Dash and didn&#39;t get anything out of the ordinary just for the simple fact I DIDN&#39;T WANT PROBLEMS with our order. My wife ordered a Cheeseburger and Fries and I ordered an order of Wings with Fries. Plus 2 slices of Cheesecake. When the guy delivered to the order he indicated the restaurant indicated the order was not complete. They apparently were out of Wings so they just dropped of a Cheeseburger! If they can&#39;t fulfill the order I get it but I couldn&#39;t believe they didn&#39;t have the common sense to call me and let me choose a different item they just ignored half our order. With all of this going on I like to make sure I tip the drivers at least 30% to 40% as I know times are tough my original bill was 64.00 and I left a $20 tip for the driver when I ordered. Half my order was missing but the $20 is still on the tip for the driver. It wasn&#39;t his fault but he got a $20 tip on a $43 order after my my portion that didn&#39;t show up was deducted. If your sitting in a restaurant and they don&#39;t have half your order the waitress will come over and ask for you to pick another item right? You call in an order with these guys and they don&#39;t have it they simply just ignore your request without contacting you to have the chance to eat.<br>Personally I&#39;ve always thought this place was completely overrated! they won&#39;t ever see me back! Complete JOKE!

Here&#39;s the deal... The Cheesecake Factory is a chain restaurant and although I typically try to stick to smaller, local joints, I LOVE eating here. It&#39;s just a classic chain choice. The menu options can be overwhelming but if you know what to get ahead of time, you won&#39;t be disappointed. That&#39;s why I&#39;m here to tell you what to get! The avocado egg rolls are a MUST when it comes to appetizers and I love the Thai lettuce wraps as a meal (even though they are listed as an appetizer). The orange chicken is also a hit but make sure you ask for extra sauce since the chicken can sometimes be a little dry. If you&#39;re wanting something heavier, the Louisiana Chicken Pasta is also delicious if you are wanting something heavier. <br><br>The pros: HUGE portions, warm bread before your meal, lots of items to choose from and TONS of yummy dessert options, duh!<br><br>The cons: dark, loud, and the menu options can be overwhelming, a little pricier than other chain restaurants.<br><br>And most importantly, you can&#39;t go wrong with any of their cheesecake flavors (especially any peanut butter / chocolate combo).
I took my spouse here for a date and it was excellent! We got the herb crusted salmon and steak....so bomb! They are expensive so be prepared for that bill.
Food was great, cheesecake amazing, price was a little high. Took 30 min to get our drink from the bar on a slow night. Been there serval times, will go back again.

Cheesecake Factory has a spot in my heart.. or shall I say stomach haha. They have such a huge menu that is the same no matter where you go. One problem with that is that it can&#39;t be all delicious when you have such a large menu, but I have a few favorites that I love and can count on. Their cheesecakes are delicious too! So good - everyone of them! Customer service has always been good here.<br><br>Like all Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, there is always a ridiculously long wait time - especially at this one! Everyone and their moms come and eat dinner here haha so allow time, or you will find yourself walking around the mall or going somewhere else!

Typical Cheesecake Factory fare but the service is consistently bad. Slow to get food. Ridiculous waits for a table. Sarcastic waitstaff. Floors are so slick you can barely walk on them, not sure if it&#39;s dust and dirt or poor flooring choices. Head downtown if you have to have their food or cheesecake.

We ordered dinner online arlund 5:20 pm and were given a pick up time of 6:15. We waited for a text to come and by 6:45 went to the door to make sure we weren&#39;t missing something. We were told that they were 1.5-2 hours behind on the originally quoted pick up times. . Our food was ready at 8:15 pm. Whenever someone went to the door, the woman was screaming about how people just need to wait for their texts and how they got too many orders at one time. I understand that we are all trying to figure out how to do this. But we recently had a DoorDash cancel our cheesecake order 1.5 hours later as well because of this. At this point, maybe Cheesecake Factory shouldn&#39;t be taking all of these orders, or adjust the pick up times accordingly?? We are officially done with this restaurant option.

Absolutely awful service here. We ordered two pastas, a milkshake, cheeseburger meal and an appetizer. Everything took so long to bring out, and our server was barely ever here to attend to us at our table. My brother was excited to receive his milkshake, only to be told later when we had our food that &#34;somebody&#34; was supposed to let us know a while ago that they did not have ice cream in stock to make the milkshake. Would&#39;ve been nice to know after we had originally ordered. We brushed it off and continued with our meal but anytime we needed anything we had to look around for our waitress. There was a table next to us who received their food earlier than we did as well, even though we arrived around 15-20 minutes before they did. we only saw our waitress around three or four times during our meal. We had to go inside the restaurant, we were seated outside, to flag her down and grab our check. Absolutely awful service. <br>The food was very lackluster as well with this visit. They don&#39;t serve normal Parmesan cheese apparently only the powdered version. I would not recommend this location.

Made a reservation through Yelp for brunch.  We showed up a little early and only had to wait a few minutes to get seated. Our brunch meal was great.  Of course as full as we were we still have to have dessert...so topped it off by splitting a piece of salted caramel cheesecake.

We made a reservation through cheesecake factory and yelp! Perfect for Friday night! They were on time with our reservation and the food was delicious as always! We will definitely be going back! We also had an amazing server!

SOOO BUMMED. ‍<br>We drove up from Provo for our first Mother&#39;s Day celebration with our 2 week old baby. Thinking we would have as quick &amp; satisfying of service as our City Creek experience we were mistaken... <br>We arrived promptly @ 5:00, perfectly on time since we had placed our order online much earlier that day in prep, pulled up to the To-Go parking space (Although we had to guess where to park bc there was SO much going on w signs &amp; lines...) <br>&amp; were greeted, they took our name &amp; our money &amp; we assumed our food would follow... <br>45 min &amp; 20+ cars served before us despite arriving after us... we received our food &amp; still had to request our drink.<br>Keep in mind, we had a fussy hungry newborn waiting to be fed bc what we thought would be a 10 min experience reached almost an hour. <br>Anyways, we drive 5 min away to the Murray Park for what we think can still be a great picnic until we open our food &amp; realize not only is it room temp, soggy, &amp; our ice cream melted out of the container into the bag BUT we also noticed our food was prepared @ 4:15.... AKA it could have been sitting out for almost 2 hours before we had the chance to enjoy it... <br>If you couldn&#39;t guess, we only had a few bites &amp; were left with awful stomachaches. <br>You might ask why we didn&#39;t run back &amp; complain, trust me, if you saw the chaos you wouldn&#39;t go back either! ‍
Delicious food and great service every time! It&#39;s a bit pricy but worth it every now and then.
They take absolutely ten years literally ten years to get my take out order said it was ready at 7 and it&#39;s 8 just sitting waiting forever for half decent food is bs

Love coming here. Closest Cheesecake Factory in Utah county. The staff is always friendly, wait times are fair. <br><br>The good is incredible. Today I had the salmon and it was cooked to perfection.  Was juicy, had the right amount of crisp to it and the lemon perfected the meal. <br><br>I ordered the side of asparagus as always because it comes out cooked perfect!  <br><br>Our service is always top notch and love coming her in special occasions.

The wait here is always ridiculous but it is worth the wait! The food portions are always huge and it&#39;s prepared very well. I ordered the spinach dip which was not the most dip but was really good. Would definite recommend it as a starter. Then I got to try the hibachi steak and louisiana chicken pasta. The pasta has a good kick so be aware of that. The hibachi steak had a nice asian taste to it and the potatoes came with a wasabi like butter. Service is on point and they were very friendly.

Cheesecake Factory is one of our favorite places to eat.   We always enjoy the different varietys of food we can choose from.  On this visit, we ordered Orange Chicken with White Rice ~ Good choice.  And the Skinnylicious Salmon loaded with veggies!!  Delicious!  For dessert we ordered Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake, so rich,  creamy,  and delicious.   Our waiter was Isaiah T.  He was attentive, refilled our waters, engaged in short and great conversation,  and made great dessert suggestions.   (We&#39;re taking home the Oreo Cheesecake :) )
The food is good, but overpriced. And it&#39;s always WAY too loud there; you have to shout at the person across the table in the same booth just to be heard.

Unbelievable poor service. Took an hour and a half to get overcooked cold steak and cold mashed potatoes. Ordered shrimp scampi and got shrimp Alfredo. Avoid this overpriced dinner and stick with something local. Even the French fries for my son&#39;s burger were cold. Horrible

Salmon lunch was delicious, portion was generous, but a bit pricey for lunch. <br>We got there at 4 PM received our drinks quickly, however the coffee I was served was cold and had to wait for a new pot to be brewed. Also we were told that bread was in the oven and would be 10 minutes. We received our meals, no bread. We leisurely ate our meals and the bread finally arrived when I was on my last bite of salmon. Very poor planning on their part.

The personal that works at the pick up area are really rude, this is the second time that I pick an order and they answer no polite. I went today to pick a Caesar salad and ask for silverware, the blonde hair lady told rudely that it was inside de bread bag

The food was great! The service was great!  I made a reservation for 9 pm through Yelp because I have a horrible back and can&#39;t wait around for an hour. Got there 20 minutes before 9 just to be safe. Ended up waiting until 9:30 to be seated anyway!  So that was dumb and PAINFUL!  But other than that... LOVE THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY!!

I love the Cheesecake Factory! I love the food! I love the cheesecake! I always get the shepherds pie. I look at the menu, get frustrated because it is SO big and then I go for what I know I&#39;ll like. One day I&#39;ll just open the menu, point at something and order it. Until then, I&#39;ll play it safe.
Always busy and I really wish they would take reservations.   However their food is outstanding and I try to choose non-busy times so that I can enjoy their delicious food.
This place was so good! I really recommend going here. But be prepared to spend money here. But they give you big proportions on your plate. I loved it!

New Year&#39;s weekend is over now, so you know that can&#39;t be their excuse. We dine here often, so this must be an isolated issue. The restaurant wasn&#39;t particularly crowded today, besides that they can handle huge crowds at cheesecake factory.  So here are my observations:<br><br>1.  Service was slow. It took an unusually long time before we got our main course and again a long time before we got our dessert. It even took a long time to get the bill.<br><br>2.  They were out of the desert we ordered, they offered substitutions, we accepted a substitution; however, they made no concessions in terms of a discount on our dessert or on our meal.<br><br>3.  At The server&#39;s suggestion, we ordered the dinner special and found the portion to be much smaller than the usual main course portions. As I&#39;ve mentioned in prior reviews, their portions are typically big enough for two people to split.<br><br>I&#39;m sure we&#39;ll give the cheesecake factory another try because the food is consistently good, but we&#39;re not heading over there for dinner anytime soon.<br><br>Salute!

This place is still going strong but we walked right in for lunch today.  Our server was awesome, didn&#39;t catch his name.  Bread came out fast with drinks.  I just always go with Rene&#39;s special.  It has a salad, the soup, and half a sandwich for $13, well worth it!  Wednesdays they serve mushroom soup and its the best!  Hearty and tasty.  The ranch dressing here is also phenomenal.  I know the cheesecake here is what to order but calling all my carrot cake peeps, the best! here! i know!  Why a 3 u say?  Always busy, bustling, and left wanting.  Service is hit and miss.  Food is usually, inconsistently, good.
No doubt that this is a BIG 5 Star Restaurant !<br>The food was Great <br>The Service was Great <br>It turned out to be a Fantastic evening !<br>Thanks <br>Carl B

The one thing I have noticed at Cheesecake Factory is they are super consistent from location to location. I&#39;ve eaten at them in a lot of different states and locations. <br>My wife is a big fan, as are many of my friends. I just don&#39;t get what they all love about the place. They do have a big menu with a lot of variety. While they are ok, there food is nothing that great. However they do have a great chocolate cake and a lot of different cheesecakes.<br>They seem over priced for the kind of restaurant they are, however they are always clean and I have never had an issue with their service.
We did take out tonight and we stood in line for an hour just to get our food and it was cold by the time we got it home. They need more help.
Don&#39;t expect to get a table in under an hour--  even on a Tuesday. Not worth the wait.

Seemed like the place was owned by vampires.  We couldn&#39;t see anything. Specially our over cooked steaks. Service was great just wish the food would match it. Isaiah was nice, acomodating, and on point with everything. But maybe light the place up a little bit. We couldn&#39;t even see what food was what and had to use our phones as flashlights.
Great food! It&#39;s busy and the waits are long, but worth shopping at the mall to eat delicious variety of food. Service is always great and cheesecake is a perfect ending!
Always rude slow service. Always overly expensive microwaved food. Cheesecake is way too sweet, distractingly disgustingly sweet. I can&#39;t figure out why this place is always busy.

Love the wide varieties of options of meals, drinks and the fresh free bread served. It is pretty hard not to have a good time here because I feel like there is going to be an option will make your day. Servers usually is good but the hostess can be hit and missed. Overall, love the experience here, will for sure go back

I got takeout from this location. This is the only one near me and it&#39;s not close. I got the chicken pasta carbonara. Let me tell you, I&#39;m not sure who cooked this, but they need to know how. The pasta was dry and chewy. There was a dab of sauce on it. There was like 3 tiny pieces of chicken and a bite size worth of bacon. I should have checked this before I paid for it. This is my favorite dish and I was highly disappointed. I got bread with it and it was very hard. The only reason I gave this two stars was the Godiva cheesecake. Can&#39;t mess that up when they aren&#39;t making it from scratch.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been one of my favorite places to be at. So we had a large group last night so the service was good for such a busy table. Honestly, I usually get the same thing but it&#39;s always good hahah! The enchiladas are always so amazing. I just love the food here in general. Including the bread that they usually have. Personally I like the brown one lol. We got the nacho appetizer this time and that was amazing. The cheese and portion was perfect. I always love the portions, flavor and price here. Cheesecake Factory is a go to.

I have never had a bad experience whether in SF, SLC or San Jose. I don&#39;t recall ever making a reservation but they do have a buzzer system that works from far away.<br><br>My favorite time to go is on Sundays for brunch. Also if you read the first page on their menu you get a sense of their humble beginnings.<br><br>American classics are offered with a twist. Prices range from $7 for kids to $13 for adults.<br><br>They have alcohol (bloody Mary, mimosa) and They also have ethic specialties like plantains, southern fried chicken or fish and Italian.<br><br>They menu is large but I love trying new things and having options at different price points.<br><br>Consistently good food, great staff, and dessert.

Ok, so I have been going to the The Cheesecake Factory since I can remember. Growing up near several in Southern California gave me the opportunity to watch the restaurant grow and evolve. This Cheesecake is a great example of what it has become. <br><br>While the wait always seems to be long at this location, the staff is pretty welcoming and there is a good of space to sit inside, or you can wonder over to Z Gallery (another review coming). I love how the indoor seating has a nicely located cheesecake display, giving you the opportunity to decide what cake you want, before you indulge in bread and giant sized portions. <br><br>The restaurants design is very similar to most other Cheesecakes I have been in, with the exception of the bar area (that&#39;s a whole other story though). The seating comfortable and spread out. Tables are large, as they have to be for the ginormous plates. <br><br>Service is very structure and always seems to be by the book. I am always impressed with the team work atmosphere of the staff. You never feel like you are being ignored. <br><br>The food is always pretty consistent. I have never had an item that deviated greatly from the norm. While it is not exceptional, it is always good. The menu offer more then enough options to satisfy a small army, let alone your family. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has changed over the years, but it seems to have found its place and is staying there for the time being. If you want a lot choices and big portions, and willing to wait for a table, you have found your place.

Usually a wait to get in, but this is one of those restaurants that are worth the wait!  Their menu is extensive!  We have always experienced great service.  The decor is awesome.  Prices are in line with this type of restaurant.  I have tried several different selections and all have been excellent.  Don&#39;t forget to try some cheesecake!

Will never come back to this location.<br>I visited this restaurant with two friends on Tuesday.  It was not busy at all.  The service was poor.  Our server handed us our menus and in less than a minute came to take our orders &amp; he got annoyed that we needed more time.  Excuse me, the menu is 15+ pages long - hello?!?!  He had an attitude, did not EVER bring us refills on our beverages, &amp; wanted to rush us out.  This has happened twice to me in this location.  Never again!!! I recommend you go to the City Creek location - the people there are friendly, prompt, &amp; actually work instead of socializing with other workers.

Stopped in here for a quick coffee. Caramel Royal Machiatto. Which is a double espresso, hot caramel, vanilla and steamed milk. As usual my coffee was on point. A good pick me up with a touch of sweetness satisfaction. I was tempted to get some cheesecake, but I had to have some self control. Staff is friendly and funny. I&#39;ll definitely be back

I have just been here for my first time. The cheesecake is wonderful.  The food is not.  Had the lunch size chicken piccatta. It just didn&#39;t have a lot of flavor. The portion just for a lunch size was large so I can&#39;t imagine the regular size.<br><br>It needed seasoning desperately and didn&#39;t have any type of lemon flavor. <br>My friend had a tasteless Turkey club. She found it to be just s lacking.  Their soup, from a pre-made base soup and not scratch, was pretty good but nothing to go there for.<br><br>One of our margaritas had been dipped in sugar and we had to wait most of the meal for a server to stop and check on is to get it corrected.<br><br>The only thing I liked was the cheesecake (chocolate mousse)but it wasn&#39;t worth the rest.<br><br>Certainly not good enough on any level to warrant going back.

The food is way over priced and nothing special. I got the Cajun pasta and it was disappointing. There was the Cajun spice, but no taste to  it. It&#39;s loud and crowded. The service was great though!

I am not the biggest fan of their entrees, but the appetizers and brunch in amazing. Brunch is always amazing and many options for appetizers. <br><br>The cheesecake and staff is the best part about this restaurant. The staff is friendly and always doing their best. The cheesecake is also amazing. If you go here, go for the cheesecake.  <br><br>Only one flaw: The lighting is very dark. I had to use a flashlight to read the menu. I suggest going during daylight. <br><br>I will definitely be returning! Staff is great, brunch, appetizers, and cheesecake is amazing! I recommend this place for families. plates are big and the atmosphere is great!
Food very plain service seemed obliged and robotic... perhaps good for those people whom want to talk about feelings and the such
My only complaint is that this location is so busy and popular that you sometimes have to wait an extremely long time for a table and they won&#39;t take reservations.
Great place! Need working on the long waiting process though! Great people who work there and they are very responsible and respectful.

I have been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory for years and I was glad that they finally made their way to Utah. My wife is a fan of their chicken piccata. I know it&#39;s a simple dish but they do a really good job with the lemon sauce with capers. I like their kobe burger and the smoke house BBQ burger but I normally go with their lunch pizza (margarita) and salad. I have tried a lot from their menu by try to save room for a cheesecake. I haven&#39;t had a bad cheesecake yet or one that I wouldn&#39;t order again. Tonight we came in for desert and have their newly updated recipe for carrot cake and I got the Dutch apple caramel streusel. Wow, both were really good. The service has always been great here and Holly tonight was no exception, she did great. And that goes for any Cheesecake Factory that I have ever gone to, the service makes or breaks the dinning experience . The only reason I am give them three stars is for the fact that this has to be one of the smallest and loudest of their restaurants that I have been to. Maybe they didn&#39;t think they would be as big as they are in Murray, Utah? The other restaurant in salt lake is a pretty good sized restaurant. But still, it&#39;s one of my favorite restaurants to go to. <br><br>09/17/2017<br>Today we came for the brunch and I had their chicken and waffles with eggs Benedict and I&#39;m stuffed and didn&#39;t finish my plate. Everything was good except I wasn&#39;t a big fan of the maple syrup. It tasted like butterscotch, a bit too sweet for me. My better half had the skinny chicken pasta and she that was pretty good, it looked good. It almost made me feel guilty for having the chicken and waffles.

I&#39;ve been holding off this review for a long time. I&#39;ve been coming here for many years and I&#39;ve had mostly good experiences except for the long wait. The food is always excellent I highly recommend the chicken Madera not sure if I&#39;m spelling it right. But it is so good. I&#39;ve had many other things on the menu and they&#39;re good but this is the best.  <br><br>Candace also known as CJ has really great customer service she&#39;s really prompt. Same with Brian. Same with many other servers here. I&#39;ve always received excellent service.
Always good, the wait can be brutal. I suggest doing a little shopping while you wait. Wait times typically in excess of an hour

I love this place. Perfect for special occasions. It is having more GF options, and that is wonderful. I do wish that it would have more. Especially on the cheesecake. If there were more GF / allergy friendly items, this would be 5 stars for sure!

I know it was Christmas Eve but there must be a value on making a reservation or else you&#39;re a first come first serve. Unfortunately The Cheesecake Factory failed me and my family today. We made a reservation and checked in only to find they gave us a one hour wait to still get seated. Then, after waiting for an hour, they say it&#39;s  going to be another hour! My time is valuable! My family was starving and we didn&#39;t want to spend our Christmas Eve there! I do feel bad for the manager. She was getting complaints left and right.

This place if you haven&#39;t been here is a restaurant mostly famous for their different variety of cheesecakes. Even though their cheesecakes are wonderful their food here also if very good. The only problem with this place is that during the weekend the wait time is super long ESP if you have a large party of 6 or more. <br><br>Their food menu has a little bit of everything. They go from asian to southern food. I would recommend the gumbo or the mediera chicken. Those in my opinion are the best. This time I thought I would switch it up a bit and got the lemon herb chicken. It was good, and very flavorful, the only problem with it is that the lemon flavor over powers everything on it. Even my carrots and mash potatoes started to taste like lemon after a while. **disclaimer** the portion size here is huge...so if you are not a big eater and want dessert I would recommend eating half on your plate and then order cheesecake.<br><br>All in all this place is great. The servers are friendly, the food choices are huge, and their cheesecake is delicious.

They get 3 stars for their cheesecake and their BBQ chicken salad. Everything else is pretty bad. The menu is too big for them to do any of it well. I&#39;ve tried the pizza and a few chicken dishes. Unfortunately they are almost inedible. Stick to dessert and you&#39;ll be happy.
My go to place for cheesecake no matter what city I m in. I usually take the classic cheesecake or the tiramisu.

Cheesecake Factory is a affordable place to go to where you can enjoy beautifully plated items but not break the bank. I have been trying to get a chance to eat here but every time I come the wait is about 2 hours so I made sure to come around 3:00 pm so I was able to be seated quickly. If you come before 5:00 pm you can order off of their lunch specials menu which is a smaller version of their entrees, I also like that hey place the calories content next to the entrees. We ordered the fire fracker salmon for an appetizer, it was delicious and rolled in a thin wonton paper and sat on a miso sauce. I ordered the miso salmon with brown rice, the salmon was cooked perfectly and the lunch size was enough to keep me full. I&#39;ll admit I&#39;m not a cheese cake dessert fan but I&#39;m in love with their tiramisu cheese cake slice, it&#39;s a must if you are a fan of tiramisu.
Always bomb good, always bomb service!!!! Definitely one of my favorite places around!!!!!
The food is undeniable good and there is so much to choose from. But the noise is hard for me. But we have to go anyway because I love the red velvet cheesecake

The food was pretty good, as it usually is, however I was pretty bummed out that I paid 7 dollars to add shrimp to my salad for what ended up being a grand total of 3 shrimp. I know that restaurants usually skimp on shrimp in many dishes, but 3 shrimp added as a protein is a little bit of a joke, especially for so much money. The cheesecake was also delicious as always but it seems they&#39;ve cut their portion sizes on the cheesecake in half too, so I paid 8 dollars for a slice that was about an inch wide. <br>Overall pretty disappointed that I spent over 30 dollars here and am still hungry. I guess the fact that I ordered my deal for delivery allowed them to cut down on sizes without me being able to do or say anything right then. I will definitely remember this for the future and choose somewhere that&#39;s at least a little more worth the money next time.

Just had the best experience at Cheesecake Factory last night! Our server gabby was so awesome and gave us the best service she has the best recommendations even tho she said she was new and our Diet Coke was never less then full she was so awesome! We don&#39;t come to cheesecake often but she made us want to! She was great it was so busy but everything still came out so quick!
This location needs work. To go was very pushy and had alot of attitude . And everyone seems to be behind and in a rush.  Havent had a good experience here yet!
Fantastic cheesecake options. They are big portions. The meals are delicious. It&#39;s always crowded during the normal meal times. So either go early or prepare to wait. But it&#39;s worth the wait.

Boy do I love Cheesecake! I don&#39;t always like their menu, but their stuffed mushrooms and pasta are really great! And the cheesecake, oh the cheesecake! I love their cheesecake. Since we visited on Valentine&#39;s weekend, we just got some cheesecake to go with a gift card I had to spend, and ate the cheesecake the next day after our homemade dinner, totally holds up! <br><br>We also came here on our Wedding Anniversary and had great service! I enjoyed the Pasta with Chicken and Scampi sauce! Our waitress was very nice and very quick with refills and made sure to check in with us without being a pest. The tables are a bit too close together for our comfort, and we basically had to wait for the chatty girls next to us to leave before we could enjoy our own conversation, because they were very loud, and since the tables are so close together we couldn&#39;t enjoy our conversation, but their was quite interesting, I wonder if the one girl was ever able to get her boyfriend to propose LOL

All I can say is that this restaurant should be called the Avocado Egg Roll Restaurant!   That is why I come here!!!!  The rest of the food is great too. But it&#39;s the egg rolls that bring me back!   I don&#39;t even love cheesecake in general so I hardly ever get dessert there. But I always leave stuffed full of deliciousness!  My only complaint is that they are so busy in the evenings that it takes forever to get seated. And they don&#39;t take reservations.

Food is delicious as always. I just wish our server could have been more happy and just smile! It makes all the difference. People come out to eat for the experience. So it&#39;s crucial to have servers with a positive attitude to make it a good experience.
My all time favorite restaurant. Excellent choices, great service, and the ultimate desserts.

I&#39;m so mad about their Christmas Gift Card deal. They promised a piece of free cheesecake with each 25 dollar gift card purchased. I purchased two gift cards and selected to receive them in the mail vs electronically. To my surprise I only received one in the mail and zero free cheesecake coupons. I checked my emails to find Out that they sent one gift card electronically. Okay, weird but I could deal with that. The problem is that they didn&#39;t send any free cheesecake! When I email them about the problem the responded that my purchase date didn&#39;t fit within the dates required for the free cheesecake but when I bought the gift cards, that clearly was the promotion.  BEWARE OF FALSE ADVERTISING

My least favorite cheesecake factory ever. Waited an hour for a table. Husbands food was really late. Like after everyone was done eating late. We were celebrating my daughter&#39;s 12th birthday. I had to remind them to sing Happy birthday twice before she actually got her co workers and brought a candle. Super frustrating.

This was based on Saturday June 22nd 2019 from 5:15 pm to 7pm Obviously the cheesecake was to die for! Which why there will be any stars. But oh my hell. The service was awful. Our waitress didn&#39;t ID check anyone (ages 20,25 and 26) she only stopped at our table when we flagged her down. She threw a basket of bread at the table. Slammed a drink and got it all I&#39;ve done of us. After complaining we got the manager, Casey, as our waiter. Which we were hoping would be a better experience. But he was condescending and didn&#39;t even seem like the girl did anything wrong. He did ID check and as he was doing it he said &#34;what we really should check is the weight box&#34; umm excuse me? What MANAGER says that to a woman. Then when we asked about if our gratuity would go to him he said &#34;I don&#39;t need your money. I&#39;m salary&#34; <br><br>We were so excited for a girl birthday dinner. And this was a horrible experience. I will never go back. And I will make sure I tell everyone about the poor wait staff, management and failure to ID check.

Not too pleased if you will, somehow a half filled piña colada drink, mac cheese balls(small plate), and a half filling steak Diane ended up being nearly $50, cheesecake your lucky you have good customer service otherwise you would have gotten no stars

Went in the evening  and the lighting is horrible. Can&#39;t read your menu   Can&#39;t check out your table area for cleanliness because you can&#39;t see anything. Can&#39;t see your food when it arrives.  Too dark for such an upscale upper price restaurant. I&#39;ll stick with brio
Love this place!!!!!  Been here many times and I am always  waiting to come back!  The staff is great, food is great and of course the desserts are amazing!

Not a clean place. The food is very corporate in taste and quantity. Like other big corporate restaurants they can stand to hire quality teams for the existing menus and a creative team for new better tasting items!

Yummy!! I love their mango key lime cheesecake!! We enjoy it and I love it! We had that calamari for appetizer that was good too and the wait time was long but worth waiting for that cheesecake , so don&#39;t mind coming back and try something else

I have mixed feelings about this place. I enjoy it for what it is, but sometimes I really don&#39;t have the best experience when I try new things. I learned to stop trying different menu items and just stick with the three cheese pasta, or the spaghetti and meatballs. Those two dishes are very consistent and really good. You get large portions, and I&#39;m always full with leftovers.<br><br>Unfortunately, the steaks really aren&#39;t worth it (except Steak Diane, which is just okay). I had the filet mignon, and my wife had the ribeye. They were both mediocre, and I wouldn&#39;t order them again for the price we paid. It reminded me of a &#34;nicer&#34; Applebee&#39;s steak, which is the last place you should be getting steak from. They were cooked alright, but the meat was a bit stringy and tasted lower-quality (perhaps even lower grade) than other steaks in the area. Like mentioned above, neither of us have been overly impressed with any dish other than the pastas. Still, we find ourselves back there after shopping sometimes. <br><br>The waiters are friendly but usually a bit stiff due to how busy they are (being right next to the mall) we often don&#39;t get refills on drinks until it&#39;s too late, and the limited interactions we have with them feel rushed <br><br>The desserts aren&#39;t great unless you get cheesecake (go figure, it&#39;s in the name). I would skip dessert unless you&#39;re dying for cheesecake. Even then, there are way too many choices and I would advise sticking to tried and true flavors. I recently tried their chocolate layer cake, and it was dry and boring. <br><br>Despite other reviews, I love the dark ambience of this restaurant. To be honest, I think it makes the experience better, and a semi-romantic place to take a date or spouse. Basically, the darkness makes this restaurant seem way nicer than it actually is.<br><br>This is a great &#34;stepping stone&#34; if you&#39;re just getting into nicer restaurants, because it&#39;s pricier and better than, say, Applebee&#39;s, but won&#39;t completely break the bank. We eat here when we want pasta, but definitely not when we want to eat at a super nice restaurant. The menu is way too jumbled and confusing, and they need to cut out a lot of random dishes that I can&#39;t imagine a lot of people are ordering. <br><br>My biggest negative about this restaurant is that I feel like it hasn&#39;t figured out what it wants to be. Is it...an Italian restaurant? Is it...a nicely disguised diner? Is it a literal factory where they make black-market cheesecake, and the restaurant is just a clever attempt at distraction? We may never know.

Lettuce Wraps, Avocado Egg Rolls, Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes are my go-to-favorites. I&#39;ve branched out but tend to be happiest with these three. Menu choices can be a bit overwhelming for the first time - I would recommend looking it over prior to arrival so you don&#39;t feel overwhelmed making a choice. Raspberry lemon cheesecake is my favorite.
The food was not that great the cheese cake  wasn&#39;t that good it&#39;s very expensive too

Hands down without a doubt the WORST curbside pickup ever!  Order online.  Head to the restaurant to pick up the order.  Call the &#34;dedicated&#34; curbside number they tell me someone will be right out.  15 minutes later call the number again.  No answer!  Call one more time then end up going in to pick up the order that has been ready for over 40 minutes.  The worst customer service by far.

Food was good but I don&#39;t know why when there were only 20 people in the entire restaurant we all have to be seated damn near at the same table. We couldn&#39;t have a conversation because everyone was so close.

Waited 90 minutes to be seated (Saturday night, so not completely unexpected), then waited another 60 minutes AFTER being seated to get our food. Left us with less than 10 minutes to eat our food before we had to leave. 2.5+ hours of waiting vs 10 minutes to eat. I hate this place.<br><br>Our server apologized and said it was due to the restaurant recently adding DoorDash. Dumbest decision I&#39;ve heard of. Dozens of potential customers are already walking in the door every night and leaving because the wait is too long - and you just made it worse? For take out orders that are on avg. smaller and rarely tip, so your staff doesn&#39;t benefit? I hate his place.
Ehhhhhh as far as the food goes, this place was ok especially for the price. Now if we are talking just desserts and cheesecake then 5 stars it is

We ordered a cake more than 24 hours in advance. But when we arrived, they told us that they had run out of that cake and could not give us the cake we had preordered, so we had to settle for a cake different than my mom had selected for Mother&#39;s Day. We were offered no discount for a different cake and nothing to show for our missing cake.

The biggest problem with The Cheesecake Factory is the wait. Simply anticipate the wait and this is an excellent place to eat. The food is excellent. They give you a lot of food. The prices are reasonable. Obviously the cheesecake is the best. Get there early, get your name in, walk around the mall and come back when they ask.

It is worth mentioning that although almost everything I&#39;ve ever eaten here is good some of the foods are better than others.  If you&#39;re going, you need to try the avocado egg rolls at least once.  I get them every time I go and they never disappoint.  <br>It is a louder restaurant so if you&#39;re looking for quiet and romantic, don&#39;t go here.  It is a loud place and sometimes hard just to have a conversation at your table.  <br>All the food is reasonably priced and the service is on par.  <br>Never had a bad slice of cheesecake from here either.  <br>I would for sure recommend this place to friend and family.  Perfect for a casual or semi casual night out.
Awesome place. Great service and food. Staff is always super friendly and all the cheesecakes are delicious!!

Stood in line for 45 min to try to get a freaking table. There were people cutting in and out of the line. Way too packed and no organization. <br><br>Finally get to the front and it&#39;s a 2 hour wait for a party of 2. This place needs better management.

Wasn&#39;t as good as expected, everyone over hype Cheesecake Factory but in all reality it&#39;s over priced and awful lighting. The food wasn&#39;t tasteful and was a bit cold for my taste. Great desert

Let me first say this, NEVER go to Cheesecake Factory on  a non-weeknight. The weekend rush will ruin your night. We waited 1 hr 45 min for a table for TWO. Just two people. They told us originally the wait would be 1 hr 10 min. Also heads up, they do not take reservations on weekends. <br><br>Once seated, our server took a lengthy time in approaching us. However, when she did we immediately put in our order and she was back with drinks and bread in only a few minutes. Appetizers and our entree came out quickly, too! Which was a welcomed sight after our long wait. <br><br>We ordered the Avocado Egg Rolls. Pretty good, but they are absolutely MADE by the sweet dipping sauce they serve with the dish. Seriously, we almost ate it by the spoonful. <br><br>We ordered the Lemon Garlic Noodles. We added shrimp ($5 extra and they gave us probably 6 small, measly shrimp.) Next time just add chicken. It&#39;s cheaper. The noodles are spaghetti, but next time I&#39;d change it for angel hair. The thick noodle seemed odd without a marinara sauce. The garlic sauce is light and buttery. The dish was reminiscent of buttered noodles my mom would make me as a kid. The added asparagus, tomatoes and mushrooms were great. <br><br>We finished it off with a slice of their Pumpkin Cheesecake. Seasonal, so get it while it&#39;s hot! <br><br>Decent meal. C+

Hmmm....my recent visit to the Murray cheesecake factory, was not exactly amazing. <br><br>Pros: Large portions, amazing cheesecake and clean restrooms.<br><br>Cons: High prices, bad service and long wait times.<br><br>I am a huge fan of the cheesecake factory chains. Mostly because of the red velvet cheesecake. We arrived this evening around 10 pm (one of the few choices open at 10 pm for a full service meal). There was a 10 minute wait (which we found odd since it was 10 pm and there was no one in the lobby). Once we were seated, we waited 15 min to place our drink order. Our waiter &#34;forgot&#34; to bring out bread until after our appetizer was delivered to our table. <br><br>We ordered:<br><br>Pot stickers: Piping hot, crispy and seasoned to perfection! The sauce was addicting! I kept dipping my bread in the sauce. I would definitely order this again. The only con- they only give you 6 small dumplings. So, for the price of $10.95....you are paying for quality not quantity. <br><br>Chicken Madeira: This dish was so disappointing! Ice cold, lacking in flavor, gluey cheese and overcooked asparagus! <br>Disclaimer: We have ordered this dish before at another location and it was wonderful. <br>We complained to our waiter and expressed our concerns about the dish. He acted annoyed and told us he would get a manager and have it remade. The manager brought out the remake and seemed annoyed with us. She did not even apologize for the mistake. If you are going to pay $18+ for chicken, it should at least be hot! The new one had been microwaved for a few minutes (rubbery!). We basically filled up on bread and pot stickers and took our dessert to go. <br><br>BTW: We paid full price for everything, even though they took 25 minutes to replace a messed up item. <br><br>Lemon raspberry cheesecake: Out of all of the desserts I have tried at cheesecake factory, this one is by far the sweetest (tastes like pure sugar). I would not get this item again. <br><br>Craigs crazy carrot cake cheesecake: Very tasty and not too sweet! This carrot cake had a subtle sweetness and was moist! <br><br>Overall I wouldn&#39;t come back to this location. I was not impressed with the way they handled a complaint and the cold/overpriced food. If you have a hankering for cheesecake factory, hit the one in city creek downtown!<br><br>Fin&#39;

The manager was super friendly and Joe our waiter was kind and polite. He got all of our orders and drinks was good. I like how everyone treats us kindly. Plus the bread was super tasty. I like their elegant interior make it looks a mansion. The chicken nachos were super tasty as well. the steak is perfectly cooked to how i like it. Fries were tasty and the green beans were good too

Since we woke up late today we knew we would be too late to get Dim sum since the best time to go is right at 10:30am to avoid the long wait/line.<br><br>We ordered the eggs benedict with fresh spinach and bacon and grilled tomatoes. Then had the Brioche breakfast sandwich, and then the Brûléed french toast. <br><br>The eggs benedict weren&#39;t that great. the muffin was very soggy, the potatoes were deep fried and over cooked.  The Brioche breakfast sandwich wasn&#39;t bad, the bread was delicious and the eggs were cooked just right.  The best part was the Brûléed french toast. They were light and fluffy and had a nice syrup with it. They were dusted with powdered sugar.

The food here is consistent and good this is the one good thing this chain has going for itself.<br><br>The service at this location on the other hand needs some serious work as the manager and the servers seem to not pay a lot of attention to alterations of items due to multiple food returns I can back that up.
The in shrimp in the food I ordered tasted fishy if that&#39;s a saying but the service is always excellent

The food is always delicious and fresh and the service has always been great. The menu is huge with plenty to choose from. My favorites are the Miso Salmon and Tiramisu Cheesecake.<br>The only downfall is that there is always a looong wait, so be prepared.
Love the food!  I ordered via. Door Dash and I was impressed by the way they packaged the food.  Great job!

This place is AMAZING! Ivan K was an amazing waiter! He gave us excellent recommendations for food and was very friendly and gave us a little extra bread  also kept up on drink refills which is really appreciated!!! Thanks for a successful date night!

We went at 5:00 Wednesday evening. We didn&#39;t have to wait much at all to be seated. When the sun went down this is a very dark and noisy restaurant. It was not a pleasant place to eat at with friends who want to have a conversation and be able to hear each other. You have to yell to be heard. The lighting is awfully dark at night time you can&#39;t see very well. We don&#39;t want to come here for a get together again with friends. <br>My vegan Cobb salad had all the lettuce hearts in it and hardly any greens. It wasn&#39;t a very good salad at the Fashion Place location. Downtown location vegan Cobb salad was very good. I ate there at lunchtime once that was a much better salad. It was nice and quite eating there then.

I have a theory. If your menu is large enough to sell ad space in it, and large enough to confuse with the King James version of the Bible, it&#39;s too darned big. For me, it tends to frustrate as too many choices confuse what I may or may not be hungry for.<br><br>C.F. seems to be a favorite in the Salt Lake valley and there is rarely a night without a bit of a wait. That&#39;s saying something since this place is huge.<br><br>The food is usually pretty good. Not great, not bad. Pretty good. I like that it is reliably good and you&#39;re going to have a decent meal no matter what you order. Pricing is in line and you aren&#39;t going to break the bank feeding a family here.

Highly overrated and overpriced for the quality of food. I&#39;m not sure what they have done right to keep the hype up. I&#39;m also interested in how they keep such a large array of menu items ... maybe everything is just microwaved ? Not sure how else you could have that many items shoved back in that kitchen.

Good food long wait... not sure why they don&#39;t take reservations. The venue is over populated and rather noisy but for the lack of ambiance there is a pretty good meal with a hefty portion to fit.
Always delicious. Love the avocado rolls. Definitely a must visit. Waiters are always so friendly. I definitely prefer lunch time to go since it is always packed. And the portions are huge!

I love you guys and have been ordering curbside for  years, because it&#39;s usually quick and easy, and I like avoiding the crowds. However, the last couple of times I&#39;ve sat for 30 min plus and watched 5 or more grub hub/door dash orders come through before mine. This was after I waited at home for 30 min. prior to placing the order. So about an hour or more wait. For curbside? Please don&#39;t let the curbside option be forgotten.

I came to this location because it was closest to my house. My wife and I had celebrated our wedding the day before and we had an excellent cheesecake at our wedding. The cheesecake was the Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter cheesecake and we came back because we wanted to get some more. We came in and the front area was so disorganized that it was hard to tell who was waiting for a table and who was ordering cheesecake to go. There was people standing everywhere, but eventually we were able to push our way to where we could buy cheesecake to go. We told the cashier we wanted a peanut butter cheesecake but weren&#39;t sure which kind. She showed us a single slice of the Reese&#39;s which at that point we told her that&#39;s the kind we wanted and that we would buy half a cheesecake. The total came to just over $30, and after a 15 minute wait it was ready. She gave it to us but only showed the top and with the poor lighting we couldn&#39;t tell if it was right but we assumed the employees knew the difference. We took it home just to find out that they gave us the Adams Peanut Butter cake which is half cake and half cheesecake. I am greatly disappointed and in the future I will better inspect my purchase since the employees who deal with cheesecake every day couldn&#39;t tell the difference between two cheesecakes.

They started screaming at me. The waitress got the manager and he started screaming at me. I was there to pick up a online order. Look in the back and see the people doing doordash they are screaming at them and treating them like trash. Sad a company would treat people who are helping them out.
Screaming  and threatening  your delivery  drivers is not ok. Had three employees  including  the manager  threaten me.

This particular Cheese Cake Factory has the worst customer service ever.  From the girl at the front tonight straight to the condescending, rude manager.  They make it obvious they don&#39;t care to have our large party of 9.<br>This has been our favorite gathering spot for our family celebrations for years.  Time for New traditions I guess.
They mess up my cake and food was horrible I order farfale chicken pasta no souse in pasta

I&#39;ve been to quite a few different Cheesecake Factories but this location always let&#39;s me down. I&#39;ve tried coming here multiple times but the last two times have just been flat out DISGUSTING. <br>Every single time the wait times are always so long and so unorganized compared to other cheesecake factories.<br>The first time I came here my pasta was so  watery it was drenched in tomato water. Ive had this entree at the Salt Lake City location and it&#39;s always been amazing. There were huge chunks of undiced garlic I&#39;m my pasta. I was really disappointed. <br>So I despite my last experience I decided to give this Cheesecake Location another try. The wait time was horrible again. Not just to be seated it took 20 minutes just to get bread and water and another 20 just to get all of our appetizers out. Me and my partner ordered the shrimp and angel hair pasta both we&#39;ve previously had at the Salt Lake location and loved. Our food came out in a slop, nothing was plated presentably it seemed like our food was thrown onto a plate. The pasta was dry and had no sauce it, then my parnters shrimp came out lukewarm and mine was just cold. It was almost like they had been sitting underwarmers for those 20 minutes. We notifyed the waiter about how disgusting our pastas were she said they would make us a fresh batch. 5 minutes later she comes out with the same sloopy looking plates. The only difference was they had obviously heated up our plates. They even kept the same shrimp on the plate just microwaved. Our food was now dryer and the shrimps were hard and a fishy smell. It was literally inedible. It definitely shows just how little the chefs care about the presentation and the quality of their food. <br>The only reason I&#39;m not giving this Cheesecake Factory a 1 star review is because our waiter was very kind. I definitely will not be coming back and wasting my money at this location.
I have never been disappointed when we have gone to the cheese factory. It might be a little pricey but the food is worth it.

This place always scores well. Great food with dozens of choices and so far haven&#39;t had bad ones. Shrimp Scampi was awesome, Chicken Marsala was killer, Miso Salmon and the Tomato Basil we&#39;re also excellent. Proportions were big a filling. We shared a Arugula Goat Cheese salad that was very tasty. All in all it was another excellent meal for the family at the CC Factory.
Love this place! You can&#39;t beat great service and great food. Being able to make reservations on Yelp is the icing on top!

I ordered the steak Diane and herb crusted salmon combination. Instead of potatoes, I asked for spinach. I was a little confused when the dish came as I thought it would be creamed spinach, as that was what I got at another location. It came sautéed, but nevertheless it was good...except that half of it was still raw. I love spinach but would have rather eaten it sautéed than raw and bland. The salmon was a little dry but the steak was alright. I come here a bunch because my mom loves it, but it&#39;s definitely not somewhere I would go on my own.

Place is just good. Everything on the menu is good food. That is if you&#39;re into chain restaurants. If you&#39;re not don&#39;t go there. I&#39;d appreciate it too because the line is already long enough.

It&#39;s been a long time since I&#39;ve been here. I came years ago and it left a distasteful experience last time hence why it&#39;s been so long. I wanted to leave a review though where I could remember my whole experience.<br><br>So first off Saturday night super busy. So we try to plan to go little early like 5pm maybe the wait will be less. Nope still a 55 minute -75 minute wait. So we put our names down and wait. Get a booth seat which is nice and look over the menu. <br><br>Looked over the menu for a long long time before we were helped by our waitress. I&#39;ve come to the conclusion too it&#39;s not there fault. There understaffed. They need more waitresses and waiters to turn tables over quicker. So the wait would always be less for those wanting to eat and they could make more money... just saying. <br><br>Anyway she takes are full order because we are beyond hungry and ready. Avocado Egg Rolls for appetizer, I got the Thai Lettuce Wraps as my entree, and my husband got the Enchiladas. Ended with a banana cream cheesecake to share. <br><br>So Avocado Egg Rolls! A+ they were amazing and actually like the highlight of my meal. My Thai Lettuce wraps were decently good too. My husband said his Enchiladas were good but not as good as a Mexican restaurant of course. He said the rice was terrible no flavor. The Avocado Egg Rolls $12 pretty pricy for a appetizer but possibly worth it in my opinion. Thai Lettuce wraps $15? Eh I&#39;ve had better for cheaper. My husbands $15 Enchiladas. Also had better for cheaper. <br>Cheesecake worth it and yummy! <br><br>My conclusion is this... this place is lacking in service and needs some help with that to get people in and out the door quicker. Next is the quality of food vs the price isn&#39;t matching depending on the items. So overall experience is probably would only come back if someone I knew really really wanted to go.

Today my husband and I went and had lunch and of course cheesecake. The Fried cheese we started out with had the smoothest cheese in it and was the best I ever had.  My husband had the shepherds pie and said it reminded him of his Grandmothers recipe. He got the smaller lunch size and could not finish half of it. I got the Mac and cheese burger but I had s turkey burger instead of a beef patties, it was out of this world. My only issue was they brought me my sandwich with tomato after I asked for no tomato and my fries were not ready at the same time so by the time my fries came out I was done eating and I didn&#39;t want to take them home since I hate old fries. They took them back to the kitchen and still charged me for them. <br><br>Our waiter was great (except the fry issue$. He kept our soda glasses full and they didn&#39;t get halfway empty. He wrapped the leftovers up quickly and didn&#39;t push us out even though there was over 20 people waiting for a table. <br><br>The cheesecake was the best - ever.   It took us about 15-20 minutes to get our cheesecake but it was worth it.  A bit expensive for me but overall it was great. I think I&#39;ll stick to appetizers and cheesecake.

Came here for lunch to celebrate my birthday! I have been here many times over the years and they have consistently been good! <br><br>We always start with Tex mex egg rolls or Buffalo blasts. Both are excellent choices. Chicken Bellagio is probably my favorite dish on the menu but you always have to request extra Parmesan cream sauce because it can be rather dry. <br><br>Cheesecake, cheesecake, oh cheesecake! <br>So many wonderful choices! My favorite is the 30th Anniversary cheesecake. Yum! Yum!

Another friends birthday, another visit to the Cheesecake Factory, another disappointment. <br><br>This time I went with a Mac and cheese burger, fries, and a side of both the buffalo sauce and chipotle mayo. We were in a group of 11, so of course it took a while. While waiting for food I had a hibiscus lemonade that was actually really good. It was $5, but with unlimited refills and the option to switch it for raspberry or strawberry I found it worth it. The food eventually made its way out and I began the meal.<br><br>The burger was okay, but I&#39;ve had much better Mac &amp; Cheese Burgers for less money and less of a wait. The real reason I have to ding this place down to two stars is the fries. When I&#39;m paying ~$25 after tip for a lemonade, burger and fries, every element of the meal better be excellent. The lemonade passed, I&#39;ll let the burger slip by with a pass, but the fries...the fries...the first thought when eating them was wonder at how old they must have been. I ate a few, from the top, then the middle, and then the bottom, all in hopes that I could find one worth eating. I never found one. <br><br>Eventually I offered fries to friends just to see what their thoughts were. The reactions were, &#34;old&#34;, &#34;gross&#34;, and my personal favorite....&#34;these taste like fries that you left in the car and then tried a couple of hours later and regret&#34;<br><br>Much like old car fries, I regret this meal. I&#39;ve tried a decent variety of things here and only found a handful that weren&#39;t awful. Maybe 1 or 2 that were good, but in the end, regardless of what I eat, I think to myself, &#34;why didn&#39;t I go to that local place that makes a better version of this meal for less cost and less time?&#34;

First off, I want to state that I don&#39;t like their brunch. It&#39;s always cold and pretty bland (besides the caramel syrup), and I usually get items on their regular skinny menu for breakfast. The service is usually mediocre but today was fantastic! She&#39;s partly why the 4 star rating, i would give her five stars, so thank you so much, Ann B!!!! <br>Busser Nicefero and some other bussers are always cruising around the place every time we are here! I regularly get their bang bang chicken and shrimp, the ahí tar tar, beet salad, and Asian lettuce wraps (messy but fabulous). Can&#39;t forget to mention their desserts! I love the chocolate and carrot cake. Their cheesecakes are spotty. Sometimes they hit the spot and sometimes they&#39;re boring. This place is expensive but has large portions!

Not a big fan of chain restaurants but I always enjoy eating at The Cheesecake Factory! The Paris Bistro is my favorite dish  The angel hair pasta with the shrimp is delicious! Sit at the bar to avoid the long wait at the Fashion Place location

Friday night is usually a very busy night but we only had a 20 min wait. They have lots of great options especially for my mom who can&#39;t have gluten or dairy. We shared the the avocado egg rolls which are my wife&#39;s favorite. I had the crispy chicken costoletta, 5 stars,  delicious, had to eat it all. Crispy chicken in a lemon cream sauce with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The wife had Spicy chicken pasta, 4 stars, after tasting mine she wanted my food of course. Dad had a Greek salad and the steak Diane and enjoyed it a lot more than he thought he would(he had a bad experience once, the one time he at there). Mom had some kind of fish dish I believe from the skinnylicious menu that was gluten and dairy free. For desserts I ordered my favorite Tuxedo cheesecake, wife had the raspberry white chocolate cheesecake, dad had carrot cake and mom had a berry and fruit smoothie. All in all a great experience with great food. The only thing I would change is the noise level but that&#39;s hard to control, maybe turn down the music so other can talk quieter.

It&#39;s refreshing to go out to eat and know that the food is fresh, tasty, and a good portion size.  Trying the Grilled Salmon tonight and it was cooked perfectly and the herbs added a layer of flavor to enhance the fish.  The potatoes and asparagus was a complement to the salmon, and the portion was enough to split.  I am hooked on any salmon dish at Cheesecake Factory!!

Over priced for okay food. <br><br>The wait was ridiculous and I&#39;ve walked by a lot the line is always long but I really wanted to try it so we excepted the wait time. I figured well if there&#39;s a long wait then the food must be great! It did not live up to my expectations at all. I ordered the gumbo and it just was blah, I like the Bayou&#39;s gumbo a whole lot better. The prices were stupid expensive and I will not return nor will I ever recommend this to a friend.

I love this place! It&#39;s always good food. It doesn&#39;t matter what you&#39;re in the mood for you&#39;ll find it on that menu. The only problem is it may take a while from getting seated to getting your food... WELL WORTH IT THO!
The biggest negative for me is that they will not take reservations. The entire group has to be there to be seated. <br><br>As for the food, the Chicken Marsala is amazing.

We had a negative experience at the other location, but decided to give it another try, because the food was decent. We waited an hour for our food because of the mistake by the waiter. When we got our food, the potatoes were cold. Very cold. We&#39;re leaving an hour and 40 minutes later. Rushed out. Uncompensated. We won&#39;t be returning.

I absolutely Love this restaurant, the service and the ambient are just the perfect complement for the AMAZING FOOD they have. My family and I love to spend most of our special occasions here and I would 100% recommend this restaurant to anyone that likes great food

Where is the love? I dont know why there are too many haters here. Cheesecake factory has always provided good food, good selections, good ambience, good service. Sure...prepare to wait an hour or so and the place is always crowded. Its a good thing.  I don&#39;t think i was unsatisfied with any of their selections. Steaks are good, pastas not bad, delicious appetizers and great salads. The only complain I have is their cheesecakes are overpriced. But other than that... Solid 4 stars. I am just happy to have a Cheesecaje Factory here in Utah.

We traveled all the way from Utah county to take my daughter/son-in-law to lunch. We ordered 1. Chicken in waffles 2. Chicken Pasta dish (davinci ?) 3. Hamburger 4. Monte Cristo and a child&#39;s Mac&amp;  cheese. The waitress stoped by our table 2x to let us no our food was coming out any time after 25 -30 min our food finally arrived. My husbands waffles were ice cold and he had to ask for butter twice. My pasta was hard &amp; crispy it had sat in the window way to long, and dripping in oil. I could not eat it. My daughters hamburger was soggy. We complained and the waitress brought me a new dish chicken tacos. The pasta was uneatable and they did bring my husband a new hot waffle after he ate his chicken so he had chicken and THEN waffles. She brought my daughter a new bun. My sil enjoyed his Monte cristo it was hot and delicious.              So we decided all our food sat in the window for so long waiting for his sandwich and was RUINED. Bad cooks choice.  After we ate our disappointing lunch our bill came $ 84 I was outraged!! I have no problem paying that price for good hot food, BUT NOT when we had to return 3 out of 4 meals with no apology and no offer to a free piece of cheesecake. It has been over 24 hours and I&#39;m still mad about the horrible experience. I&#39;m not even going to write about how all of our drinks were empty. Bad lunch experience. I will visit the cf again of course because normally we love it there, but cf disappointed us yesterday.

We were told to wait an hour and a half for a table, the wait ended up being 2 hrs and ten minutes, which is absolutely ridiculous for a table. Then, we ended up waiting over an hour for our food. I spoke to Casey the manager, and he rudely said &#34;you&#39;ve only been waiting for 50 minutes, at least you had an appetizer&#34;. 50 minutes is a ridiculous wait time as is. Once we received our food ten minutes later (at least an hour late), my friend had a hair in her pizza. Usually cheesecake factory has decent service, but this was unacceptable and the manager shrugged it off. we will not be returning to this location.

It&#39;s bomb. I order something different every time and have enjoyed everything I have ordered. I&#39;m shocked at the 3 star current rating so I had to rate because I don&#39;t think that is accurate.

I occasionally have Cheesecake Factory food delivered by Grubhub. In the past it&#39;s been pretty good. Lately though, there is a marked difference in quality.<br><br>They used to include utensils, and bread. They no longer do. I&#39;d be happy to pay for the bread, but there isn&#39;t an option to order it.<br><br>In general the food just doesn&#39;t taste the same as it used to. Cheesecake Factory used to marked by impeccable quality. Everything was just so good.<br><br>Tonight I had the Fettuccine Alfredo. The pasta was all stuck together in massive knot, all the sauce was stuck at the bottom as if it had never been tossed, and the pasta on top was just bland. I can make that at home, if that&#39;s what I wanted.

Their food was good and their service was decent. There was a ton of people so it made it feel really crowed which isn&#39;t ideal. The food was good but honestly I would go back just for their deserts. They did not disappoint. We had the gluten free chocolate cheesecake and I don&#39;t know if any other cheesecake will ever come close to how good it was. Couldn&#39;t even tell it was gluten free. Honestly not sure if I&#39;d go back for the food because I wasn&#39;t super impressed but I&#39;d go back everyday forever for that cheesecake!

I normally love the Cheesecake Factory, but this was literally the worst experience I&#39;ve had dining. And it seems like I&#39;m not the only one who has left this location with a bad taste in their mouth. <br>We arrived tonight around 6 and were told the wait would be 15-20 minutes. After 45 minutes, we asked how long the wait was. &#34;You&#39;re getting really close.&#34; We were finally called up around 7:30 to be seated, but the table wasn&#39;t ready. So we waited for another 10 minutes and watched as they sat another party at the table they cleared for us. When we talked with the hostesses about it, we got a very snooty, &#34;We have everything under control.&#34; <br>Um. Apparently not. <br>This wouldn&#39;t have been such a big deal normally, but we had two toddlers with us. A 15 minute wait is fine. An hour and a half is not. By any standard. ESPECIALLY with children. By the time we finally got out of there at 8:30 both toddlers were beyond consolable and the tables around us weren&#39;t pleased either.<br>If we would have been told the TRUTH about how long the wait was, we would have gone somewhere else. And spared everyone frustration. <br>Instead, we won&#39;t ever visit this location again.

So thankful that since I&#39;m pregnant, I can digest lactose again (hope I don&#39;t have to go back to dairy jail after delivery). Of course, cheesecake is on my list of must haves while I take advantage of eating dairy. <br><br>Haven&#39;t been here in a while and it is as good as I remember. Guess I&#39;ll start with first things first before getting to dessert. I love the complimentary rye bread (the sour dough is ok). Our favorite appetizer is the portabella, avocado, and zucchini fries- resembles vegetable tempura. Calamari &amp; Thai Lettuce Wraps are also good. Think the avocado egg rolls are overrated though. My go to entree is the Luau Salad; THIS IS NOT YOUR TYPICAL SALAD. Between 2 or 3 layers of over-sized wonton squares sit chicken breast, mixed greens, pineapples, cucumbers, bell peppers, carrots, green beans, nuts, and more, all dressed in tasty house vinaigrette. Such a delicious combination and it&#39;s eye appealing. Now the dessert... I like the cheesecakes with different layers and different textures so my favorite at the moment is the Oreo cheesecake. <br><br>They are always busy and weekend dinner times = ridiculous wait times. Despite long waits to get a table, food arrives relatively fast.

Probably our most disappointing experience at a Cheesecake Factory. Passing through Utah in Father&#39;s Day, we thought we would stick to something familiar since we love our California Cheesecake Factory locations. <br>Sadly, that was a mistake. I&#39;ll just list the negatives because the positives were few and far between, and those are standard for all Cheesecake Factory&#39;s- nothing special stands out about this one. <br>The negatives:<br>- waiter was rude, never looked any of us in the eye when he spoke to us <br>- waiter never asked us if we wanted refills and we had to stop him as he passed by to get help<br>- waiter never asked the members in our party who ordered pasta if they wanted the grated Parmesan, which is standard for Cheesecake Factory to do<br>- waiter dropped off the bread sans sourdough without a word as to why there was no sourdough. I really don&#39;t care, because i sorta like the wheat bread better but he should have said something instead of assuming we were dumb and didn&#39;t know sourdough is always included. <br>-kids meals came out first, even though we weren&#39;t asked if we wanted them to come out first. It wouldn&#39;t have been such an issue, except that they came out so early our kids were done by the time the adult meals came. <br>-lastly, my sweet potato fries were dried up and shriveled. Obviously old. Didn&#39;t bother with sending them back as the waiter obviously didn&#39;t want to deal with us. <br><br>Basically, the worst service ever at a Cheesecake Factory. I wish we had tried the Afghan Kitchen.

Pleasantly surprised with this restaurant. Our wait on a Sunday afternoon was nonexistent and the service was great. The menu can be daunting, I mean there&#39;s over 13 pages of options so it can be a little difficult choosing your meal. On the plus side even the pickiest eater can be happy dining here. My friend ordered the avocado egg rolls which were delicious with a nice sweet sauce. I ordered the chicken parmesan pizza style entree which was basically all chicken. It was chicken parm in the shape of a pizza topped with slightly  under-seasoned garlic pasta. Overall it was good, different but good. A little salt on the pasta and it really hit the spot. My friend had the chicken and waffles Benedict which was also really good. The chicken was perfectly fried and the waffle was nice and fluffy. The hollandaise sauce wasn&#39;t the best, but the maple sauce was delicious. Bonus is that the serving sizes are so big you have enough for another meal. I&#39;ll definitely be coming back again and trying some of their many, many options.

Next time you go here make sure and get the nachos. They are hands down the best nachos I have ever had. I get nachos at other places to compare but the nachos here always win. The spicy chicken chipotle pasta is my other go to. My other go to is the chicken Madeira.

Oh, my. I have a new favorite meal. The beef kabobs with goat cheese and tahini sauce are SO good!!<br><br>I also liked the beets with walnuts appetizer. <br><br>Ordered chocolate mousse cheesecake to go.

First off I love Cheesecake Factory. The menu has something for everyone. My issue isn&#39;t with Cheesecake Factory as a whole it&#39;s just with this particular location. Our party was initially told to expect about a pretty standard 10 minute wait. At about the 20 minute mark I ran up to check where we were on the list. They ended up giving our  table to someone else and didn&#39;t put us back in the system. They apologized and told us to wait another 15 minutes. At about the 45 minute mark I checked in again. Still nowhere to seat us we were a decent sized party but multiple other parties of six got taken back while we waited. Not much was done to provide a decent customer experience. Food is great customer service is poor.

The good, the bad, the ugly. <br><br>The good:<br><br>-Great food! I have only had the healthy options but they use fresh ingredients and it&#39;s well prepared. <br><br>-Cheesecake! I stick with traditional which is always good. We often share with each other. Many of the options are too rich for my taste. You cannot go wrong with the classic options. <br><br>-The staff has always been nice and upbeat. <br><br>-The atmosphere can be hectic. It&#39;s a big place. Yet, it&#39;s always clean and comfortable. <br><br>The bad:<br><br>-This place is always busy. Seriously, I have been a few times and I&#39;ve yet to wait in line. Typical in a good restaurant. <br><br>-The price is a bit much for what you get. <br><br>The ugly:<br><br>Nothing to report here.
Bad service. Bad service. Bad service. <br>The food was decent but quite expensive. Lots to choose from. Too much.  Jack of all trades, matter of none.

Absolutely fantastic! The Miso Salmon was unique, full of sweet flavor that hit my palette in all the right places!!!<br>Dessert, Lemon Meringue Cheesecake was light, lemony and the best New York cheesecake!  Just great! <br>And of course their Lemon Drop Martini was the highlight of my dinner!

Came in for lunch on a Tuesday and was PACKED. But it was also national Cheesecake day so not sure if it was busy because of that. I was with my friend and we were able to snag a seat at the bar. Our server was attentive and friendly. It&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve been but just as I remembered, portions are still just as huge! Come in hungry and leave with Cheesecake. Don&#39;t expect to have an intimate environment. You are almost always elbow to elbow with a stranger no matter where you sit in the restaurant. Food has always been good and made great left overs. I have never been disappointed with any of the many cheese cakes I&#39;ve tried!

Horrible tasting and Mushy cheese cakes. I had ordered 2 cheesecakes via DoorDash from this restaurant, and one bit of the carrot cheesecake and I felt sick. It looked like the cream was runny and it tasted like stale cake from many days ago.<br><br>I called the restaurant and was transferred around to 3 people, each of them decided to get rid of me and after waiting for 5 minutes listening to music, some guy answered the phone.<br><br>As soon as I described the issue, he picked up on the word DoorDash, and indicated he had no interest in even listening to my complaint and asked me to call DoorDash and sort it out with them.<br><br>Add bad customer service to the list.

What can I say about The Cheesecake Factory?? I think everyone likes this place. My boyfriend &amp; I went here with his daughter during Labor Day weekend (Saturday) It was very busy, but surprisingly the wait was not very long. Only 15 minutes. We got there at 1pm. Our server was very offish, cold, bored, over-it. It was hard to read him, just not a very friendly guy but I can understand -maybe he was just very busy. He was however, very attentive &amp; after fixing my bf&#39;s drink order from a Diet Coke to a regular Coke we never had to ask for a refill on our drinks or water. He just automatically picked up the glasses &amp; returned with full glasses. So that&#39;s good. Our food came to us in a timely manner. Not a very long wait. It also arrived exactly how we requested it. Nothing out of the ordinary, just tempura fish rather than grilled fish in the tacos.<br>My bf had his usual of Shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo, I ordered fish tacos, &amp; his daughter had the Alfredo no chicken added. All the food was delicious as usual. Our experience was overall good.
The cheesecake factory is good, but it isn&#39;t great, especially for the price. I find that most dishes lack any flavor.

This place is always busy no matter what day you go. Always expect some kind of wait, but it gets ridiculous on the weekends so plan ahead.<br><br>I have been to this location many times and I finally found a dish that actually tastes good! The steak medallions are great! It has taken many trials and errors to get to this conclusion. Everything else is ok, nothing special in my opinion. Although their food may only be alright, their cocktails are pretty good. I would suggest their flavored mojitos to be the winner of the night.<br><br>You can&#39;t come to Cheesecake Factory without ordering cheesecake. We had a voucher which gave us a free slice and I have to say, it was more than enough.
