Yes their cheesecake is delicious but personally I don&#39;t mind sharing with at least 3 other people because it is just too rich.<br><br>Now that I&#39;ve found something that I actually like, I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll mind coming back. This place is great for birthdays because you can always expect at least 3 songs throughout the night.

You can find better foods in the fashion place food court. First time the entire family left more than half of our food unfinished. They also forgot our appetizer. My daughter had  only 1 or 2 bites of her spaghetti and meat balls ( her favorite choice of food) and tossed it on the side.

Our food hear is always yummy, I had the vegan conn salad and it is one of the best salads ever!!! It is healthy and tastes wonderful! Healthy or not I am will be getting a cheese cake! Stilling trying to decide!

I was in the mood for pasta and my friend conveniently recommended Chicken Jambalaya Pasta. I heard this is the dish she always order every time she is in Cheesecake Factory. So I thought, well, worth a try, and boy was she right. It was so good I wanted to give her a hug. Heck, I even wanted to give The Chef a hug.  <br><br>The chicken was tender and juicy. The cajun spices were spicy enough to add zing to my taste buds without overdoing it. Ok spicy is not actually a taste but a form of pain, which then confirms when people say there is always pleasure in a little bit of pain. The pasta was done in perfection. The shrimp was tasty and together with blends of vegetables (onions, tomatoes and green peppers with parsley sprinkles), they complete this whole heavenly dish. <br><br>I would give a 5-stars review if I had not made to wait over an hour to get our table on that Saturday evening. I know that is the busiest time of the week, and I don&#39;t mind the wait but we had to wait almost 20 minutes to get the bread served (and another 20 minutes to get our orders).  At least, they should serve the bread right away after we were seated since everybody was surely starving after all that long wait. Sounds doable enough right? <br><br>I will be back, probably with a little snack to munch whilst all that waiting. 4-stars.

Services is good here! The food I ordered was tasteful. I liked the steak and salmon were cooked just right. The steam spinach would be tasty if add cream. My wife chicken with artichoke but the artichoke was insufficient.

What?! Only an average rating of 3 stars? What&#39;s up people? This little Cheesecake Factory spot totally deserves 4 stars at least! I dock them a star for being too dimly lit inside and not having a happy hour. In CA we loved hitting up Cheesecake Factory during happy hour but I suppose with Utah&#39;s weird liquor laws Happy hour isn&#39;t a thing here.

Bring your own flashlight ask to be sat by a window that is lucky enough to have Mall Parking lot light shining in, because unlike EVERY OTHER  CHEESECAKE FACTORY, the Murray Stores inept Manager forces the staff to keep the lighting at or below candle light levels.<br> <br>Good luck reading the menu or seeing what you are actually eating.<br><br>Our waiter tells us they get 50 complaints or more every night. I say, &#34;fire the damn management  and get a clue Murray store!&#34;

Most the time it is very busy around dinner the wait never seems so bad because the mall is right there so you can waste some time walking around window shopping. I really enjoy the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps, it can get messy but it&#39;s always delicious. You get a few different sauces to try and yummy grilled chicken. The Chicken Parmesan sandwich is also out of this world. The sauce and peppers just add so much flavor to the already delicious sandwich. The Factory burrito is also another favorite, it&#39;s very large and could easily be shared between two people. The cookie dough and Adam&#39;s Reese Peanut Butter Cup are my two absolute favorite cheesecakes. It&#39;s a nice place to go when you want something familiar and are in the mood for dessert.
This has been horrible in this place today. We are a group of 10 and they wait to sit us more than 35 minutes and now we are sit outside 95 degrees under the sun

We don&#39;t typically eat at The Cheesecake Factory; I still remember when it first opened how long the wait times were. But yesterday night, my husband suggested we go there, and I thought it would be a nice change from Olive Garden or McGrath&#39;s, where we normally go.<br><br>They were a bit disorganized with seating people. Rather than using a paging system, the host and hostesses would yell out the name and number of people in a party. They heard me wrong when I gave our last name and said party of three. They were calling our name, but for two, and it took a few extra minutes for them to sort that out. The host was apologetic and friendly, though. It wasn&#39;t a big deal, but having worked in a restaurant before, I know that something like that would probably set off a different type of personality and the restaurant workers would get yelled at.<br><br>Our waitress was Jen, and while she was nice enough, I&#39;m fairly good at reading people. She seemed annoyed, and I&#39;m not sure if it was with us or if she just didn&#39;t want to be there at all that night. We all have those days, I know. I ordered the fish and chips with the sweet potato fries and she gave me a &#34;you&#39;re kinda stupid&#34; look when I asked if there was any other sauce besides ketchup for the sweet potato fries. My options were ketchup and fry sauce. I asked for fry sauce, but I wonder if there are other sauces she could have recommended. Most places have something sweet to go with it, or something with a kick. Either one of those would have complemented the fries better.<br><br>When it came time to get the check, she gave us another table&#39;s check that didn&#39;t even closely resemble what we&#39;d ordered. When she dropped the check, that was pretty much the only time we got a huge smile out of her, as well as a &#34;it was my pleasure serving you tonight&#34; (which, sorry to say, didn&#39;t feel genuine at all.) I had to catch her while she was walking by, or it might have taken us another fifteen to twenty minutes to get the correct check. She wasn&#39;t apologetic about giving us the wrong check, and didn&#39;t even seem surprised that she had. <br><br>I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll eat here again, but I&#39;m a bit put off by how pushy the servers are with cheesecake--if you don&#39;t want to eat it there, then they try to push you to order it to go--and the lukewarm service we received from the server.<br><br>I also wish she&#39;d been thoughtful enough to include a container of tartar sauce for my leftover fish and chips. They are going to taste plain without it, as well as soggy, because she also included the coleslaw and only separated that from the rest of my leftovers with a thin piece of paper.

My family and I love this place! We always have great service and great food. The only downfall is there is normally at least a 30 minute wait most of the time more then that. But atleast it&#39;s in the mall so you can do some shopping while you wait.

Delicious cheesecake and I loved it. But it was more like the service I wasn&#39;t completely satisfied. Front desk or the cashier guy looks like he wasn&#39;t happy or smiling. Other than that, great location, nice and clean, great food! Just the service wasn&#39;t over all nice but it&#39;s okay.

Last night me and a friend went to The Cheesecake Factory to enjoy a meal and a glass of wine after a busy day. We were seated promptly but the hostess seated us at a table that was lightly used (filled water glasses, unfolded napkins, ect.). We knew something was off about the scene but we just wanted to sit down (long day). Our waitress greeted us and immediately noticed that our table wasn&#39;t ready. We joked about it with her and laughed it off. The manager came over to apologize, informing us that the hostess was new (no harm, no foul we&#39;ve all been there). Our table was cleaned off and we received our waters, but that was about the most consistent our service got . We didn&#39;t receive our napkins/plate/utensils until after our bread and butter was refilled, everything about that service seemed half done. Our orders were taken, our food was DELICIOUS, but we agreed that the experience was the worst we had. I will say our waitress was nice. She gave us time to place our orders but either me or my friend had to ask for common things (silverware and plates, our appetizer plates to be cleared from our table after receiving our entrees, water refills) it just seemed like since we were a smaller party we didn&#39;t matter.

Super great food and reasonably priced for the serving size. I tasted all four meals and all were flavorful and well presented. <br><br>The reason there is a 50 minute wait is because the service is so slow they can&#39;t get the tables turned. I wasn&#39;t in a rush and it was ok that it took 90 minutes though, that&#39;s a long time for a restaurant experience.

I ordered the old fashion burger, I&#39;ve had a better burger and fries at 5 Guys. Nothing special about this one except you&#39;re paying $13.00 for it. <br><br>My boyfriend ordered the chicken stuffed tortillas. He really enjoyed the sides, one being grilled corn cakes. The chicken was very flavorful and moist. <br><br>Our server was great, he even steered me away from ordering the cucumber lemonade. The restaurant is spacious and kept clean. <br><br>I know we will be back eventually for some of our favorites on the menu (avocado egg rolls, fried mac and cheese.)

As much as I love the food here, I have to say that the blonde hostess that works on Friday nights isn&#39;t only ditzy but super slow.  &#34;Check back in 40 mins, check back in another 40 mins, check back in 30, 20 and 15 mins.....&#34;. So annoying and the service that night was mediocre at best.  Food was good but service could&#39;ve been better.  Maybe open up another location???

So... went there to celebrate... the wait was expected. We were seated right next to where the waiters put in the orders. <br>Problem 1- one waiter smelled like some serious herbbage. <br>Problem 2- the table felt like it was meant to be pushed together with the couple who sat next to us (spacious table), which made our table way too small for two people.<br>Problem 3- my card wouldn&#39;t &#34;authorize&#34;. It didn&#39;t decline. I tried it that morning and later on that evening. So it wasn&#39;t my card. They just brushed it off as my problem, when it was their machine. We were lucky we had the cash between us.<br><br>Tips. Take cash! Their machine might not work, and then you&#39;re stuck with a $60 bill for a very greasy meal. <br><br>Avacado egg rolls saved you this time.

Service and food are excellent, as always.  It&#39;s still crowded when you get here on a weekend.  The only fault I find is the seating arrangement is so tight.  Not an overly huge fan of the people on the next table being able to lean over and put their elbows on my table.  I get communal dining, but not a fan of it.<br>The food is still good.  The Salmon Roll appetizer is worth it.  The Bistro Shrimp Pasta is still good though I can notice the change in it to reduce the calorie count. The cheesecakes of course make this visit worth while.

I visited this location on Monday 8/20/18. I was angry at how heavy their entrance doors were to open. I was with my elderly mom and sister with mobility challenges and struggled to make sure the doors didn&#39;t slam on them.  As a disability accessibility advocate, I couldn&#39;t believe there were no push plates to enter......I checked as we exited. I shared my concerns with one of the managers during our meal, he thought there might be a push plates but he wasn&#39;t sure and appeared to have little concern for my inquiry. I am not sure if this problem is at all their locations or not. I hope they rectify this issue before someone gets hurt!<br>Please let businesses know when they are not accessible for everyone!!!!!!

Horrible experience tonight. We took our adult &#34;kids&#34; to celebrate a birthday. Waiter was awful and non-attentive. After ordering waiter told us they were out of bread and they were baking more. It arrived (a single basket for 6 adults) after a really long wait just shortly before entrees were delivered. After each of us having one piece of bread asked waiter for more, 10 minutes later we were told they were out of it again.  Entrees arrived lukewarm, one of them nearly room temperature. Ordered dessert and told waiter of a nut allergy of someone we were taking desert home for. He told us no nuts in the recipe but gave the CYA answer of prepared in a place with nuts. Sure enough one of the layers definitely had nuts. Thanks for helping us celebrate. Next year we will go somewhere else. Funny thing was that it was a Tuesday night, the restaurant was not that busy for such horrible service

Horrible service from the manager. My wife&#39;s food sucked and we didn&#39;t see the waitress until the end, when my food was gone because we both ate my food. Then the manager corrected us on how to return food. We witnessed him return some food from another table and he was doing all he could to make it right for them. But when he talked with us he made it seem like he went out of his way just to take it off the bill. He didn&#39;t offer to get better food or anything.

I&#39;m a huge French toast fanatic and their &#34;best French toast ever&#34;  was way under cooked and basically un eatable.    My date ordered and they brought out the wrong order.    I was done eating (trying to eat) about 5min before hers showed up.

I&#39;ve been here many times and the food and service is spectacular. However, DON&#39;T ORDER THE STEAK!!! I should have known better. I guess I expected the steak to be on par with the rest of the food but I was sorely disappointed. the steak was very over cooked and dry.

Got off of work and ordered chicken samosas, my order for some reason was missing when I arrived. Decided to just go in with my boyfriend and sit down at a table and let them know the situation. The manager was so sweet and didn&#39;t charge us for chicken samosas! We ordered the garlic chicken pasta and it was just perfectly cooked. Really good portions and customer service was outstanding! Also going at night makes it ten times better simply because the lighting was awesome and environment was nice!

I love the Cheesecake Factory.  The food rocks.<br><br>I love the Jambalaya Pasta with Jumbo Shrimp and Chicken.  This time I added the Andoulie Sausage.  I wouldn&#39;t do this again as it was a bit greasy from the Sausage. My bad though<br><br>I love the Cheesecake here and this time I ordered the Key Lime.<br><br>On my next visit I will try the  Steak Diane.

I stopped by on my way through town. This was a great experience. Didn&#39;t have to wait and was seated immediately. We had Evan as our server. It was probably one of our best experiences in a restaurant. He was prompt, kind, recommend some great stuff that we ordered. Never had to ask for refills and he made us feel exceptional. The food was awesome. Will definitely be back on our way passing through and will definitely request Evan again. Thanks Evan and the rest of the staff for a great experience.

A solid 3. the food is good but expensive. Not a place to take kids when you have to pay regular prices for them. I ordered the Baja tacos. The flavor was good but you get 4 mini and I mean mini tacos with only 1-2 chunks of chicken per taco. I thought they were appetizers but I was wrong. For $14 I expected at lest real sized tacos. Wife got a $14 bowl of chili. Really good but chili costs $14? For the 4 of us came to $75 includes tip and we all ordered water. I&#39;m sure there are better things but tonight was not it. It will be a while before we go back. (Maybe after I get a raise)<br>Our waitress was really good but when the kitchen brought the food out it was 2 plates at a time with about at 2 minutes in-between. Not terrible if you are 2 or even 4 but we were a table of 7.

I went here on a Tuesday, around 3. It wasn&#39;t busy, but we still had to wait a few minutes to be seated which isn&#39;t a big deal at all. The first thing I notice is the absolutely beautiful interior it&#39;s super spacious and I love the display cases of the cheesecake by the door where you can get some to take home. <br><br>After I was seated, i took a look at the menu and, boy oh boy, is it huge. You definitely get a lot of options from orange chicken to steak. The cheesecake list is super impressive. <br><br>Now the portion sizes are large. I knew this place was a tad bit pricier than average but after seeing the portions, it makes sense and is reasonable. I ordered the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp. Seriously, it was the best meal I&#39;ve had in ages. Rice was cooked perfectly, the chicken and shrimp were so flavorful, and the coconut bits were a perfect touch. <br><br>The cheesecake. Honestly. Best thing ever. I have no words. I had the Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;mores Cheesecake, would definitely recommend. <br><br>My only gripe is the service. It took us forever to get water, and then it took even longer for him to come back for our order. Seems he was switching shifts and just left mid way. A waitress took out our food very quickly and my next waiter was absolutely amazing. So it all depends. <br><br>Either way. I&#39;ll be back for sure!
The Bang Bang is SO good! Such a great meal, the only negative is the lighting is too low and makes it hard to read the menu

The food is the best! Especially the lemon sauce on the herb crusted salmon. Seriously amazing!!!<br><br>I don&#39;t love the hour wait, but my family has accepted that going there means waiting and we always plan for it.<br><br>Also, there is not much privacy. Try asking for a booth. You wait longer, but it&#39;s worth it.

So bummed. I love the cheesecake factory and was pumped to eat here for a birthday dinner but they don&#39;t take reservations today and when we showed up there was a two hour wait. We ended up going to Wingers down the street.
Food was good.  My steak was cooked prefect.  The customer service was just outstanding. Loud environment but thats just because i was busy.  The prices were a little high but iv had worst.

I doubt you are reading this to determine the quality of the food. For service, one star is being nice. <br><br>First, the host was jerk, sorry for coming. The waitress was slow. It appeared they gave her three new tables at once. So slow to get drinks to us, which then pushed out order out. <br><br>The worst part of the night came from being seated on the West side, in perfect position for every car&#39;s headlights to shine right in our eyes. We asked to have the blinds lowered, the manager said no as they turn off the lights at night. Really, lame excuse. There is no light switch or dimmer?  He somewhat offered to move us, but you could tell that was not going to happen. Again, sorry for coming. <br><br>The food was the same old Cheesecake. Three stars at best.

I know the wait can be unnerving but they&#39;re popular for a reason. So we went on a Saturday morning at 11:00 and still there was about 20 of us coming in the door. The service was excellent with a waiter named Steve. He brought extra Madeira sauce for the chicken Madeira not asked for but definitely appreciated. Extra anything we wanted was brought and anticipated. The lettuce wraps are just the best anyone&#39;s ever made. The banana cream cheesecake with hot fudge sauce on the side is uniquely phenomenal. The Chinese chicken salad is fantastic. All entrees can easily be shared. This place just does unique and delicious and presentation as good as any upscale restaurant without the upscale costs and much better volume! There is a reason there is a crowd, just go on off peak demand hours.

I told myself I would never come here again and because of time im here smh. Go DOWNTOWN to city creek! I ordered curbside to-go because I hate the service here. And they messed up the to go! With no apology! I&#39;d rather starve then come here again, I would&#39;ve left but my husband was hungry after a long day of traveling internationally
Devine food! Amazing service! Such a cool environment! I love everything about this place

My wife and I came in within in the lunch special hours (before 5:00), and we had some awesome entrées.  My wife had crusted Romano chicken. I had some of it and it was quite good. Pretty basic, pounded chicken with pasta and I think Romano sause. It was good.  But what I got totally blew it out of the water! <br>If you like salmon, then prepare yourself for the beat salmon you&#39;ll ever have. Its called salmon genovese. Amazing, that is what it should be called. The salmon was grilled with roasted tomatoes and artichokes, anyway it was plated beautifully and the service was great.<br>Now my wife and I arrived before 5:00, so obviously our wait time was long enough for them to grab menus, and our service was above average, and we didn&#39;t wait too long for food, which tasted amazing.<br>Low wait time +<br>Service +<br>Food quality ++<br><br>Why? Probably because my unborn child inside my wife was screaming for food at 4:00 in the afternoon. If we had gotten there at 5:30 or later, I would expect a longer wait time, less service quality, and possibly lower food quality. <br>I thoroughly enjoyed my time there.
Do not come here on a Saturday night, totally not worth a 1.5 hour wait for mediocre food or overpriced desserts. They really should get a reservation system or a cell phone alert system.

Seriously, Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ve been in business how long and you still don&#39;t know how busy you get??! BUILD A BIGGER WAITING AREA! People are LITERALLY stepping on my toes. Your food is not worth that kind of hassle!

I love this place. I don&#39;t even like cheesecake but the food here is awesome. The menu is huge and all the food is great. My favorite appetizers are the Stuffed Mushrooms, Avocado Eggrolls, and the Factory Nachos. I love the pasta, the burgers and the steaks. The milkshakes are delicious as are the lemonades. My wife loves their Oreo cheesecake.

We have only been to this location once. The server we had was amazing! She was very attentive even though she was obviously very busy. My only complaint was the wait at an early dine time and really no place to wait in the cold snowy evening of Utah. The wait area was part of &#34;to go&#34; area for cheesecake. The food was wonderful, well prepared, and they have an extensive menu with many choices for the family.

Have you ever had to wait 15 minutes on the phone just to order carry out? I was transferred three times. When I went up to pay they didn&#39;t even have the order I&#39;d called in. A restaurant that&#39;s always this busy should figure out how to better manage things, and hire more employees.

First time I ordered delivery service and I&#39;ll do it again. My order was delivered early, packaged well inside the containers, food was hot and my order was correct! And let me not forget that the food was fantastic and well portioned (not too much, not too little). I got the skinnylicious turkey burger with a side salad. Wonderful!
Food we received was cold. Food seemed like it was hastily made. Not so good. Definitely not with the price.

Love the food as always, portions are large and it&#39;s always cooked well. This visit, we waited and waited and waited for our food to come out. It&#39;s a Wednesday you wouldn&#39;t think that it would be like an hour for our food. Anyway, nothing but love for this place!

Don&#39;t get the mashed potatoes. They don&#39;t clean the potatoes properly and the last 3 times I&#39;ve gotten the potatoes there was sand in them. This most recent time I took the potatoes home and ate them there and chipped a tooth. So just stay away from the potatoes and you get to keep your teeth.

Habachi steak with onions, mash potatoes and a nice sauce to pair it together .. Doesn&#39;t tickle your fancy? Try the pasta devinchi  with sautéed onions and mushrooms in a Marsala wine sauce, it&#39;s just as Divine. <br><br>Now for the appetizers.. Fire cracker salmon with Asian slaw and sweet spicy sauce wrapped in a fried wonton wrapping is my favorite as well as their tuna tar tar . The avocado is fresh and the fish melts in your mouth . <br><br>Now martinis ! Can&#39;t go wrong with their Asian pear martini . Light, crisp and pairs well with fish dishes.

I went to eat here with my husband today for lunch/dinner......we ordered egg roll samplers for the appetizer and we really enjoyed them and the different kind of sauces with it  I ordered the New York steak  with mashed potatoes  and brown gravy and a bowl of tortilla soup....I really enjoyed my meal  my husband ordered the New York steak  with green beans and a bowl of salad ....my husband ordered his steak medium rare and when they brought it out the temperature was wrong so he had them redo it...they brought it out the second time and this time his steak was rare...besides that the green beans were raw and not done...my husband was very upset with his food but gave up complaining about it and just ate it anyway......The restaurant was super busy....I also bought a banana cheesecake which I look forward to eating..... anyways a half great experience... Thanku Cheesecake Factory  4-12-18

I&#39;d leave zero stars if I could. Took over an hour to get our food. We had to different servers who were both very rude, I&#39;ve been a loyal Cheesecake Factory customer, I will not be coming back. And I&#39;ll make make sure not to return, customer service and food was horrid.
Great food and great portions sizes. Our family comes here all the time. My wife gets the red velvet cheesecake and she loves it

I came here with my friends for my early birthday dinner. The server was funny and friendly. The good was good, and the server had a candle on my cheesecake which was really nice. The only thing I didn&#39;t enjoy was when we walked in nobody came over ask us anything, and we had to find server to say we are here to eat which was kinda awkward.... But after that we had good experience. I would choose the downtown location over this one.

My friends and I came into the restaurant last night for a girls night. The wait was about 45 minutes which was normal for cheesecake factory. We then got sat and our waitress was great, we ordered three chicken Parmesan pizza style and I ordered the chicken Riesling. After about 40 minutes of waiting for all entrées our waitress said they are on their way. We then waited five more minutes and the chicken Parmesan came out. After that the waitress came over to me and said mine was taking longer to cook, and there was a misunderstanding. She then offered to give me a free salad on the house, as well as have the manager come over and she explained the situation. She then gave me my meal for free. At first I was upset, but then the great customer service turned it around. I appreciate great customer service like that. I hope the next time I am there it&#39;s not that long of a wait for my food. I will be back.

So I&#39;m kind of big on good customer service, being noticed and feeling special even though I am only here to have thai lettuce wraps. The couple of times I&#39;ve been at this location(because it&#39;s close to where I live) I have been disappointed deeply in the host/hostess staff. <br><br>First don&#39;t make me say something to you, all 3 of you standing there, and don&#39;t ask me to wait for two people when the restaurant is almost empty. I don&#39;t get that. <br><br>The food is usually good...tons to choose from. I&#39;ll keep eating here and I realize it&#39;s a chain sooooo I&#39;ll get over it.

They never have what we want <br><br>Never have fresh ahi tuna <br><br>Never have apple crisp<br><br>Never have fresh ice tea <br><br>It&#39;s becoming a joke<br><br>It&#39;s tarnishing the name &#34; cheese cake factory &#34;<br><br>Bread always cold !<br><br>Butter expired <br>Next time if anyone goes ck UR butter

I like this restaurant from overall food, service and, of course, desserts (its cheesecake). The only tip is to come on Sunday, whereby there are not as many people, so you do not need to queue very long.<br><br>So we came here the last time for Sunday lunch. The price is cheaper because the portion is smaller. We need to understand that their &#34;lunch&#34; portion is still pretty large &amp; comparable to other restaurant. Their dinner portion is gigantic.<br><br>They provide bread for appetizer. There are two types of bread (chocolate one and normal one). I prefer the chocolate color one (it does not taste like chocolate, but it is still delicious) with butter. The waiter is very kind and providing another one, after we ate them out in 5 min ... (yes, it is that good).<br><br>I got fish &amp; chips that I shared with my six-year-old boy, both of us like it. It is crispy with 3 pieces of fish and fries. It filled both of us.<br><br>My wife has fettucinni (pasta) with roasted potato and chicken. We like it and  I stole a couple of bites from my wife&#39;s plate. Yummy...<br><br>We closed our lunch with cheesecake. We asked the waiter of her favorite cheesecake and she told us the caramel one, so we ordered it... it is truly delicious, you&#39;d love it !
Year after year, you can&#39;t go wrong with the Cheesecake factory.<br><br>Who has a bigger menu in town?  Noone.  <br><br>The food is great and always fun to eat here.
Food is cold, service is horrible!!<br>Today they told me my food will take 20-25 min, it took more than 45 min and it was cold!!! Tooo cold!!<br>I ate cold fish and ship,!

Really disappointed with our experience tonight. I&#39;ve always enjoyed Cheesecake Factory, but after tonight&#39;s experience I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be in a hurry to be back. It was really busy, so I&#39;m not that put off by the long wait times in between drinks, appetizers, entrees... but the service just seemed extremely forced, and I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s based on location, but we never got our usual bread and butter WHICH I LOVE! The bread is a huge reason I keep coming back, and by the time we got the waiter around to ask about the bread our food was out and I didn&#39;t feel like being more of nuisance

I had the Miso Salmon and two bites in had a bone stuck in my throat. Eating small bites probably saved me fro harm. I was able to dislodge the bone with small bits of bread and other than soreness did not suffer harm.

Okay, I may be a little bias but I love The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I, Sky Thai, LOVE The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Absolutely love, love, love it. Maybe because my favorite dessert is cheesecake and it&#39;s part of the name and I loved everything I ever had here. (Not to mention that many memories of birthdays and friend&#39;s birthdays were held here.) Not sure why I love it so, but I love The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I think if I were a restaurant, I would be The Cheesecake Factory. Best chain restaurant in existence.<br><br>LOVE IT!<br>- - - - - - - - - -<br>Anyways back from my fanboy moment, it has a slightly elegant but comfortable and relaxing feel that just works to bring the best of the upscale and comfort of a lowscale together in harmony. What more can you ask for?<br><br>The lunch specials are seriously good for what they get you and are so very delicious and yum-yum good. The dinners are the same way and you get a hefty, tantalizing portion of whatever you order. They like to pretty up the tasty food so big points for plating design. (You do know you eat with your eyes first.) I have not had anything bad here and I don&#39;t expect to but hey, if you have a problem with the meal they will get another one for you at no cost. That&#39;s what they did for a friend of mine and that&#39;s what I call good customer service.<br><br>Yes, it is crowded in the evenings and the waits can be atrociously long but go on the &#34;off days&#34; (Sunday-Thursday) in the afternoon or early evening to get a seat. If all else fails, just go shopping at the Fashion Place Mall or at some other store nearby to kill time until the wait &#34;should&#34; be over. You just gotta play the waiting game sometimes but I think it is worth it.<br><br>Oh, and how could I forget about the cheesecake itself? In a nutshell, there is a huge assortment and array of the decadently guilty pleasure. I am pretty sure you will find something that appeals to your wanting tastebuds. Just go to the gym and work it off later, indulge a little.<br><br>I definitely recommend this restaurant to go to because I think it is a pleaser for just about everybody.

The floor is always such a slippery hazard. I don&#39;t know if this is because of oil spilled or what they are polishing it with, but it&#39;s scary. The waiters were very nice and the food was great. The hostess at the front desk was snotty  and didn&#39;t listen nor care to try. Wait time on a holiday is 2.5 hours. So...last time I&#39;ll do that. If the range of the buzzer was farther it wouldn&#39;t be as much of a problem. I have always liked the entrees here.  I don&#39;t care much for cheesecake though. The Dallas location was more open and less crazy busy feeling. Maybe we need more locations in Utah.

Our server, Jessica, was fantastic and very helpfull.<br>She steered us to some great appetizers. The two appetizers we had(sweet corn tamale cakes and Tex Mex egg rolls) were fabulously tasty.<br>This place was very busy but our service was great.<br>We split the chicken Madiera shrimp scampi combo and still could not finish it.<br>The food was very good. We had a lemonade that was much too sweet we could not drink it without diluting it with our water.<br>We had a very good time and I will be back.

We came on a Saturday around 4pm and it was pretty busy during our meal, but our server was very friendly and our food was great. Love the fried mac &amp; cheese! So crispy on the outside and really gooey inside. And the sauce it&#39;s served with is delicious! My only issue is the cost. I know it&#39;s a little silly to complain because their prices are known to be high, but $10 for an appetizer is a little steep. You can&#39;t really consider the free bread &#34;free&#34; when meatloaf costs $16.

You&#39;re out of Hennessy. <br>Ok next option,  do you carry ciroc?<br>Grey goose it is then. <br><br>Pretty much an unprepared bar to start. Our bartender was great though. <br>It was an appetizers and drinks kind of night with friends. I ordered the fried calamari and sweet corn soup. The soup was okay, nothing to rave about. <br>My fried calamari was very salty. I made everyone try it and they agreed. Had I not been drinking I probrably couldn&#39;t stomach this. My friend had left over lettuce from his lettuce wrap and I actually took bites out of it with each bite of calamari and balanced it. That salty. <br><br>The cheesecake will always be delicious. At least I can count on that.

We have business lunches here once a month on Fridays. How can you go wrong with such a vast menu everyone in the group can order different items that are high quality and gourmet! It&#39;s always busy and bustling here. I&#39;d suggest you hit the bar area where you&#39;ll typically find seating when tables are a considerable wait. You can order anything here and you&#39;ll enjoy it. I trust this brand so much that when I do promotions for the business I&#39;m in I&#39;ll buy thousands in Cheesecake gift cards! Also I&#39;ve never ordered a bad dish.. Gotta get back to work.. So I&#39;ll keep it short!

I don&#39;t like this place in Utah!!! The wait on a Thursday night was 50 minutes!!!  It&#39;s like Mormon Nirvana.  They love this place!!!   I don&#39;t get it.  Sean our server was excellent!!  I ordered a mushroom burger and not trusting their medium to be medium I said medium well and got medium rare.  Terrible burger!!! The meatball appetizer and breads were excellent.  I sampled my sons Mac and cheese and it was good,!while my daughters pizza was average!!! Sean was so good I bumped them up to four stars.  This restaurant isn&#39;t worth the wait when I can walk into cpk next door down and sit immediately for the same quality food!!!

Good food, great service, excellent (as in extensive) array of choices. Moderate pricing. Be prepared for a 12 page menu, plus a kid menu and a lower-calorie menu. Take the time to preview them online.

Service was slow due to amount of people that come here. If you spill water,  plan on cleaning it up yourself,  it&#39;s hard to get somebody here that cares. Our server seen me cleaning up poured water &amp; didn&#39;t try to assist. Regardless of how busy you are,  waitors/waitress should still be attentive.  Big pet peeve of mine. She doesn&#39;t fill up my glass until I was ready to leave. If I could do it all myself I would. This restaurant charges a lot for poor service &amp; food that is just alright. Thus the 2 stars for the alright food &amp; restaurant facility. Won&#39;t be returning here anytime soon, possibly ever!

I was craving pasta the other day and it was kind of late, so we went over to The Cheesecake Factory, because it&#39;s been a few years since I&#39;ve eaten here and they were open. After about a 15 minute wait, and almost falling during the walk to the table lol (very slippery floors and I was wearing heels) we were seated. I forgot this place had such a huge menu with different types of cuisine, but I didn&#39;t want to go through it all so my boyfriend and I just ordered a flatbread app and the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic to share.<br><br>The flatbread was okay. The pasta would have been delicious if it weren&#39;t for the overpowering saltiness. We also ordered the classic cheesecake with cherries which was the highlight of the meal, but not awesome enough to want to come back here for another couple of years.

Cheese cake factory can be really hit and miss but tonight was a 5 star experience. Kurt was an awesome server. Our appetizer took twice as long to arrive so they gave it to us for free. We jade the sweet corn tamales. Please don&#39;t come here without getting them, they are that awesome. We had the chicken madierra and the Louisiana chicken pasta, both were incredibly delicious. And then to top the whole night off with a big fat cherry, the Adams cheese cake! Holy moly that cheese cake tickles my belly from the inside. Tonight was worth the wait to get in.

This is a really okay choice for a restaurant. It&#39;s nothing special (of course, being a chain), but the food was decent and the service was alright. The wait time was almost excessive, with nearly an hour for our lunch (on a wednesday afternoon) and another 15 minutes for two slices of cheesecake. Overall, it was a bearable experience, but not one I&#39;d soon repeat.

Came here on a Saturday about 3:00pm, took 2 hours to finally get seated, I guess that comes with the territory when you eat at the Cheesecake Factory! The food, like always, was in point and for the quality and amount of food you get is really good, I will def come back but probably only for certain occasions due to the long wait time almost all the time.

Food and service by Tracy/Tracie was excellent!  Our table...nnnnnnot so much. The restaurant is really dark,  too dark IMO. Our table was on the southwest side by the window.  We had dinner under a glaring parking lot light....how romantic. Every minute or so we&#39;d get a shot of headlights in our eyes. HIDs are great when you&#39;re driving, but suck when you&#39;re eating a hibachi steak.

This place is consistently, straight up bad. We avoid coming here because the food is lackluster, below even average for a restaurant chain, and the service here is usually awful. Sometimes we may join friends who like the enormous portions (and terrible costs associated with mass amounts of lousy food) but we don&#39;t go here on our own for the most part. The only thing even vaguely good about this place is it&#39;s titular dessert and then, only if someone else is paying for it. That&#39;s right, only if the cheesecake is literally bought by someone else.<br><br>Today, though, takes that cheesecake and craps all over it.<br><br>After all, how bad of a screw up do you have to be if you cannot manage to pull a single cheesecake for pick up so it can be ready to serve? You had seven hours and literally only one job where this order was concerned, but lo and behold when we arrived at 7pm, that cake had never ever been pulled and our order ticket had been lost in the shuffle. They found our ticket, but that ready-to-serve cheesecake? Did not exist. They had screwed up taking a cheesecake out of the fridge. That was it. The whole of the job. They couldn&#39;t even do that right!<br><br>Now I have a $25 dollar gift card that will never be spent, because this is the last straw. This place is a blight on the mall clogging parking and apparently services only  people who enjoy mediocre everything. We are never giving it business, ever again.

I had the chicken Romano and the crust was too eggy so much i couldn&#39;t eat the chicken, the pasta that accompanied it was tasty though. My hubby ordered there orange chicken it was fantastic! Best orange chicken across the board. If you come here bring your appetite bcz the portions are huge! And be prepared to wait bcz it&#39;s normally a lengthy wait. But you can always kill time at the mall.

I always love eating at the Cheesecake Factory. I love their huge menu and massive portions. I just don&#39;t love all the calories, fats, and carbs that go with them. However, when it&#39;s date night anything goes. I&#39;m especially fond of their Steak Diane, Chicken Madera, their Chopped Salad, and their Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake. But I could totally go on. I&#39;ve never had anything I didn&#39;t like.

Just walked out of the restaurant without eating.  I wanted to take my mother and father out for an early father&#39;s day lunch.  I asked if we could get a booth as my mother is hard of hearing.  The hostess tried to seat us in the general area, I asked if we could be seated at a booth and was told that the booth was reserved for parties of 4 or more... even though I counted 5 open booths.  CONGRATULATION CHEESECAKE FACTORY of Midvale, UT, I won&#39;t be back. Thank God I have alternatives. California Pizza Kitchen, our lunch and atmosphere were amazing and it&#39;s right next door.

If I could do 0 stars for this location I would. I&#39;ve been to numerous Cheesecake Factory&#39;s in multiple states but never have I been so poorly treated as I was tonight, on my birthday no less. My usual regular is the four cheese pasta with chicken but given my smaller appetite and wanting to save room for cheesecake I asked for the kid&#39;s meal chicken fingers. I was then told I couldn&#39;t order it. When asking the manager why they had that policy I was told because they loose money when adults order kids meals. I told him I was willing to pay more for it and still he refused to let us order it because he said &#34;he could loose his job.&#34; The manager argued with us and we asked if we could just order it to go. He said that he &#34;couldn&#39;t stop us from using a phone if we wanted to use that loophole&#34; but that we&#39;d have to leave because there were &#34;other people needing our table&#34;. I felt so unwelcome and have never been treated this way as a person who frequently dines out. After some time the manager brought our to-go order and offered it to us on the house which we appreciate but defeats the entire purpose of the policy that he chose to argue with us about from the beginning. We politely declined and insisted on paying since apparently Cheesecake Factory is hurting for money and doesn&#39;t mind loosing repeat customers over a $7 kid&#39;s meal that I would have paid more for if allowed the opportunity to purchase dining in. All in all, it wasn&#39;t worth the 2 hour wait and the humiliation on my birthday with friends and family. I&#39;m contemplating starting a GoFundMe for The Cheesecake Factory since apparently Trump&#39;s promise to save factories in the US does not extend to the cheesecake variety.

There isn&#39;t a bad thing on the menu. Everything I have ever ordered is amazing! Great food and service. The parking is good too! Food is always quick and the servers are awesome! I don&#39;t recommend any certain thing on the menu because it&#39;s all so good.

Not only do they have any kind of cheesecake that you can think of, their food is amazingly delicious. They have something for everyone. There menu is probably an inch thick with everything from pastas, burgers, pizzas, steaks, seafoods literally anything you want. I love the jambalaya and the carbonara is great too. If you are looking for a good appetizer the Mac and cheese balls are awesome. The lemon raspberry cheesecake is a perfect finish to the awesome food. To full to eat desert take it home. Don&#39;t leave without a slice of cheesecake.

i&#39;ve been here a few times, but this was my first time coming here since they updated their menu to mark gluten free items.  i came with my cousin and it was a 20 minute wait.  we were told they were not seating anyone on the patio, so instead were seated in a nice booth inside right next to a window.  which was weird, because an hour later we saw like four tables outside on the patio eating.  besides that service was excellent.<br><br>i chose to get the GF pasta carbonara and it was seriously so good.  very creamy, rich, and savory.  it was a large portion and i ended up taking half to go.  my cousin got the thai lettuce wraps which she loved.  we decided to pass on dessert, but they have quite a selection if you choose to enjoy dessert.

This place is still one of the most popular teenage dating spot in Salt Lake even after the initial opening hypes die down over the years, so expect a wait longer than steakhouses.  The dim light and classy decors both sets the mood for your romantic conversations.  The service has been quite consistently good for all of my visits here.<br><br>As for the food, I truly believe they wanted to bring out your indecisiveness with the excessive number of items on their menu.  Every time I came here, their menu always overwhelmed me, and it took numerous processes of eliminations to figure out what I want to order.   If you are limited budget, I would recommend their Sunday Brunch, it actually has more food than dinner for lower price, and I personally enjoyed their Egg Benedict.  It is healthy, delicious, and I sure love a perfectly poached egg.<br><br>For dinner appetizer, I would go for the Spicy Ahi Tempura Roll.  It is not exactly a traditional Japanese dish, more like a Chinese-Japanese fusion with western plating, which to my surprise turned out very well.  Crunchy like egg rolls with texture like sushi~   The portion is huge, you may consider substituting that for the main course.<br><br>For those that just want to get a salad, I recommend the Seared Tuna Tataki Salad.  The fish and fresh vegetable just went well together.  For the actual main course, I would go for the Wasabi Crusted Ahi Tuna.  I could not tasted any spiciness in the wasabi, but the crust goes very well with the tuna, and the miso sauce rice underneath seem to go well with the dish overall.  I do believe they need to enhance the wasabi flavor more.<br><br>Now for the bad...  the steak is pretty bad here, I never had a single good experience with their meat dishes here.  They seem to have a tendency of overcooking them with poor seasoning... bland is the word I would use to describe them.   The pasta is next bad choice I experienced here.  I tried the Shrimp with Angel Hair and it was painfully flavorless.  I would however recommend the Thai Chicken Pasta, which was delicious.  Other dishes I tried tasted pretty average.<br><br>Cheesecakes are also hit or miss, the Tiramisu and Wild Blueberry cheesecakes were very good, but ones like Cherry, Key Lime, Pumpkin, and the Low Carb ones were very hard and bland.<br><br>Overall, if I only tried the good things in this place, I would be a fan, but after experience the bad, I have to average down the overall score.  I guess with a menu this big, you are bound to experience vicissitudes in your visits.
Most amazing restaurant and staff. Never fail to deliver a dining experience with excellent food and dessert.

Solid experience overall. Wait time is awful, but that&#39;s pretty status quo for the area on a Saturday. We tried a new appetizer, some truffle oil bacon cheese sticks and they were great. She got the salmon+shrimp and seemed to love it, I got an Italian combination plate and it was decent but nothing out of this world. Speaking of out of this world, the cheesecake was divine, as always. Will definitely return, albeit on a night where we&#39;re not in a hurry.

Shorter menu. I feel like I am reading the bible. Too many choices. Do one thing right. I like the avocado spring rolls and the shrimp scampi. The chicken Madeira is good but honestly the portions ate huge and I can never finish even half my meal. I am always too full to order cheesecake. Isn&#39;t that why people go there?

My favourite restaurant in Utah! The wait times can be quite long but are totally worth it! The menu is huge and caters to ALL tastes. I have never ordered anything that I haven&#39;t really enjoyed. The chicken costoletta and the pasta DaVinci are my favourite dishes with the salted caramel cheesecake being my favourite slice! Avocado egg rolls or factory chicken nachos are the best appetisers. Serving sizes are HUGE - you could totally share a meal of you aren&#39;t big eaters.
This place rocks. Everything I try is awesome. I&#39;ve never been disappointed. It&#39;s all so good. Can&#39;t wait to go back.

We haven&#39;t been to this location in over a year. The quality has really gone down hill. The entrees used to be so flavorful and tasty. Having ordered the same dishes we usually get, we were so disappointed. The crusted chicken romano did not taste like normal. Pasta was dry, lacking sauce and flavor. Chicken was dry, no flavor as well. Usually comes out moist. The shrimp scampi didn&#39;t have any flavor as well. Everything just tasted stale and old. Not sure what changed in the kitchen, but they need to fix it!

brought my family here for a nice lunch. was rudely greeted by the host behind the counter after standing there for about 10 minutes of being ignored. when asked how long it would be for 5 people he whispered his response and couldn&#39;t here i kindly asked again but was yelled at by the host who said &#34;we will call you when we are ready&#34;. i was a little shocked at my experience but waited to be called and looked forward to my lunch. the appetizer came out quickly and we ordered our food. after eating filling up on bread and sitting there for about 45 minutes waiting for our food to finally come, we had lost our appetites. we were very disappointed with our experience as we love coming here.

The place was super busy for on a Tuesday night. Had to sit up in the bar area or else it was going to be a 30 minute wait for a table. The drinks and food were delicious. Service was good too. No complaints. A+

I &#34;talked&#34; everyone into coming here for a birthday celebration amongst other places because I wanted it to be special (someplace they have never been before).<br><br>First of all we were given a 35 minute but it turned into maybe a 10 minute wait .<br>Our meals were delicious!<br>The cre&#39;me de la cre&#39;me was our waitress Michelle; not only did she make the night wonderful BUT she took the EXTRA time to understand what I wanted and how I wanted it.<br><br>Losing my voice 2 weeks ago has been so frustating, bursting into to tears, stuggling to communicate, at times dealing with people who become agitated trying to figure out what I am try to say but Michelle my girl you were the best and I hope the management reads this and recognize you as I have. <br>Kudos To Guys

This is for Cheesecake Factory in Murray. This has been the first bad customer service we&#39;ve had here his name was Gabe. Arrived here at 4 30 our waiter was not attentive at all did not bring us any of there yummy bread our had to ask then he said oh just came out of oven but yet no asking if needed any condiments no drink refills he was about to change shift s he was just hanging around bar visiting with the bar tender so didn&#39;t seem to care at all !!!!! Our waiter that took over his shift was great or we wouldn&#39;t have even tipped at all !! Then called talked to manager he didn&#39;t even ask my name or anything ?? Wasn&#39;t calling to get a free dinner or anything just to let them know of our service experience so that just shows you lack of customer service ???????

Salt Lake City has grown up a lot, in a culinary sense and nowhere is this more in abundance than this chain electing to finally land in this market. The city, in addition to badly needing an enema, also needs more upscale chains like this. The interior was nearly spot-on to a lot of the East coast locations I&#39;ve hit up and the only flaw I could find was the black coating peeling back on every one of the benches. Despite it being jammed, this location was also the least amount of time I&#39;ve ever waited to be seated at any of their restaurants. It&#39;s overall borderline artsy and tasteful and apropos for the lofty pretensions this chain has for itself. This is a very good representative restaurant of that, overall. <br><br>This extends to the food itself. Tons of alcoholic drinks on the menu and their annoying habit of including the Sunday-only stuff in the regular menu, but refusing to make any of it, unless you happen to be there on that day. That menu is extensive, but mostly a hodge-podge of standard Americana stuff, along with a bevy of questionable fusion ideas executed mostly poorly.<br><br>The hallmark of this chain, to me, is that everything, including the cheesecake, is one note off. This extends to the Coke Zero mix, to the soy ginger, remoulade, Thai peanut and Dynamite mayo sauce, to the &#34;tempura&#34; batter on the shrimp and on down. The warm bread basket was nice and the bread was flavorful. This, along with the perfectly done fries, was probably the best part of the entire thing. The shrimp batter tasted slightly off and refused to go nicely with any of those 4 sauces I mentioned. The Cuban rolls was an intriguing idea; combining a Cubano into a spring roll. In execution, though, it&#39;s basically like they stuck everything in to a blender, stuffed it into a rice wrapper and fried it to death. This also refused to go with sauces, but the idea of a Cubano, when done well, is that it wouldn&#39;t need to. In case it&#39;s not clear, this was not done well.<br><br>The mango key lime cheesecake was another disaster. Topped with artificial sugar whip, gloppy mango syrup, incredibly overdone key lime flavoring and next to no actual cheesecake taste, then mounted on a crust with bits of coconut that was itself a dense, overly thick chunky mess, it nearly defied eating. In fact, I bailed on it well before the end.<br><br>This is a place I meant to get to since it opened and while it took longer than expected for the stars to align both with me having opportunity and the lines dying down, I finally made it and now it&#39;s done, probably never to be repeated again. Given that it will typically be busy (wait line was out the door when we left), know going in this place will be rather loud and service will be very put upon and performance will drop accordingly.

Always love this place! The menu is so huge.  So many choices &amp; types of food for every mood. I do love the Teriyaki Chicken &amp; Chicken Madera are my personal favs! Drinks are also yum! Perfect for Birthdays or Anniversaries. Also makes a great date night! I&#39;m not a huge cheesecake fan but they have a lemon tort cream cake to die for!

Went for my sons birthday. We were greeted in a somewhat timely matter, drinks took over ten minutes to receive. The drinks from the bar were phenomenal but they didn&#39;t have ingredients to two drinks I wanted to try. <br>Appetizers were tastey, food looked and tasted delicious. But my son didn&#39;t care for his kids meal and we sent it back. Unfortunately, the waiter did not get the meal taken off the check. My husband paid, otherwise I would have said something. <br>Although the food was delicious, we didn&#39;t get a check back until we were almost finished. <br>I will come back with my husband to enjoy a quiet romantic meal next time

Not so great not sure what all the hype is about? They are always super busy though. Went in had the philly was sub par as the service was. I probably won&#39;t return but the place as far as cleanliness and nice looking goes is all there.

Horrible horrible wait times, they said 50-60 mins took over 90 mins to get a table. The people who finished eating need to just get up and move on with life if you see there are a ton of people waiting. There&#39;s a bunch of open tables available too not sure why they weren&#39;t seating people. Only reason this got bumped to a 2 Star was our waiter. Super nice and polite and kept checking up on us. Maybe he should be running the show...

I love The Cheesecake Factory Food, but their service was horrible today. Our male waiter ignored us and then passed us to another waiter who happened to be a girl. He knew he was getting no tip. I actually had to get up and ask who was our waiter and it was the guy i asked. He apologized and then 10 minutes later we ordered and then he gave us a new waitress. Pass the buck at its best.<br><br>So far she has been only a little bit more attentive. But that&#39;s something. She filled our waters. Then she asked what else we needed we asked for a refill of our son&#39;s drink and we were told it costs x amount of dollars for a refill. I said that&#39;s fine, but really? Who trains these waiters?<br><br>I worked as a hostess years ago, if any of our servers were this inattentive, they would&#39;ve been fired on the spot. <br><br>Customer Service and attentiveness will bring customers back. Sadly, not to this establishment. Glad we had a gift card.
We love the cheesecake but have never been very impressed with the food, especially for the price.

I like to visit the Factory of Cheesecake when I want something a little better then average on the food scale and I&#39;m willing to drop $60 in the process. <br>This happens about 4 times a year. I have never had a bad server, they are always professional waitstaff. I assume this is because of the average price per plate. <br>This last time we ordered off the Sunday brunch menu and I had a fabulous crab hash and my husband had a sinful French toast sammich of doom. <br>Of course both were amazing. I was a little annoyed by some burned peppers in the hash but it was overcome by yummy poached eggs and real chunks of crab. <br>The decor is dated and very Las Vegas but who really cares as long as it&#39;s clean and the food is good? <br>One beef I have is the community seating. I HATE the long bench and the tiny tables spaced out by a foot. It&#39;s really difficult for the servers, it&#39;s gross to be so close to strangers when you&#39;re eating and quite frankly whoever invented it has probably never had the flu. <br>But I&#39;ve learned to tell them up front to seat me at a booth and that I&#39;m fine waiting. Though I&#39;ve never waited at this location. Probably because I&#39;m a scary intimidating bitch that happens to be very polite and authoritative with my demands. <br>Of course I&#39;ll be back.

This was my first time ever eating here and I had a gift card. I would not have stopped by without it and honestly will not be back. First impressions: way to dark!! Bring a flashlight with you. Music way to loud, you&#39;ll be yelling just to have a conversation. Decor is weird, not very inviting. The tables are really close together!! Not only did I have to yell at the person sitting across from me, I also had the privilege of hearing 3 other conversations of the tables around me since we were pretty much sitting on top of each other. <br>The staff was pretty rude right from the start. The girls who take your name down were so condescending. We waited almost 15 mins for even a &#34;hello, would you like some water?&#34; from our waiter.<br>Menu is way too big!! Maybe it&#39;s just me and I believe in the beauty of simple, no nonsense, good eating. <br>Food is pretty medicore. My husband ordered fries with his hamburger, and the waiter forgot them. When we informed he, he seemed like he didn&#39;t care. It took 20 mins after he got his hamburger to get them.<br>I had the carbonara. I have had much better for a better price. <br>I think the waiter only checked on us once after the fries and that was to ask if we wanted to order dessert! We had run out of water. <br>The only good thing was the cheesecake!! I would order that again!! But next time, I will just pick it up and go home! <br>All in all, bad service, bad atomsphere, and really over priced mediocre food.

Now I know why I never come here. The service is absolutely awful. My friend and I came here one night after shopping at the mall. We came a little later than I would usually go out, but we were hungry and the first thing we saw was Cheesecake Factory. We walk in and I immediately ask if they were still serving and the hostess replied with a &#34;yes, we still have a few hours until close&#34;. Perfect! We get seated and we literally just sat there waiting for our server for 10 minutes before someone finally came. He took our drink order, and another 10 minutes past before we see him again. We get to ordering out meal and waited 45 minutes for our meal to be given to us. Mine was half cold, while my friend enjoyed hers. At this point I just want to go home. Anther 10 minutes to get our server to get us the check, another 10 minutes to get our cheesecakes, another 10 minutes to have the server correct a mistake on the bill, another 10 minutes for us to pay....you get the idea. We arrived around 9:00pm and left around 10:45pm. The food wasn&#39;t even worth the wait.

Come expecting tasty comfort food, a casual but noisy environment, and 30-minute or longer wait on Friday or Saturday nights and you won&#39;t be disappointed. The menu is epic, and the cooks deliver well on a surprising variety of foods. My favorite is the Shepherd&#39;s Pie.

By far the worst CheeseCake Factory around. Took 35 minutes to get drinks once ordered. Burger was over cooked, they asked and I told them med rare. Burger was well done. What&#39;s the purpose of asking if no one is listening? Fries are worse than Arctic Circle, strawberries were rotten, avocados were black, and to top it all off we had to fight fruit flies the whole time. Won&#39;t be going back anytime soon.

They specialize in cheesecake. Unfortunately this means that everything except the cheesecake is marvelously mediocre. Oddly enough, despite the food being meh, the lines are obnoxiously long - My theory is that they hire people to wait in line just so it looks like the food is good. I have no way to prove my theory but just like the moon landing hoax you can&#39;t always back up truth with facts.

We had a wonderful experience today. The food was excellent, but our waiter John P. made our experience even better. He was punctual, attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. The White chicken chili was delicious and it was guilt free for my diet. We&#39;ll be back!

We waited for an hour to get seated and when we finally did, it took another 2 hours to get ordered, get our food, get our dessert, and pay the check. I don&#39;t know why it took so long. Our waitress was moving like molasses. It felt like ages waiting for her to bring back our cheesecake. It was weird though cause some of the people she was also waiting on got seated after us, and somehow got out before us. It just seemed like we were her last priority. The food was good though. I got the grilled steak tacos. They were fresh tasting and the chipotle sauce with the guacamole on top was a nice touch. I always enjoy the bread they bring out too. A nice place to eat, when I&#39;m in the mood to have a long dragged out evening.

Any American dish or pasta is always done right. I love their steak Diane, it&#39;s cooked in a red wine reduction sauce with their delicious horse radish mashed potatoes.  <br><br>Anything Asian I&#39;ve noticed is good, but not amazing. Service is very friendly, but this place usually has a long wait on the weekends. Good place for a birthday party or a date. If you have a massive zit on your face, the dim lighting will make you appear more attractive ;-)

I&#39;ve always liked Cheesecake Factory. It just seems to be one of those places that fits any &#34;special&#34; occasion, whether it be a birthday, graduation, or a family reunion. In addition to its eclectic decor and snappily dressed staff, the restaurant&#39;s menu boasts more items than a Vegas buffet with a smorgasbord of dessert choices (not limited to cheesecake).<br><br>This time we went for my wife&#39;s birthday and there were 7 of us in tow. I am always anxious about going to restaurants in large groups as I tend to be the one on top of things who knows what he wants and knows that the sooner everyone orders, the sooner everyone is feasting. My sentiments do not seem to be universally (or even commonly) acknowledged, yet the staff at The Cheesecake Factory was helpful, patient, and responsive.<br><br>I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with buffalo sauce. It was delicious but no better than what you&#39;d expect at a sit-down restaurant. My wife had the salmon spring rolls and shrimp summer spring rolls. She initially ordered the ahi tartare (all of these items are on the Skinnylicious menu), but they were out of tuna. Odd for 4 pm on a Wednesday, but she decided on the rolls instead. She loved both of them. The rest of the orders were similarly enjoyed (eggplant Parmesan [huge!], margarita pizza, herb-crusted salmon, steak medallions, and chicken bellagio).<br><br>We also ordered seven slices of various cheesecakes, and there were no complaints there. The lovely waitress was cordial, quick with the drink and bread refills, and helpful to the finish. Nothing worth complaining about on this visit.

If you like to wait for a long time for food...come here. <br><br>Food is okay. I have definitely had better. <br><br>Always crowded. <br><br>It has been several years since my wife and I had been here and decided to give it another try. Last time she ordered the miso salmon and the rice was crunchy. <br><br>Still a disappointment. <br><br>They need to work on service, the speed of serving food and the quality of the food.

I had a horrible experience (read prior) but have since been contacted by the manager and received a gift card as an apology which I highly appreciate. I will leave this at 3 stars for now as I appreciate any company that tried to make amends, and will try again soon and post my experience. Thank you Cheesecake Factory for taking the proper steps thus far.

Wish I could do negative Stars!!! This establishment was unfriendly and unprofessional to the &#34;T&#34;. I called on a Monday for a Thursday reservation. I confirmed on Tuesday to confirm address and my party&#39;s # of people to attend which was 18! This was a Christmas lunch for my largest client, with the President and VP in attendance. I show up at 11:30 with all 17 guest to find out they had not written down my reservation, the manager remembers discussing with me but could not find where she had written it down..... extremely embarrassing for me, we had to go to Brio(Amazing Restaurant with the best staff amazing food, 10X better than this place) wait another 30 min. I will never take any of my clients to the cheesecake factory again or recommend it to my staff. Thank you for ensuring I nor my clientele to attend your hypocrisy of a restaurant again. Good Day,

I went there for my mom&#39;s birthday last year, really good customer service but wasn&#39;t all that impressed with the food. <br>Kind of over priced for little portions and a strange sweet flavor on EVERYTHING.
Only gets 3 stars because of the Cheesecake. Otherwise it would probably get two stars.   Very average steak.  Fish tacos were ok.  Meatloaf almost made it redeeming.  Not what it used to be.

I know it&#39;s a chain.  <br><br>But it serves some of the most amazing food ever.  And if you have a special request or dietary restriction, they not only honor it, the well versed servers will offer tasty suggestions!<br><br>I have NEVER been disappointed with any meal I have ordered at any Cheescake Factory.  That is why we keep coming back!  The servers are always friendly, knowledgable and aware of your table.  Never seem to run dry, which is a pet peeve of mine.<br><br>I have read some reviews that were frustrated with the wait time (which can be long, but  shopping at ZGallerie cuts down on that and is a pleasant distraction) and the closeness of the tables. It&#39;s a franchise people, you will have similar configurations at all Cheescake Factory locations.  Hardly seems worth complaining about.  You know what you are getting when you choose to dine at a Cheesecake Factory.  Now if want to wage a complaint against the 50 page menu...  Just kidding!<br><br>Oh, and did I mention the cheese cake?  To die for.  There.
Food was OK but there was hair baked in to the cheesecake. We took it to go so I couldn&#39;t send it back. It was very obvious as the end of the hair was sticking out of the side about an inch.

This review is for the location and service.  The food tastes the same no matter which location you eat at, and is always decent. <br><br>We went on a Saturday around 2:30. It took over an hour to get our food.  Other patrons that came in after us were served before us. My husband had a salad and I had a salad, soup, sandwich combo.  No excuse. The waitress kept coming back and saying she&#39;d go check to see what was taking so long, making comments about &#34;are they growing the lettuce back there?&#34;  Finally our meals came out.  Mine was wrong and my husbands was missing the dressing.  Took another 10 minutes to get the correct meals. He still didn&#39;t have dressing.  He was so upset by the time it came out he told them to just take it back. I ate mine because I was starving.  Thank goodness our kids weren&#39;t with us. Never going back.

When I walk into the Cheesecake Factory in Fashion Place,  I am struck by the high end ambiance.   This is supposedly just a family restaurant,  but it does not come across that way with the lighting,  the marble table tops and the art. I am also impressed by the extensive menu selections with the wide variety of food and what a big job the food preparers must have to keep everything so fresh. <br><br>I will start with the drinks.   We arrived at about 9pm.  The place was 75 % full.   That being said,  why does it take 15 minutes to have a glass of Pinot Noir delivered to the table?  I want to be able to relax with a drink and have a great conversation with my gorgeous date!   There needs to be more time to talk with a drink before we eat.  Bring the drinks within 5 minutes and let us talk for 15 minutes or so.  That is part of the enjoyment of having a drink before dinner. This is a problem with many Utah restaurants not just the Cheesecake Factory.  <br>Ok, so we order our food,  which was just the chicken nachos.   They were very good.   We really wanted to save room for the main event. ..the delicious cheesecakes! <br>After finishing the nachos,  we ordered the blueberry cheesecake and the snickers cheesecake.  The blueberry was very light and anything but ordinary.   Perfect finish when the meal is heavy cheese and chips.   The snickers cheesecake was the exact opposite!   Very rich and very heavy but oh so scrumptious!!  <br>Overall,  the food here is pretty good,  but is still just family style food with portions that I have found to be ridiculously large. The price is also a little high.  Service is ok, but not spetacular therfore,  I can only give it three stars.

I always order the Louisiana chicken pasta with no mushroom and extra cayenne pepper! It&#39;s a huge portion and tastes good the next day! My bf orders the chicken Madeira and everything about that dish is tasty the freshly  mashed potatoes, the asparagus and the chicken is so fresh! Once in awhile we&#39;ll order the Mac and cheese burger and THAT is amazing if you love Mac and cheese!

I like the feel of The Cheescake Factory (busy, clean, and nicely decorated) but was more impressed with the presentation than the actual taste of the food.  My lunch companion&#39;s chicken parm sandwich looked incredible yet he only ate half of it l.  The miso salmon I ordered looked delicious but the sauce could have used more miso and the white rice could have been stickier.  I however at least finished my plate.  We passed on dessert but I suspect the experience would have been similar.  Lots of flash with little substance.  Good thing I like flash...

The food I got was great, mac and cheese burger, wife got Belagio chicken and that was great, daughter got shrimp scampi and that was not good. She ate a shrimp and then wanted my wife&#39;s food, my wife took the shrimp and had one and said it wasn&#39;t good. I of course already finished my burger and always will finish theirs. So I took the plate and had one shrimp then did not eat anymore. The shrimp was way over cooked and dried out. Didn&#39;t even have a good flavor. I didn&#39;t bother telling the waitress. We won&#39;t get the shrimp there again. 1:30 pm 6-11-17

We had to walk out!  Customer satisfaction here is apparently of no real interest to the staff at this location. It&#39;s a beautiful sunny 75°F day here in Salt Lake.  We asked for a table outside.  They told us it would be a 30 min wait, because they only had one server outside and he already had 5 tables. We only went out to eat so we could sit outside and have an appetizer in the nice weather.  We explained this to the staff and asked them to check with the server if he would be willing.  They told us no and then said the wait would now be 55 min.  We could not wait for that because the sun would be down by then.  Instead of accommodating us they showed us the door.  As we left we could see that everyone on the patio was done being served and we could have been easily accommodated. We love this restaurant, but feel an apology from this establishment would be in order.

Third time being here and will be the last. Ribeye steak wasn&#39;t as good as the last two visits; lacking the marinated flavor. Chicken lettuce wrap is nothing compare to old Cafe Trang and on top of that, the lettuces still had dirt on them. Yuck!

I recently went here to celebrate my birthday with a co-worker.  To my surprise, there wasn&#39;t a ridiculously long wait.  We even got a booth!  Yes!  We didn&#39;t have to sit at one of those tiny tables that is so close to the next you feel like you&#39;re having lunch with the people next to you.<br><br>However!  Our excitement quickly dwindled when we received the slowest service possible.  After we received our drinks and placed our order it felt like oserver disappeared.  We saw other servers going back and fourth re-filling drinks, but not ours.  On several occasions I wanted to switch servers.<br><br>In addition, my co worker and I were joined by several flies.  I counted nine at one point.  I&#39;m not sure if these flies came in when the doors were open, but they were desperately trying to get out using the window at our booth.  After many attempts to escape, they refueled their bodies with microscopic portions of our meals.  Or, just left us gifts of exhaustion.<br><br>Overall, it was an unforgettable celebration.

The looks and environment of this place were definitely deceiving. I was at this place Saturday March 10, 2018 at 10 PM. They sat my wife and I down after a 35 minute wait which wasn&#39;t too bad. I didn&#39;t appreciate the tiny table they sat us down on.  The people next to us were dropping silverware on the floor the tables were that small.  My wife ordered the lemon basil chicken and I ordered the parmesan herb crusted chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans. Mashed potatoes and green beans with an Italian dish, should have been a red flag. I received the dish to discover soggy paste on one side of the chicken and nothing on the other side. The green beans and mashed potatoes were ok. The Cheesecake Factory failed on the parmesan herb crusted chicken, it wasn&#39;t right at all and the price tag was high at $17.95.  The service we received from our waitress was good but this place is not top of the barrel as it appeared. If you like cheesecake and paying to sit in a decent environment this place is for you. Otherwise I recommend pass on this place, the food is terrible.

My wife and I came at me here yesterday. We waited the one hour wait time to be seated for our valentines dinner date. Our food was satisfying. The bacon bacon cheese burger was awesome.  The reason for the one star is because we paid with a gift card and paid our tip with the same gift card, there was suppose to be a remaining balance enough to put towards a piece of cheesecake. I went to order the cheesecake at the front where it&#39;s served. When I gave the cashier the card it was denied. I checked the balance and it was at $0.00. I asked for the manager. The manager checked the balance and told it must have been some miscommunication or computer error. He wasn&#39;t able to put the credit back to the card but did get me my piece of cheesecake. For the service received I will not be returning to this location.

Their portion sizes are huge! But if you ever go on a weekend evening prepare for a wait that is more than likely over an hour! The biggest down side is the long wait every evening. And they got rid of the apple streusel cheesecake :(

Friendly staff!! It&#39;s hard to find a place that can please everyone... The kids, the adults, me! But the CCF does! And just because the menu is extensive doesn&#39;t mean they make large quantity without quality!<br>I love their Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp for a delicious Thai style dish. Not to powerful of curry spice, but a nice sweet balance with coconut.<br>And I love their Kale and Quinoa salad. Filling and healthy. The grapes and lemon zest add a fruity kick that keeps it tasting light!<br>And of course the desserts! Chris Outrageous Cheesecake is truly... Outrageous!!! Coconut, chocolate, pecan, CHEESECAKE!! I mean, come on!!
Honestly I feel a bit overrated. The drinks were good..but then the steak wasn&#39;t very good. I feel like the food is very overpriced for what is provided. The staff is nice though.
