I love coming to this cheesecake factory on random nights just to pick up a slice of cake, or an order to take home.  They are very good with their &#34;curbside pick up&#34; and I am usually very happy when i get home and open up my food!   Some of their appetizers and food are on the greasy side, but then again I when I order from here I am ordering with that expectation of getting a rich meal.  I creature of habit, and always end up getting the same things that I love (Chicken piccata and the Hershey&#39;s chocolate bar cheesecake).  No need to change it up when i know what i like :P

If you&#39;re ok waiting for a table for an hour then this is the place for you! Other than long wait times, the food is amazing and so is the service. Portion sizes are huge and I&#39;ve never been disappointed with anything. The sweet corn cakes are my favorite as well as the cheesecake.

Good experience, very good service and the food as always is on point. Rich, comfort food. Don&#39;t come here complaining about its not healthy, that&#39;s not what they are about. Only thing for me personally, I prefer a booth here and not a table. The tables are too close, the people next to us were staring at us at times while we were in conversation. Get a booth.

Ordered the cheese steak sandwich to go. It was the most horrible cheese steak sandwich I&#39;ve ever had and the fries were ice cold. $14 for the sandwich I will never go here again. I know they&#39;re known for their amazing desserts and they are good but the prices are so outrageous why would you buy them? Costco has an amazing chocolate cake that&#39;s just as good as theirs and their caramel cheesecake is only fifteen dollars for the whole thing
Food came right on time delivery guy was super nice everything was still warm and yummy

There is something for everyone here. All the food is good, service is good and the menu is vast. You can bring kids, grandparents and foreigners here - they will all be pleased! Never a bad meal here!

Delicious every time with good service and usually not an incredibly long wait. I&#39;ve been to this location several times and it never disappoints. Generally I take cheesecake to go if I actually eat dinner there because their portions are gigantic. I also tend to bring home a doggie bag. I definitely recommend it!

The cheesecake factory is fun place to visit once and a while. <br> It&#39;s always takes 1/2 to an hour to get a table and the noise in it makes it hard to talk to anyone.  <br><br>The menu is really big and makes it hard to decide what to pick, especially when you are hungry.   The food is good but read the descriptions.  They may do things a little different than what you are expecting.<br><br>If you  have the time and the money take a trip to the cheesecake factory.

Restaurant: 2 stars. Cheesecake: 5 stars. <br><br>Lots of hype for this restaurant, and I was disappointed. <br><br>First of all, they don&#39;t take reservations, which comes off as pretty arrogant for a restaurant. So you have to wait for what&#39;s usually quite a long time.<br><br>Then they give you the famous novel of a menu, which is chock full of a huge selection of mediocre food. I&#39;ve tried a lot of it over the years at different locations across the states, and never found anything to write home about. <br><br>The service has never impressed me too much, and more than once I&#39;ve had a negative experience. <br><br>BUT (and this is a big but) that cheesecake is awesome. Fantastic. Delicious. Divine. <br><br>So here&#39;s what I do &amp; what I recommend: go get a slice of Cheesecake to go. Then you experience all of the good and avoid all of the bad. Mmm, cheesecake.

Food is delicious but the service is way too slow. These servers have too many tables to take care of any of their guests.  My waitress forgot to get us bread 3 times, didn&#39;t put the appetizer order in before my main course and took forever to get us anything.  No refills. Ever.  Then I ordered dessert and it took 15 minutes to get me the check and then 10 more after she took my money to get us the desserts.  Who is running this place? Seems like inexperienced back of house managers.  I&#39;m usually not such a harsh critic, but my girls were there so long they could not stay awake waiting for the check.  The food was amazing but the expierence was poor. If you have an extra 2.5-3 hours then it should be okay for you.

My husband and I went for on a Thursday for lunch and the service was AMAZING! We felt truly valued as customers. Even though we had a newly hired waiter on his first shift, he did an amazing job of making sure we were comfortable and that the food was to our liking. He was extremely knowledgable of the menu items and gave good recommendations. There were a few hiccups with getting menus but they quickly fixed the problems. My husband&#39;s hamburger was absolutely to die for and the chicken thai curry I had had just the right amount of sweetness and spiciness. The chicken was so tender! We had a wonderful experience here and will definitely be coming back to this location!
We visited Cheesecake Factory for the first time tonight and we WILL be back. Great food, great drinks and great service! Lacey was great!! Oh, and the cheesecake is great too!

Being President&#39;s Day, we decided to get there early, and we were glad we did! For a party of two our wait was still an hour, but we expected this to be the case. Luckily the mall attached has some great stores. Our waiter was great, extremely friendly and accommodating. After perusing the 50 page spiral-bound menu, we finally made our decisions. About half an hour after we ordered, the complementary bread came. Long wait, but at least the bread was warm. Shortly after we received our appetizer - the factory nachos. Holy massive plate of food batman! Unfortunately, the chips were grease-laden....literally dripping in oil, and the cheese was hard and coagulated, and also incredibly greasy. On the bright side, the guacamole tasted fresh and the pico de gallo was pleasant. Four chips in and we were already full. When our entrees finally came, the California Guacamole Superfood Salad had to be sent back because the order was incorrect, but the waiter was accommodating and friendly about it. Once the right salad came, overall I didn&#39;t have any complaints. It wasn&#39;t anything that would wow you, but at least it was fresh. My husband ordered the Factory Burrito, I believe it was called. It was literally 14 inches long and 5 inches wide, so he of course was initially thrilled at how much food there was. However, the burrito ended up being a soggy mess of a tortilla smothered in tepid red sauce and wrapped around a massive, mushy mound of flavored rice. Unfortunate. I will say though, both of us agreed that the endless lemonade was fantastic. It&#39;s too bad they changed their policy and don&#39;t let you change flavors once you order. <br><br>When we asked for our check, the waiter looked sad and asked if everything was alright, looking and the vast array of food still left on our plates. Of course we told him it was okay, we were just full. Since we were paying with gift cards, we weren&#39;t about to complain about leaving with full stomachs and wallets. We also got some Oreo cheesecake to go. <br><br>Overall, it was your typical chain restaurant experience. An extensive menu and huge portions typically means low-caliber food, so we weren&#39;t surprised.

I have never given any restaurant one star, but the Cheesecake Factory in Murray is very deserving of a one star review <br><br>My husband and I went to Cheesecake for dinner because we had $100 in gift cards there. We paid for our $44 meal, only to find out that they lost our gift card before they ran it, leaving our meal unpaid for. We sat for an hour and a half, waiting for some action to be taken. Finally, the manager said that she was sorry they lost our $100 gift card, and &#34;we would just have to take our losses.&#34; After we explained that we thought that was very unacceptable that they weren&#39;t willing to replace what was left on our gift card, she said the best she could do was give us a $25 gift card, and it would come out of our waiters pocket. <br><br>Wow. Just wow. Our waiter looked tirelessly for our gift card, and was stellar at taking care of us. I find it awful that a SENIOR manager would ever be so unwilling to replace our gift cards, and then later say she would do it at the expense of her own employee!! <br><br>After some discussion, she gave my husband the $25 gift card, and he called to see the balance of the card. It was zero-- in fact she had never even activated card, which the employee on the phone told us must happen in order to add money on the card. So not only this SENIOR MANAGER refuse to replace our gift cards initially, and later said she would give us $25 after losing $100, but she never even put money of the gift card!! <br><br>I&#39;m extremely disappointed in the management and cannot believe that they would treat customers like that. We will definitely never be going to Cheesecake Factory ever again, and will be sure to share this story freely with everyone and anyone that wants to hear it. <br><br>The one star is for the delicious food and awesome server we had. Cheesecake management gets a -5 stars.

Today we went around 11:30 for my sisters birthday. We waited about 45 minutes for our food to come out. I ordered the brunch special and it was not so good. It came with their maple butter and this was purely just melted unsalted butter. We asked the waiter for syrup explaining that the maple butter had no sweetness and no flavor. He said &#34;sorry that&#39;s all we have&#34;. At this point I was unable to eat my pancakes because they were now smothered in melted unsalted butter. Not a pleasant experience. I think the chefs may need to taste what they are bringing to the table. :/
Avacado egg rolls are suprisingly really good, Cuban sandwiches, thin crust Cicilian pizzas. I don&#39;t even like cheesecake but I  don&#39;t go here for the cheesecake anyway.

Typically a great stop. My wife and I usually get take out and have had fairly good luck with getting the correct items that we ordered. However, there have been times where we didn&#39;t get what we asked for. Also, they are sometimes out of bread.. what restaurant runs out of bread? Overall, super yummy, somewhat over priced, and service is meh.

The worst fish and chips I&#39;ve ever tried to eat. Greasy greasy nasty disgusting. Tempura fried grease. Fine dining prices for low quality food. Service is desperately lacking. I really don&#39;t know why anyone comes here more than once

I have been to this location a few times and every time it was definitely a 5 star visit but the last time I came in was awful. The food was really good, but we received horrible service. We were seated almost immediately and were greeted not long after by, I guess, a manager because they were not in a server uniform. They got our drink and food order. Our food came out fairly quick but I never got a beverage I asked for even asking and reminding them several times. The entire time we had no idea who our server was and felt ignored. I still left a $7 tip because I, myself, am a server and realize sometimes when you go out you just get a bad experience once in awhile. Don&#39;t know if I&#39;ll be coming back as it wasn&#39;t worth the $50 I spent here.

My wife and I haven&#39;t been out for a night out in a long long time and we came here because it was good the last time we were here. Tonight the wait time was 1.5 hours and when we got our food the bread was hard as a ROCK seriously I tried to break the bread with my hand and it was as hard as a rock! Also my orange chicken was very dry and tasteless. Probably won&#39;t be back, one to somewhere else...

Went to the Murray Cheesecake Factory with my family Sunday Afternoon.  There were 5 of us.  Unfortunately the waitress misunderstood my order and brought the wrong dish.  They were very nice and gave me a salad while I waited for my meal.  The manager came and apologized and compt the meal.  We asked for a takeaway for the part I didn&#39;t finish.  She said she would box it for me.  She brought it back in a nice container with a bag to take home.  When I went to have it for dinner tonight, I found that it was not my dinner!  They gave me the wrong meal!  The parmasian herb crusted chicken is excellent if you can get it.  I will never let them box my leftovers again.  Now I need to figure out what to have for dinner.<br><br>Update.  Called the restaurant and told them what happened.  They wanted to make it right and are mailing us a gift card.  I guess I will get to try it again.

The food was mediocore...not too hot, not too warm. They dropped off my daughters kids meal without fries so they could bring out &#34;fresh&#34; ones then the waitress didn&#39;t even check back with us for drink refills OR bring the fries to her. So at the end of the meal, she asks us if we want dessert, we tell her about the fries and she says well do you want them to go? No, I want it off my check. Meaning, the kids meal...she got the manager to take $1.75 off our bill. Poor service, poor food, I won&#39;t be going back. Such a disgrace to the chain. BLAH!!!!

Went here while I was visiting Utah for a few days and I was pretty disappointed. As most people can tell from my reviews, I&#39;m not a foodie and don&#39;t typically go to fancy schmancy restaurants. I like the Cheesecake factory, but this location left me a bit sour.<br><br>There were two issues - the wait was atrocious and since it was a bit cold outside, everyone just stood inside elbow to elbow, with people walking in between everyone trying to get their name in or just leave after eating. The second issue I had was the proximity of our table to other tables. I went here with a buddy and we could hear almost word for word the conversations on both sides of us. I don&#39;t mind a somewhat noisy restaurant, but I shouldn&#39;t be able to hold hand with two total strangers on both sides of me without even trying to reach.

Typical overpriced so so food. <br>In Any other state rather than Utah the full bar would make a difference however here they actually serve 1oz instead of the legal allowed 1-1/2 oz. they charge roughly the same money as rather would in other states for a watered down cocktail. I had a steak. Much better meals around for about 20-30% less. Also it&#39;s very noisy.

I&#39;ve never tried anything except for the crusted chicken parmesean.  I was lucky enough to order something I loved on my very first visit and I see no reason to risk it.  This last trip was even better than normal because in addition to the always amazing chicken parmesean and delicious dulce de leche cheesecake, we had a really awesome server!  It was just a quiet night out and she was the most memorable part of the dinner.  Kudos!

Had the chicken tacos the tortillas didn&#39;t hold the chicken it fell through the chicken didn&#39;t taste good it dripped all over my expensive shirt they didn&#39;t give my salad to me correctly they brought the salad back three times before they had it right.<br>They said to make up for the problems they would give me free cheesecake. But they only brought the bill and scattered.<br>Not planning on going back!

Another visit to The Factory. Breakfast this time...Father&#39;s Day, with a reservation. We were seated quickly, and promptly given the list of everything on their relatively small breakfast menu that they were out of that day. <br><br>The breakfast food looked pretty, but was well beyond dismal: my California Omelette was virtually tasteless (including the fresh avocado -- ??), the cubed breakfast potatoes, with their only flavor being &#34;burnt,&#34; landed somewhere between gluey-chewy and rock-hard. The coffee, including all two refills, was lukewarm. The scrambled eggs were rubbery. The fresh-squeezed orange juice and the hot chocolate, however, both received loud praises. <br><br>Our waiter was the only truly flawless part, with his Osmondesque smile, and his delightful personality. No missteps on his part at all - he worked his butt off for us. He even quickly fetched the Manager when things went South, so he could come out and apologize personally. He also comp&#39;d one meal that took forever coming out. The two stars are for the service.<br><br>For the first time (and likely last time) ever, I walked out of The Factory without being full.

I went there with my daughter the night of the Super Bowl. The resturant was not busy. Our waiter was named Leonardo.  He was rude and this was the worst service I have ever had there. We waited a long time for drinks and when I asked for bread. He replied &#34;Hey the people across from you have waited longer than you and I already told you I had put your order in&#34;. His tone was rude, abrupt and uncalled for! I ordered two pieces of Cheesecake and when I referred to it by a similar name, he laughed, corrected me and then rolled his eyes. I didn&#39;t want to make an issue at the resturant as it was my daughter&#39;s special night. On the way home I asked my daughter how she thought the service was and she replied &#34;poor&#34;. I called and spoke to Kacey, a manager. He said he would call back after he talked to Leonardo. Kacey didn&#39;t. I called and talked to another manger and he said &#34;they meant to call and this is Leonardo&#39;s style... to be causal with patrons&#34;. The service; both from Leonardo and the management was VERY POOR and DISAPPOINTING!!! I do not believe the management dealt with our concerns. They brushed it aside considering my bill was paid and I had already left the premise. I have eaten several times at the Cheesecake Factory and strongly feel the service has gone down hill. I would NOT recommend Cheesecake Factory, high prices and terrible service.
Umm. I love Cheesecake Factory! Such a big menu that there is something for everyone.

This was our first time there and was told 1 hour and 45 minutes for a table. I was able to get 2 seats at the bar after 20 minutes. The bartender hands you a book of a menu and the restaurant is so dark inside that I had to use my phone flashlight to read the menu. I  looked around while there and noticed 4 other people reading the menu with their phones also. The price of a  pint glass of Bud Light was $5.75 each. I  ordered the gumbo pasta and it was not good, wrong kind of noodles if you ask me.  We did buy a piece of cheese cake which was the only thing good about the visit. Over rated restaurant and I won&#39;t be back anytime soon

If you&#39;re looking for a place to satisfy a number of different tastes, Cheesecake Factory is the place. They have a vast menu that hits anything you could possibly be in the mood for. The Chicken Waffle Benedict is fabulous for brunch. The syrup for the waffle tastes like buttery toffee, it&#39;s incredible. I enjoy the Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls are fresh and full of flavor. I really enjoy the Fried Macaroni and Cheese, it&#39;s the perfect consistency of cheesy goodness with a light panko coating. You can definitely feast on appetizers here. As far as entrees go, you can&#39;t go wrong with the Miso Salmon or Chicken Picatta. My sweetheart loves the Cuban Sandwich and he gets it with Sweet Potato Fries. His favorite dessert is Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake. I&#39;ve tried a number of the cheesecake selections and am doing my best to try them all though the Key Lime Cheesecake is one of my absolute favorites and the Pumpkin Cheesecake is my favorite during the holidays. Give Cheesecake Factory a try, you won&#39;t be disappointed.

Today me and my boys went to the cheesecake factory at the fashion place mall. We came during lunch time and didn&#39;t have to wait for a table at all. We were sat upon walking in right to a booth. Our waitress ( Nicole) was very accommodating, loved her service! I&#39;m allergic to tree nuts and I had ordered the Thai lettuce wraps. I have never tried it before but she recommended this dish as something light and refreshing. She talk to the cook about my allergies to tree nuts and had different sauces served on the side that I could try. It was really good and I recommend it! One of my sons had the chicken Marsala and the other had the three cheese chicken pasta. Our males were served in a timely manner within 15 minutes. Now that to me as service. We all loved their dishes we had ordered. My sons each ordered a dessert, I was to full! one ordered the strawberry shortcake and the other the chocolate tower mousse cake Yum.... the boys were happy!!

I feel like it was just okay for the price, I would rather eaten at Carrabbas or something. food was kinda bland and the noodles didn&#39;t really have any sauce, the shrimp I had still had sand in it, the Manger said it&#39;s not possible because they devein it but it was obvious that there was sand, the waitress was really nice, attentive and understanding, the cheese cake is really good, probably will only come back for the cheesecake, the cheesecake and waiters are the reason I give this place 3 stars, in my honest opinion way over hyped, overpriced and not worth it.

First of all... our server was TERRIBLE.  I think one of the worst servers I have had.  I had to ask several times just to get a refill on my water. I mean COMEON MAAAN.  The food was ok but waaaaaaay over priced.  I got a quesadilla and it wasnt even worth taking a picture of.  $9.95 for cheese and tortilla.  I asked them to hold the green onions, in translation that meant also hold the green chilies I guess.  Then when our server brought our food back that he boxed up, he threw it on the table and walked away.  Not here you go and set it down it was a throw on the table and walk away.  It took everything I had no to make a scene.  If I were you.... go to Olive Garden (which is in the same parking lot) instead.

I am really not a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. There are so many better places to go just in that shopping area. I dont like their huge menu and I feel like because of that they don&#39;t cook anything excellently, everything is mediocre.

I know that there are a lot of food snobs who scoff at the idea of eating at a chain restaurant, but you can&#39;t help but give some props to Cheesecake Factory.  Nowhere else have I ever gone into a restaurant and gotten mentally tired from reading a menu.  Okay, that may not seem like a perk, but the novel-esque menu just shows why it&#39;s such a wonderful place to take a large group of people who happen to have very differing food preferences.  <br><br>Personally, I get overstimulated when reading the menu so I typically a) determine how hungry I am, b) shove the novel, i mean menu, aside and c) choose one or two of the following: <br><br>- fried macaroni and cheese balls <br>- ahi carpaccio <br>- miso salmon <br>- the navajo <br><br>I know it seems kind of lame that I stick to the same things on the menu, but sometimes I really enjoy tried and true foods.  While I enjoy my meals here immensely, it&#39;s not enough to justify waiting between 1-2 hours to get seated.  Luckily, it&#39;s located close to the mall so I can get some shopping done in the mean time.  <br><br>Now... I&#39;ve mentioned this before, but I still have yet to try cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory.  I know it seems wrong, but after the tremendously long wait, I have a tendency to down my food fairly quickly and find myself far too full to have cheesecake.  Or... in those rare cases when I&#39;m having a huge sweet tooth craving, I get Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake.  I know, it seems wrong, but haven&#39;t you ever seen Matilda when Miss Trunchbull makes the fat kid devour a huge chocolate cake?  Well, this cake is what I imagine that cake tasted like, I just prefer eating it in smaller quantities.  <br><br>Maybe one of these days I&#39;ll see what the big hype is over the cheesecake?

The food is phenomenal!  If the review was based on food, it would definitely get 5 stars!  This restaurant is extremely dim inside.  When we dined there last night there were people getting their cellphone flashlights to read the menu!  Crazy dim!  Our waitress was incredibly kind. She was punctual and made sure everything was going well.  At the end of the dinner she took my husband&#39;s credit card and disappeared for several minutes.  Apparently she set it down and left it somewhere, her manager picked it up.  Needless to say that was uncomfortable but, it all worked out.  We will be watching our credit card closely for fraudulent transactions.
Decent food, but SO overpriced. I&#39;d rather spend this kind of money at a fancy, nicer restaurant. The cheesecake is good, but the price for everything else is still ridiculous.
Service was very average. My soup and sandwich were good. The cheesecake I ordered here was below average. No, I wouldn&#39;t come back.

We came to celebrate a birthday and found it to be ok.  It took a very long time to be seated, served, and to get our bill.  The food was ok.  We have been here when it was better, but tonight struggled.  Several in our party actually sent their food back.  Overall I would say it was ok, but we won&#39;t be rushing back soon.

The hostess people are worthless. We waited an hour. I knew it was busy so I was OK. After the hour I reminded them and was told they paged me forever. I was freaking sitting next to them. Why the hell do you take names if you don&#39;t use them? The waiter service was excellent and the food was superb but the hostess need better training. I will not go back to this location.

Service, service, service and I am not saying the kid didn&#39;t try. I too work in a kitchen and it seemed the server was overwhelmed by the amount of tables given to him on a Friday night, he struggled to open wine for the table I was at and luckily a neighboring server jumped in to show him how to do it, I could tell the guy was trying though, he was friendly and enthusiastic. The chicken and biscuits didn&#39;t come like I had ordered it prior to this dining experience (at this same location, same menu item last summer) the carrots were severely undercooked and still crunched when you bit into them, the crab and artichoke dip was Luke warm and the bread was severely (cut the roof of your mouth) stale and dry. I knew the kitchen was swamped that night so didn&#39;t send anything back or complain. Just sourly paid my $40 bill for an app/main and left, a bit dissatisfied

The environment is fun and eye catching but the food is starting to go downhill in my opinion.  We use to really look forward to coming here but now it seems like we go if we have no other option.  I feel like the menu items are geared around taste and high caloric intake and sometimes they win. No longer a favorite.  I especially do not like being treated like a less than for not consuming alcohol.  I am fully aware that your tip will not be near as high, but please have some respect for water.

You really cant go wrong with the cheesecake factory,I try to come at an odd time to avoid the long wait. I really haven&#39;t explored much of the menu because I have my favorite go to meal. It starts with the mac and cheese balls which are amazing, I&#39;ve tried to recreate this with no such luck, next I get the chicken madera, it comes with two huge chicken breasts and a large portion of mashed potatoes with asparagus all toped off with mozzarella cheese, this dish is definitely one to be shared. Cheesecake is a must here even if it&#39;s to be taken home for later.

You have to admire any chain restaurant that will outright admit to being a factory that mass produces food items.  Sure, we know this is the case with all chains, but heck I&#39;m going to give them a pass on this and one other factor - they do really have cheesecake (as is also suggested in their name) and plenty of it!<br><br>I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory maybe 3 times.  And it has always been okay, but not really anywhere I can say I am likely to actually choose to go of my own volition, I&#39;ve only really been for group or family events.  In fact my criteria for going is simple:<br><br>1. Someone else is paying.<br>2. I can get a couple of bites of cheesecake mixed into my dining experience.<br>3. (And most important) - If it prevents any chance of having to visit the Olive Garden I&#39;ll throw all other criteria straight out of the window.<br><br>So with the stage now set, I can say that today&#39;s visit really was not too bad.  What I do know about this chain is the portions are HUGE, so I generally order the &#39;lunch&#39; items, which are more moderate portions if your definition of that is a medium sized banquet.  And of those, the meat loaf is the best one in my experience, it is actually pretty darn good and ultimately why they get 3 stars here.  Fish and Chips is definitely somewhat MEH - so avoid if that&#39;s the fix you are looking for!<br><br>I also must say, I&#39;m a fan of Cheesecake, however deserts in general are also a fan of my waste line so I try to avoid as much as possible.  But the ones I&#39;ve tried here, particularly the seasonal and specialty ones do hit the spot.  Peppermint candy cheesecake anyone?  Yummy.  Lot better than it sounds!<br><br>Service was very friendly, and overall prompt considering how busy it was, certainly nothing too much to complain about here.  The overall ambiance is also pretty good - if I have one complaint - it&#39;s that the music can be a little too loud and overwhelming at times.  I&#39;m not however going to take a star for that, I tend to be a bit of an audiophile, and I think that, combined with age is making me somewhat sensitive about what I tend to consider &#39;irritating&#39; background noise.  For the younger crowd it could be great.<br><br>If you&#39;ve never been, definitely give it a try.  Just beware of those portions if you&#39;re on any type of diet (and I suspect, not just portions, but all the other food pyramid busting goodness lovingly cooked in at the factory!!!!).
A little over-priced, the menu is extensive, and the food is mediocre. The cheesecake is obviously delicious, and the food portions and drink portions are very large.

Food was great, the service was awful. One of our party has a severe garlic allergy and when we asked about specific ingredients our waiter rolled his eyes at us and was rude.Bottom line this is poor customer service. We also were not offered refills on our iced tea. This is the first time ever that I have not left a tip.

I just wanted some cheesecake to go and thought I could duck in, grab some desert and duck out. <br>Poor organization made this impossible. Customers waiting for a table are forced to stand in front of the case and register. There is no signage to say where to order or pick up take out, and the congestion of people behind the counter are in each other&#39;s way. It was a total mess and took way too long. I tipped when I ordered and paid but seriously felt like I paid for service I didn&#39;t get. 20+ minutes to pick up a slice of cheesecake, after I ordered is ridiculous!

All of the waiting staff was great and helpful, making apologies when my FIL&#39;s meal was delayed and offering to bring him a salad while he waited. The food was also great. This review is for the management. The waiters felt short staffed and slow to come back to the table, as we could see him running all over the place. So one of the managers, Casey, was helping from time to time. Two of my kids had ordered apple juice. When I asked Casey for a refill for them, he said they weren&#39;t refillable, something that was never told to me in the first place, nor is it mentioned on the kids menu. Soda, milk, apple juice, lemonade are all on the same line for kids drinks. So after going back and forth with me, me saying I would not order them a non refillable drink, him saying he would get them something else, me saying just give them a lemonade, him saying what kind, me saying whatever is refillable, him saying they all are, I said get them a raspberry and he said he would take care of it. Then he ordered it and the people at the end of our table heard him say, &#34;charge this table for two kids raspberry lemonades.&#34; Sure enough when the bill came, we were changed for the lemonades and had to point it out and get it taken off the bill. At another point in the night, needing refills again, he asked what we were drinking and I said my drink, my MIL&#39;s drink, and also another drink needed to be refilled. His reply was he only has two hands in an annoyed tone. Really? Wouldn&#39;t that be super rude of me to give him two drink orders at a time and wait for him to come back to tell him others? He was so ill-mannered and I needed to ask my MIL to not tell him off. I didn&#39;t feel the need to exacerbate an already absurd situation. Casey needs some serious customer service training. He comes across as a total jerk in the way he responds. If you&#39;re going to have both refillable and non-refillable drinks on a menu, be sure to note it and that your staff is trained to state it. If you&#39;re going to &#34;take care&#34; of a mistake, make sure your staff actually takes care of it, instead of telling the customer one thing and then doing another and hoping they don&#39;t notice.

I love the Cheesecake Factory but last night was horrible. Our waiter came and took our order. She only came back once to let me know they ran out the spicy chicken and never came back. No one ever came and asked us how the food was. One girl came by and took our bread even though we were still eating it. We had to ask the waiter next to us to get us water. After 45 mins a random waiter came and ask us if we needed boxes and tried to take my plate while I was still eating. I was very disappointed in the service and food. When we left I told my friend it was a waste of an hour to drive to the Cheesecake Factory. Most likely will never go back again.

Cheesecake Factory serves some of the most amazing food ever!<br>I have been going to CF for about 10 years.<br>In the 10 years I have been visiting this fine restaurant I have never had a bad meal.<br>the food is fabulous the wait staff is courteous.<br>Love this place!!

I don&#39;t get how you can go to Cheesecake Factory, order a cheeseburger like you&#39;re in some Applebee&#39;s or something, and then rate the entire restaurant two stars.<br><br>We got two small plates, the crispy cheese and the pretzel crusted chicken, which were INCREDIBLE, along with a main dish split. We ordered the Chicken Bellagio, which is a basil pasta with crispy chicken cutlets, prosciutto, arugula and Romano cheese. So good. Perfectly paired flavors. Totally kind staff. <br><br>You can easily split an entree here. And for an appetizer, a huge dinner, and chocolate mousse cheesecake to go for later, our bill was $30. You can&#39;t argue with that. It&#39;s heaven.

Cheesecake Factory is a chain that I do enjoy dining at from time to time, mostly on lunch while at work during the week. I have visited this location maybe 3 times in the past 2 years, most recently today!<br><br>The wait is always long. I was surprised that there is still a huge line out the door even though they have been open for some time now. We opted to sit at the bar where we found 3 seats readily available and enjoyed some great lunch conversation and hijincks with some older gentlemen sitting off to our left. The bartenders gave us exceptional service the entire time and were attentive and talkative, but not overbearing in their recommendations.<br><br>I feel like the menu at Cheesecake Factory is incredibly overwhelming with too many choices and the ads especially bug me, but the dishes I have tried are delicious and prepared well. My favorite is the lunch portion (which is still enormous) of the pasta da vinci. I also like the stuffed mushrooms on the small plates menu and the passion iced tea is flavorful. <br><br>I never order cheesecake because the slices are humongous and the calories in one are probably two days worth of your daily allowance, but it looks very, very delectable.

Even though this place is a chain, I still like their Cajun Chicken littles,which are not so little. Mmmmhmm yum!! Talk about good fried chicken with great flavor, you have to try this dish out! They also put a lot of food which I end up taking some left overs of the not so littles with me.  I usually order it with their fries and that dish turns out always always good!  I am not a big fan of their cheesecakes, it is often to heavy for me, and too rich. Customer service is often good, just like any other restaurant sometimes there is a bad apple, but not usually.

Yes, it was Mother&#39;s Day.  The restaurant was busy but the wait was only 10 minutes.  My husband ordered pancakes and poached eggs.  After a 30 minute wait for food, everything on his plate was cold.  The waitress apologized and reappeared about 15 minutes later.  The eggs were still ice cold and the middle of the pancakes were now uncooked batter.  If a restaurant is unable to adequately staff for a holiday, don&#39;t bother to open.  We won&#39;t be back.

Love the cheesecake but if you order at the counter they take forever to just hand it over. You would think they are making it from scratch by how long you wait for them to hand it over. All they have to do is grab a slice, box it and hand it over.

The menu items taste exactly the same as every Cheesecake Factory restaurant. I admire their consistency in taste- they have great quality control. Nothing here will taste bad and you will have the exact same dining experience every time you eat here. Unfortunately, this means that it will be very loud and noisy, and service will be super slow. There&#39;s a reason why their menu is 20,000 pages long- to give you something to read while you wait, and wait.  And wait. Sitting in the bar, or going here super late at night will earn you no reprieve- you have slow service even after 9 pm.  <br><br>To be fair, no one seems to notice the slow service much. Parties are raucous and boisterous and having a good time. Lots of parties of women celebrating impending nuptials, or birthdays. But if you are desperate, I suggest you order a bunch of appetizers. They come out a tad faster, and no matter which appetizer you order, the quality will be good and the taste will be fine. <br><br>I suggest this place for large parties with a lot of time to kill. The extensive menu will guarantee something for everyone, and you won&#39;t notice the wait if you have lots of news to shout about across the table.<br><br>If you&#39;re still sober at the end of the night, I recommend examining the decor. It&#39;s lush and over the top and completely disproportionate to most other restaurants in Salt Lake City which have more spartan settings. But fun to look over to get design ideas for that mansion that you&#39;ll probably never build.
Food is so good. Portions are big. Great service, especially Crystal. We have been lucky to get her twice now. She is very nice and fun. I will be requesting her from now on.

The terrible management and inconsistency keeps me at bay. For being a corporate restaurant, you&#39;d hope for better service, as the ones in Vegas offer far better food and hospitality. The menu isn&#39;t adhered to and lies are spewed from managment&#39; mouth about the kitchen practices and how food should taste. Specifically, I&#39;m told that eggplant SHOULD be solid green and really crunchy when thoroughly cooked, odd, since I eat a lot of eegplant and only have issues with it at this location..

The Cheesecake Factory here is similar to any other location with delicious cheesecake and an overly complicated menu of entrees. However, the Spicy Cashew Chicken is quite delicious, and we cant resist ordering it every time we end up visiting. I would highly recommend it if you find yourself at the Cheesecake Factory.

Good food, huge portions, but the staff isn&#39;t my favorite. Turning too many tables makes them tired and clumsy. Have had multiple mess ups with my orders and even had a manager come over who argued with me about how my experience was... Say what?
Worst service ever!  Food was terrible. We had a party of 5 and we all ordered something different and we were all disappointed. They weren&#39;t overly busy so that is not an excuse!!!

The Cajun jambalaya was horrible and cost $18. The carrot cake cheesecake was not great and the red velvet cheesecake taste like cream cheese and bread, these was very little flavor. We did order the fried mac and cheese bite and those are amazing! But basically the rest of our meal sucked!! I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta and ended up puking everywhere when we got home... stir clear of that. For $95 this meal was the worst!! We ended up going to sonic later because we were hungry.

So there was one piece of chicken in my four cheese chicken pasta the price to add one piece of chicken was outrageous! The server you could hardly understand him. But he tried. For the price we paid for the food I would say not returning . If it&#39;s based on our server Daniel maybe we would return

The Cheesecake Factory has been my favourite place to eat ever since I was a child. My girlfriend flew in from Japan and naturally I wanted her to try it. The food is spectacular and great at every restaurant but this location&#39;s management is horrid. We tried to order a cocktail to share and they didn&#39;t accept my girlfriend&#39;s Irish government issued ID, nor her European Union health insurance card to prove her identity and age and instead dicked us around and put her down about it. I will always recommend the food here but never go to this location again. The waitress we had also gave us attitude about the whole situation. Afterwards we just went to Red Rock in the same plaza for drinks, go there instead, the service is fantastic.
Usually pretty good. Love the miso salmon although that one  can some times not be the freshest. But huge meals. And always have left overs. The sweet tamale cakes are good!!

I&#39;m from Las Vegas and I&#39;m here for medical reasons with the family. We ate here because it&#39;s relatively close to the hospital and I love the Cheescake Factories in Las Vegas. That being said, I was a bit disappointed with this location. They were veryyyyy slow and it took us multiple times to ask for the same things, (refills and whatnot) I think I was most disappointed with my Steak Diane. I always get this plate and this time, it was very unappetizing. It was verrrrrry over cooked. (I asked for medium and got welllll well done.) and there was barely any sauce. Needless to say, I&#39;ll stick to Cheesecake Factories in Vegas.
Always great service here the food is quality and plentiful. Wish they would have built it bigger so you didn&#39;t have to wait in line so long sometimes.
I definitely love food and ambience at this place, I always order bang bang shrimp and chicken and margarita for my dinner. However, we had to wait for at least half an hour to get a table

We ordered 2 rib eye steaks, one of their more expensive items on their menu and were disappointed. The steaks had a lot of charcoal on it. It was not the money! The service was good, just not the food.

No chain-based restaurant is worth an hour and a half wait. TCF proves this to be true. We finally gave up waiting and turned our wives loose on finding us a bar table. Our server was great but the food did not make up for the incredibly long wait. <br><br>That being said if you end up there and have persevered try the hummus and pita appetizer it was the best thing we ordered. The shrimp tacos off the skinnylicious menu were good, the tuscan chicken was tasty but nothing made up for the long wait in a crowded foyer.<br><br>Sadly we were so late getting through dinner we skipped the one thing that might have rescued the meal: Cheesecake!

For a restaurant that has so many options,  Cheesecake Factory is incredible.  Great appetizers,  drinks,  entrees and desserts.  The ambiance is very nice too.  The only thing I don&#39;t like is the wait,  but it&#39;s a long wait because it&#39;s good.
Amazing service... amazing options... Jordan the manager rocks!  Our waitress was super nice and fast...
Josh our server was great kept or drinks coming and the food was on point, kept my kids happy
Always good and a crowd pleaser. Waits are long on the weekends but not too bad during the week.

Delicious.  Yum.  More.  I&#39;m going to puke, I&#39;m so stuffed.<br>Those are words you will often hear when at The Cheesecake factory.<br>Unfortunately, at this location I also tend to feel like you hear:<br>The wait for a seat is over an hour?!<br>Where is the waiter/waitress?<br>How long could this possibly take?<br>It&#39;s been twenty minutes since my water was gone - where is someone who can refill it?<br>We can all appreciate the charm and allure and familiarity of an extremely popular chain restaurant...especially once that is just about one of the best out there, but for the amount of time it takes to get service here, it&#39;s just not worth it for me.  <br>That being said, I always, always, always enjoy my food at Cheesecake Factory.  Their appetizers, entrees, and desserts are all heaven on a plate.  My experiences have been much better at the City Creek location, but if you have a hankering, this&#39;ll do in a pinch...a really, really long pinch.
The food here is always great, as long a you don&#39;t mind longer than usual waits.  Excellent selection of cheesecakes, of course.

Cheesecake factory is my wifes and my favorite location no matter which state we are in. Their menu is enormous and has something for everyone. The only complaint I&#39;ve had with the CF is the kitchen smell. Though it is not the case for all the 15 locations I&#39;ve been at, it is for the location here in Murray. The smell spoils the good aroma of food. Perhaps keeping the kitchen room door closed would help.

I have been to this location several times. Everytime they are very accomodating for such a large group that we show up with. Also at one of my friends birthday&#39;s the server remembered all of our names and addressed each one of us when speaking to us. I am not a fancy schmancy lady but I thought that was super nice. Aside from that the food is always soooooo good and portions are huge so you can share with anyone and every one!

Love their Dirty Martinis as they come with blue cheese stuffed olives. Got their Chicken Picatta as it is one of my favorite Italian dishes. It would&#39;ve been enough to split, honestly. The only downfall was service. Would&#39;ve loved another drink, but the waiter didn&#39;t even come back till the end to box up the left overs...

Ahhh The Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ve been a fan of this chain since way before it landed here in UT.  Whenever I was out of state on vacation I&#39;d &#34;hunt&#34; for one so I could enjoy some good meal.<br><br>I took my family to the Murray location this past Sunday for dinner.  I was really happy to see there were no crowds or huge waiting times to get seated.  We were able to get a table within 5 minutes.  Score!<br><br>Our server was very, VERY nice.  He was friendly, attentive and would come to check on our drinks and on us often.  He definitely deserves 5 stars!  The service we got from him was great!<br><br>The four star rating goes to the food.  I can&#39;t remember the exactly name of the dish I ordered but it was some type of pasta from the light menu.  The dish was good BUT it had way too much pepper/hot spices added to it.  I felt like I was eating a mexican dish and not italian.  I was able to finish it but it would have been a much better dish if it wasn&#39;t too spicy.  <br><br>I got the pineapple upside down cheesecake for dessert and that was the BEST cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had at the Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;m always afraid of ordering a slice of cheesecake because they are usually too sugary or too rich for my taste.  But not this one.  It was deliciously perfect.  Give it a try.<br><br>This wasn&#39;t my first time at this location and certainly not my last.  I&#39;m a fan.
Chicken Alfredo was extremely oily. How does that even happen?! The food is over priced and cheaply made. Stay home and make spaghetti instead.

The Cheesecake is awesome and I don&#34;t even really care for Cheesecake. The portions sizes for the entrees are enormous. One the of the strengths can also be one of there weaknesses. They have a huge menu and a wide variety of dining options however that can cause one thing you try like fish tacos to be very average and a pasta dish like Chicken Madeira was fantastic.  Our favorite appetizer are the avocado egg rolls they are full of yummy real avocado. A good idea if you would like to enjoy all the courses is to split the entree. The wait is usually long so get here early.

This place has the worst customer service of any restaurant. They won&#39;t take reservations even for very large (18-20) people. They won&#39;t tell you the wait time until you show up and then you find out it&#39;s going to be 4 hours before you are seated with a few kids in tow this is far less than ideal. I get that they like the image of the insanely pretentious restaurant but they&#39;ve taken it way too far. The food is pretty good but it also takes about 20 min to get through the menu that is chock full of advertisements. I won&#39;t be going back, and next time I get a &#34;gift card&#34; there I&#39;ll be posting it for sale since it isn&#39;t worth the energy.
Every time I come here I&#39;m never disappointed. Great service great food and I would recommend the steak Diane and the chicken Marcella.

Extremely long wait every single time I&#39;m here. It&#39;s really disappointing that Cheescake Factory could care less about this problem. If you want to wait at least an hour before being seated, this is the place for you!

Over priced, over crowded,  underwhelming food. I am not sure what it is that makes this place so great. The food was mediocre. The cheesecake wasn&#39;t anything better than what I can buy at Costco.  It is SO loud in here that trying to have a conversation is pointless. I won&#39;t be back.

Our experience was amazing... my boss brought our work out for my birthday dinner... our waitress was very informative and cheerful she had a accent and all but spoke great english! Food was awesome came out right on time ...

Bad service, bad food!! Place has really gone down hill. Ever since around February this place has been horrible.. Dirty dishes, grumpy servers, bad managers and undercooked food.. Not clean or friendly don&#39;t go here... Also they always tell you about there cheesecakes but here&#39;s the real story... Frozen for months and months at a time, people walk on them, shuffle them in and out of freezers and then touch every slice without gloves... After touching mo way, hair, cleaning supplies... Gross

Cheesecake Factory has good mainstream mall food.  I&#39;ve been to the Salt Lake location a couple times.  Food was excellent and tasty.  The restaurant itself is very loud and crammed (especially if you&#39;re a party of two).  Our service this last time was a little slow and it seemed the server had too many tables.

This place takes aaaages to get food on the weekend. It was 2 hours of total time on Sunday afternoon. It was so packed and loud with chatter. The food wasn&#39;t terrible, but not great. If you&#39;re really determined for a slice of great cheesecake, then this place is for you. Just want a quick lunch? Not so much.
Food is great, very large and tasty menu. Wait times are often very long and service hadn&#39;t been as good at this location lately.

I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake Factory restaurants and they are always consistent.  I like knowing what I can expect when dining and having meals that are reliable in flavor &amp; quality.  <br><br>So, why am I reviewing this particular Cheesecake Factory?  I&#39;ll tell you.  <br><br>The background:  My bf and I went to UT for our usual ski/snowboard trip.  We have never enjoyed dining options in old Salt Lake City (or Provo, Draper or even Park City).  We decided to go to a chain restaurant to decrease the odds of disappointment and Cheesecake Factory was nearby.<br><br>The experience:  when we got there, there was an hour wait (at 6 om on a Saturday night).  I was amazed because it is a chain and the night was young.  But, knowing the food crisis in UT (nothing is good, really!)- I understand.  This is why I removed 1 star- no one should wait an hour for a chain restaurant at only 6pm.  Thankfully, we were able to find seating at the bar right away.<br><br>This is where the service magic happened.  We were greeted immediately, even with the crowd.  The bartender &amp; an assistant were attentive, funny and helpful.  Our food- chicken madiera &amp; steak diane- was the usual quality/taste/etc which is a blessing (yes blessing- it is Mormon country folks).  The bartender made a custom drink to my bf&#39;s request &amp; did so confidently and kindly.  I had the apple martini.  The highlight- we substituted well liquor for top shelf (Chopin Vodka &amp; Grand Marnier) and we were not charged extra for this nor for the unique custom drink.<br><br>I WOULD RECOMMEND this place if you are in the Salt Lake/Draper area and are frustrated by the stand alone rip off poor quality restaurants that are abundant in this area.

What a disappointment! If you want overpriced food, sub par service, lots of noise and long waits this is the place for you! The 3 stars is for the food because it is very tasty. I had a factory burrito that was huge, packed full of meat and veggis, and very flavorful. However tasty it might have been it did not equal the hefty price and poor service. <br>We were lucky to get a booth but man some of those tables are crammed in so tight you might as well ask the people next to you join you. Due to its layout the place is very noisy. We also got a slice of pumpkin cheesecake to go which was $7.50 for one slice and a mistake. I didn&#39;t see the slice until I got home, but it was tiny and the taste was pretty bland. Save yourself the trouble and find somewhere else worth your time and money.

I have visited this cheesecake factory location at least 8 times this year, after the first visit it was never my choice again. I dont know why this location is so popular/crowded. just the fact that its connected to a busy mall? It&#39;s a huge chain? Other locations are fine but I dont see how such a dirty place with terrible service, neglectful and avoidant staff can have so much business! <br> EVERY time we&#39;ve gone they seat us at a table with bits of food on the chairs and table (pet peeve). Time before last I stepped in a pile of rice on the floor. The time before that a glass was dropped and broken by a server, she asked a busy busser to take care of it but he didnt even hear her cause he was soooo busy! When she came back to the area and saw it still hadn&#39;t been cleaned up she just threw a napkin on top of the broken glass and liquid, walked away and started giggling with a coworker in the back corner. These shards of glass were on the ground for almost our entire meal. I was actually concerned about a toddler who was running back and forth by all the glass, but no one else seemed to notice or care.<br> They have no problem serving with dirty glassware and silverware. I am always so surprised by how terrible the service and quality of food is, especially since the place is often packed and ridiculously overpriced for the quality of food.<br>They seem to have an abundance of staff but they rarely want to go to their tables. I have watched with my own eyes as servers hurriedly walk back and forth up and down and looked extremely busy, but they weren&#39;t doing anything! They were seemingly powerwalking to random corners of the restaurant, shuffling around some glasses or just standing at card readers then they&#39;d rush to another side for some more shuffling and the illusion of being too busy to wait on their table. <br>Finally, the last time my guy made me go he ordered one of his favorite entrees (chicken and biscuits...that dish is WHY he wants to eat here) When his entree arrived and he tried to put his fork into the biscuits they were so hard that one biscuit repelled the fork, flew off the plate and sounded like a rock when it landed! He waited for our server to come back, he just wanted to replace the biscuit but after about ten minutes he resigned to not having any biscuits. She NEVER came back to check our food, refill our glasses or do her job at all until she decided we needed our check. We showed her the biscuit and she blew it off like, how was I supposed to know? It was completely inedible, like fossilized dinodroppings. She asked if he wanted another, he said he didnt want to risk it and he was done with his chicken, he said he would have taken one earlier but she never came back. I requested for her to bring some biscuits anyway. A few minutes later someone else with crazy person  makeup came with biscuits and said she heard about the rock biscuit and hoped it didn&#39;t happen again. She didn&#39;t offer any compensation.<br>In everyone&#39;s opinion, if you have to pay nearly twenty dollars for everything on the menu then the food should be at least edible, period. Quality control is not an unattainable mystery.<br>I really hate this cheesecake factory location.

I&#39;ve been here twice now. Once three months ago. Both visits I was very impressed with the food as well as the staff. The portions are big. I&#39;ve never left hungry. Quite busy both times, but only a 10 minute wait.

WINS<br>Avocado egg roll appetizers are so insanely yummy.  <br>The Cajun jambalaya pasta was awesome.  <br>Baja chicken tacos were amazing but are 3 small tacos &amp; not filling for a grown man<br><br>FAILS<br>Kitchen failed to have any of the dressings on the side<br>Kitchen also failed to exclude requested ingredients e.g. Tortilla chips off of the Santa Fe salad, Bacon off of the Cobb salad<br>Ligthing is so dark at night that we used our phones flashlights to see our food &amp; to pick out the crap they forgot to leave out of our salads.<br>Chicken Di Pana is a total let down.  You really could get something better at a Cracker Barrel<br><br>ONLY&#39;s<br>   Food is amazing when they can actually deliver your order correctly which still doesn&#39;t make up for 1 to 2 hour wait times to be seated along with hidden allergens left

The wait is ridiculous. I wish there was more seating for the waiting customers. We went there early to hope to avoid the rush, but no luck. There was still a long wait. I don&#39;t like the seating... I feel like I am in a &#34;speed dating&#34; setting. I didn&#39;t even want to talk to my husband because there were people right on either side of me. <br>The food was alright, but nothing to write home about.  It&#39;s pretty expensive too. <br>I do love the cheesecake however.  <br>We&#39;ll probably only go back once, and that is because we have a gift card we got for Christmas. But you can bet your bottom dollar we won&#39;t be going on a weekend, or at night....
Eternally long wait to get a table most nights. Food is worth it and beyond fantastic though. Customer service is great once seated. Portions are huge.

The hubby and I went for an early dinner last night to Cheesecake Factory.  We shared an appetizer of Guacamole Eggrolls and then split an entree of Chicken Madeira and to top it off we shared a slice of the Salted Caramel Cheesecake!  I&#39;ll start from the beginning.  We didn&#39;t need to wait very long..just about 10 minutes.  We knew what we wanted so we quickly placed our order of Guacamole Eggrolls to start off with!  Oh my....I&#39;m always surprised on how FANTASTIC these are!  You cannot get anything like this from anywhere..the flavor is crazy good and that dipping sauce...I could drink it by the gallon!!!  What a great way to start off the meal!  Our entree came right after, perfect timing and it was so good.  It&#39;s a huge portion so it&#39;s always great to be able to share that meal!  The chicken was pounded thin and cooked perfectly!  Oh their mashed potatoes are a great texture and super yummy! They brought out fresh warm bread and it was wonderful! Our server featured the Salted Caramel Cheesecake and immediately we went for it!  That is my all time favorite one now!  It was spectacular!!!!  What a great meal from beginning to end!  I love this place!

Good food, good service, but definitely on the expensive side.<br><br>I&#39;ve had lunch here a few times when I&#39;m at the Fashion Place mall, and it is a nice addition to the area.<br><br>The interior is very nice, and the patio is a great choice for warm, sunny day. Even on cooler days, they have heaters going so you can enjoy the fresh outdoor air.<br><br>The wait staff is consistently nice and speedy, no issues there and actually, these guys have some of the best service I&#39;ve seen.<br><br>Alas, this place is pretty expensive. The last time I was here for lunch, two entrees without a drink or desert came out to be $23...yipes!<br><br>It&#39;s worth coming here every now because the service is great and the place itself is really nice, but it certainly isn&#39;t cheap.

The Cheesecake Factory has a lot going for it; good food, good service, nice atmosphere, and great dessert (as the name would suggest).  The problem is that is also has quite a bit that does not help it; long lines, expensive prices, also the menu is ridiculously long( due in part to the full page adds it sells but by no means would the menu be anything but excruciatingly long with out them).  To go along with this the portion sizes are big enough to feed a medium sized family.  I understand that people want to feel full after they have eaten at a restaurant they have spent some of their hard earned money on  but these portion sizes are just laughable.<br><br>On a side not this las visit we had a waitress that was not so great.  She took ten minutes to get our drink orders and that was only after i had to ask somebody to find her.  She also told us the special of the day was &#34;So so&#34;.  Not exactly the best service but i would dare say that this is by no means the norm.
GO! You WILL enjoy!! The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorites! Great service and excellent food! The cheesecake is unbelievable!! Oreos cheesecake is one I recommend :)

Admittedly, I avoid going to chain restaurants because I prefer to enjoy local, smaller places to eat. When i was at home this weekend, my mom said she really liked The Cheesecake Factory and wanted to have lunch there.  So, being the obedient son, I went with her.  <br><br>They have these all over California, and I have never set foot in one.  The ambiance of the place is reminiscent of any large chain restaurant.  However, this one has really high ceilings giving it a really nice, open feel to it.  The one thing that I noted that was nice was that they had a partition that went from floor to ceiling (half of it being glass) that separated the kitchen from the dining area.  I thought that was really nice because often the kitchen area can get a bit loud. <br><br>I ordered the half turkey sandwich, salad, and soup lunch, and my mom got the miso glazed salmon.  The portions are really large here, so be prepared to come with your appetite like I did.  The soup was black bean and actually fairly tasty, the sandwich was on a baguette and really nice and crispy, and the salad had a nice vinaigrette on it.  I tasted my mom&#39;s salmon and the glaze was actually decent, but she found it a little bland and had to add some more salt and pepper.  <br><br>Becky, our server, was good about checking up on us and gave me refills quickly.  <br><br>Also, of note, there&#39;s a full bar here, too.  Not sure if you have to a membership, or not, but probably can just head in after a hard day of shopping at the mall.  ;-p<br><br>Overall, a decent first-time visit to The Cheesecake Factory.  Would I return, probably not, but overall a decent experience.

after numerous visits<br><br>ambience A- frenetic, noisy and crowded, but it works. the decor is decent, if a bit too &#39;las vegas&#39; for my taste. but, again, it works.<br><br>service A up to this point, i&#39;ve never had a bad server. accommodating, prompt, and polite.<br><br>food B+ to tell you the truth, i did NOT want to like this restaurant, because of all the hype and trend. but they have pleasantly surprised me ALMOST every time i&#39;ve visited. i walk away from the restaurant, take-away in hand, thinking, &#34;how did this happen again? dang.&#34;<br><br>thai lettuce wraps (satay chicken strips, carrots, bean sprouts, coconut curry noodles and lettuce leaves with three thai style sauces - peanut, sweet red chili and tamarind-cashew.)<br>it&#39;s fresh. it&#39;s simple. it&#39;s always the same. and they let you assemble your own wraps. i believe in choice. thank you.<br><br>avocado egg rolls (avocado, sun-dried tomato, red onion and cilantro fried in a crisp wrapper with a tamarind-cashew dipping sauce.)<br>decent. not my favorite. probably because wanted lime and salt to make it pop. <br><br>firecracker salmon rolls (spiced fresh salmon rolled in spinach and fried in a crisp wrapper with a sweet hot chili sauce.) <br>decent. delicious, until the slight salmon aftertaste kicks in. not my favorite. but it&#39;s still delicious regardless. <br><br>pasta carbonara (spaghettini with smoked bacon, green peas, and a garlic-parmesan cream sauce)<br>it&#39;s difficult to get carbonara wrong. i love the cheesecake factory&#39;s carbonara. the peas were fresh, and the sauce wasn&#39;t too thick and clingy. meaning, they had enough olive oil to loosen it up. (my secret hope is that the days of the table side cracking of the raw egg on the pasta returns.)<br><br>stephanie&#39;s ultimate red velvet cheesecake (moist layers of red velvet cake and our original cheesecake covered with our special cheesecake factory cream cheese frosting)<br>i can only handle cheesecake in very small doses. BUT, i CAN handle this cheesecake all by myself. the red velvet cake breaks up the monotony of cheesecake&#39;s richness and overbearing weight. i know, how can cake lessen the weight? trust me, it does.<br><br>overall: A-<br>a solid 4 stars. as far as i&#39;m concerned, cheesecake factory is doing their job. churning out pretty good food, good service and a nice backdrop.

As with all cheesecake factories, the menu is huge, so it&#39;s a great place to go with a group. The service is good and staff is friendly. However the atmosphere is loud and it is pricey. Overall, good option for picky eaters.

Did not make it past the hostess. When seated at a booth near the restroom and kitchen we asked for a different booth (there were six others empty next to the one they wanted us to sit at) we were told it would be ten minute wait. There were only two other couples waiting to be seated. We decided to leave and will never go back to this location. City Creek is the only one I will go to in Utah.

I always love the cheesecake factory, every time and it never feels.  Its hard that a place like this can go wrong with its intense menu and fast service.  Even if the service is a bit below par, the managers always step in and make sure you are completely happy.  I&#39;m surprised with the rating for this place for Utah considering it was insanely packed when I went on a late Friday.  We didn&#39;t want to wait so we sat at the bar which was perfect!  The bartenders are quick and super friendly.  We ordered off the small plate list which was a great deal and the portions were crazy (of course).  We had the corn fritters, the endive salad, a side of fries, and the strawberry shortcake.  The corn fritters were pretty big, the size of the balls (haha), and sweet tasting.  The endive salad I always order and it was perfect as usual.  Everything tasted great and I left completely happy! <br><br>Tip: Order off the small plate list because its a great deal for all the food you get and the variety is right too.  Also, if you hate waiting, never ever go here unless you want to sit at the bar.
I love The Cheesecake Factory, it is my all time favorite!! My only complaint about this location is that there is usually a very long wait!

First visit impressions:<br><br>Like said before here - pretty much like other huge chain restaurants. Food is flavorful and handsomely prepared. Waiter was very nice and helpful in assisting us with our selections.<br><br>Portions are indeed gigantic! I believe I witnessed EVERYONE leaving the restaurant with a bag. I was no exception, and I only ordered a salad. I was stuffed after eating only 1/2  the meal. It was good enough to think I might eat some more of it the next day. (More than 1/2 the folks I watched leave the place were packing around several dozen previous meals on their hips and waists.)<br><br>I have to say too that the screaming kids were annoying and the wait time was ridiculous. The herding of patrons in the seating process is reminiscent of an attraction at Disney World.<br><br>Our waiter said they hadn&#39;t switched over to the 1.5 oz. liquor metering yet so I opted out of the $7.50 Mojito. $7.50 is just WAY too much to pay for only 1 oz. of juice in a drink.<br><br>After the meal I was too full for any desert. Our waiter told us you can buy some of the cheesecakes (all made in California and shipped frozen) at Costco for cheaper than you can get them at the restaurant. So, if you want to avoid the trough-feeding experience and just get a cheesecake it may be a good idea to try out Costco.

It seems the only time I dine at the Cheesecake Factory is when there is birthday or on vacation? I can&#39;t say I hate this place by any means. But I really don&#39;t understand everyone&#39;s devotion and love of it? The menu is so overwhelming that if you don&#39;t know what you want when you go. You will be scanning the menu over 30 minutes. So I always have to tell myself what I really feel like before showing up here. The service is always good and friendly staff.  I do like the option of lunch size portions.  This place just offers huge portions, that no regular human should be able to eat. I am sure I will be back and patiently wait 30 minutes to an hour to be seated for lunch. And YES of course I will have a gigantic slice of cheese cake! On top of two days worth of calories in one meal.

Wish I could put 4.5 2/3 times great service. If I were manager I would tell someone to go home if they had a poor attitude. <br><br>Great that I know things are fresh because it seems they run out of everything I want. <br>I wanted the Mahi Mahi &amp; they ran out two times in 1 week. Also they ran out of a cheesecake I wanted on the same night &amp; no discount. <br><br>Dirty spoon, slow service, waitress forgot everything I asked for &amp; I always had to ask her for water. <br><br>As opposed to Troy &amp;  Lindsey who were very attentive.

Like many others I&#39;ve been avoiding this place under the assumption it was all hype.  I just figured that when people went the the Cheesecake Factory in Vegas and raved about it was because they were half drunk and high on the Vegas experience.  I was wrong, this place has really good food.<br><br>My first misconception was that the hype was all about cheesecake and not food.  But one look over their humongous menu lets you know they aren&#39;t just a place for desert.  Seriously find the menu online, it&#39;s 20 pages long!<br><br>I got the Steak Diane, steak medallions in a mushroom wine sauce, basically my favorite dish so I figured it&#39;s a good measuring stick for restaurants.  It was delicious, maybe a bit peppery but not much more than other places that advertise a black peppercorn Angus steak.<br><br>The portions are huge, it&#39;s best to just plan ahead and divide the dish in half and eat the rest for lunch the next day.  Especially if you have desert, if you eat it all you will be over-stuffing yourself way beyond the safe comfort/health point.  During the long wait for a table you&#39;ll notice everybody walking out with huge bags of take-home leftovers.<br><br>Speaking of the long wait.  I was there on a Thursday and waited 45 minutes; this is considered a short wait here.  You cannot reserve ahead of time so stop by, get your name down, and then try to find something to keep you occupied for the next hour or so.<br><br>This is also an awful place to have a conversation, the noise level really is out of control.  You have to shout to be heard over the rest of the diners which just leads to an even louder restaurant.  Considering how many people are packed in it&#39;s not really surprising why this happens.<br><br>The service is also average, the waiters and waitresses are working a full speed but there are just so many people to take care of that you&#39;ll only see them a couple times during the night.  They&#39;re friendly but don&#39;t expect them to be attentive to your every need while dining.  I prefer they stay out of my way anyway so this wasn&#39;t a big deal to me.<br><br>Overall I don&#39;t plan on going back there unless it&#39;s on somebody else&#39;s whim.  It&#39;s not the food isn&#39;t great, I really liked it; it&#39;s just not the atmosphere I want in a dining experience.  Dinner is where you go to talk before or after doing something with family friends or loved ones.  Cheesecake Factory is like a loud, rowdy, communal dining experience.  The decor may be a bit fancier, but I don&#39;t feel like I&#39;m spending intimate face to face time with people here.

Horrible wait time, slow service time for food that&#39;s not that good. Don&#39;t eat the fish! My wife did and 2 hours later was violently ill with food poisoning! Management claims it was impossible, yet it happened. Lost wages cost us 4x what the meal did so definitely not worth it! Avoid this location above all others, we&#39;re not the only ones sickened by our experience there.

PRESENTATION: I always want to dig in so fast before I could admire it.<br><br>TASTE: Everything always taste so good when I come here. I&#39;ve been here several times and I never leave disappointed of the food we get.<br><br>SERVICE: Here comes the service... The last time I came here for a birthday, we pretty much waited for like 3 hours for 14 top and it was driving us crazy, cause every time we asked when will be up they always told us 15 to 25 minutes. I&#39;ve never had to wait that long for just a table and they blamed it on the &#34;bachlorette party&#34; because that&#39;s we were getting sitted at, you need to realize you have a lot of other places to sit us then that spot. Servers are excellent at their job though, always tending us on what we need.<br><br>VALUE: For the price you pay, you won&#39;t walk away unhappy.

Overrated restaurant... Foods were okay but do not worth the price that they are charging.... Cheesecake just terrible... No different than the cheesecake that you can buy from the supermarket.... Basically super sweet and lack of flavor..makes you think its made out of cheap ingredients

Table, silverware, and drink cups were very dirty. Even after bringing us new silverware. You&#39;d think that they would pay attention when you request a new set due to the original being dirty. Ruined my appetite there but reluctantly ordered dinner since the kids and wife were starving and didn&#39;t want to go somewhere else. We ordered a chicken Bellagio and it was very bland, realized after we&#39;d eaten most of it that was missing the cream sauce. The kids didn&#39;t eat half of their meals, corn dogs were soggy, Mac and cheese was runny like a soup, and the slider buns were also soggy. We ordered buffalo blasts as an appetizer and they were good but we avoided the buffalo sauce as it appeared to have pieces of something in it and we hadn&#39;t dipped at all. This isn&#39;t the first time that things have lacked in the department of cleanliness. It&#39;s a shame because we typically love this place but I am finding less and less reasons to return.

Just had an amazing lunch at the bar and the two girls working the bar we&#39;re amazing. They had amazing team work, dedication and great work ethic. They we&#39;re on top of what everyone needed, fast and sweet. Beat service ever. Thank you.

Such a great place to go.  A little on the pricey side (when a slice of cheesecake costs more than 1 beer...really?!)  We tried the Habachi Steak and the fried calamari.  Amazing!  Would suggest this meal to everyone!  Very busy, so plan on having a little bit of a wait for dinner, but I would say its worth it!

Just gonna review on the cheesecake. I&#39;ve only been here 2 times just to get a slice of cheesecake. First time I was here, it was the Red Velvet Cheesecake. Love it! Definitely would come back for this. Today, it was the Kalua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake. OMG, another great slice of cheesecake. It was pretty rich though, especially the chocolate on top. Cheesecake Factory never seems to fail as a great dessert to end the evening!

My experience was not good the waiter never ask us what we wanted to drink just gave us water. When our order came my daughter ordered the burger on wheat and guess what they sent the burger out on some hard crusty bread, we told the waiter he said &#34;they were out of whole wheat so they put it on that&#34; then he took the the burger back and within 5 mins brought it back. They put the burger on the whole wheat bread and sent it back out. We spent more than $100.00 for dinner and let&#39;s just say we won&#39;t be going back to that restaurant.No apology was made about us getting the wrong order.

Okay, it&#39;s the same menu as any other Cheesecake Factory so... yay.  (Me likey.)  But there are 2 things seriously wrong with this Cheesecake Factory:  1) Be prepared to wait way over an hour.  2) There&#39;s no bar in the bar (!) and the bar area is assigned seating.  (So what&#39;s the point of having a bar?!)<br><br>I won&#39;t go back for a very long time.... or unless I need to eat at 3 O&#39;clock in the afternoon.<br><br>If you do go, though, I suggest the guacamole.  YUMMERS!!!!!

As I said before, I am from the bay area (Northern California) At home i LOVE this restaurant. but the one in salt lake could stand to change. First of all. In general, there are wayy to many children in this state. This totally ruins the dining experience. This is not a family restaurant. (but i guess everything here is family) Take you and your five kids to denny&#39;s or whatever. please. <br><br>That aside, I do absolutely love the food here. The service is good and the atmosphere is nice. (on weekdays when the families aren&#39;t there) One main downside is that they don&#39;t take reservations and there&#39;s usually a long wait. <br><br>However, If i could, I&#39;ll just go home and eat at the cheesecake factory there. Save myself from the chaos and long waits at the one here.<br><br>If you&#39;ve never eaten here I recommend giving it a chance.
