This was the worst food/service I have ever gotten at a Cheesecake Factory!  <br><br>The only thing that saves this from a 1 star review is that our crabcakes and our crab/artichoke dip were FABULOUS! <br><br>My &#34;seared&#34; ahi was dang near fully cooked.  They took it back politely and brought back a chinese chicken salad.  It was huge, but part of the huge-osity was the fried rice noodles that almost broke my teeth.  <br><br>The cheesecake is always scrumptious, but for 7 bucks a slice, it should be.

The wait on a Thursday evening is forever long. The booth we were given had so many food crumbs on the seat. After a long wait, it took a long time for the server to get us water. The server was nice and friendly, but overall, the service was almost non-existent. Waiting for the food took forever long. The bread, quesadilla, salad wraps and tiramisu cheesecake were good. The Tuscan Chicken, however, was beautifully described on the menu, but turned out to be dreadfully horrendous with too much sauce. I love sweet potato fries, but there was too much seasoning. After the meal, I realized how much MSG was in the food. I drank so much water throughout the meal, but I am dehydrated now. The non-stop atmospheric noise is a headache. The dark cave of lighting feels similar to a prostitution house. You might as well sell your soul to a soulless monopolization of food. This is no fancy place to have a dinner or to celebrate a birthday. Over this overrated place.

If there was a zero star rating that is what I would give it. We were told 1.5 hour wait, which we were fine with. After multiple check ins at the front desk after we had been waiting for 2 hours, they told us that our table would be ready in 5 min. 25 mins later we check in again and they tell us that they have sat another group at our table because we never showed up with when called (which never happened). The hostess was very rude and casually said that we would be the next group to be sat in another 45 - 60 mins. Needless to say that we left. Not sure I would return here simply based on the customer experience that we had here. Slow, crowded, and terrible customer service.

Cheesecake Factory is amazing, this location IS NOT! Horrible service! Food is delicious, but avoid the Murray location and go to City Creek! Even their curbside to go has poor service! I had about 10 bad experiences but since it&#39;s my favorite restaurant I kept going. After the 10th bad experience I stopped going for about 2 years until I recently dined at the city creek location. Go there, better friendly quick service and had a beautiful and different decor from all the other ones I&#39;ve been too.

Had valentine&#39;s day brunch here. I was amazed how many people had left work early as the place was packed.  We were able to sit at a bar table after a shot wait.  WE ordered the tuna tataki salad and it came out fresh and delicious after about 40 minutes. Didn&#39;t mind the wait as we were wqtching the Olympics on TV and our server kept refilling our drinks promptly.

Great food huge menu. A couple things I don&#39;t agree with however.....I hate trying to spread cold butter on bread and I would like my &#34;server&#34; to serve my food not some random guy from the kitchen. After all they are called servers not just order takers.

Really, really???!!! For the price you pay it is not worth it!! I ordered a simple to go order and somehow you forget the pasta in my shrimp scampi! Nothing but three pieces of shrimp! I live really far. I can&#39;t just drive back and tell you that you somehow forgot my noodles! I mean really. This place has gone down hill. You use to be my favorite restaurant. I am so disappointed. When you do dine in they hardly give you any bread anymore, the food is cold after waiting for 30 min, it is so loud and strangely vaulted that I can not hear my company speak but can clearly make out what a couple across the room are talking about, and not to mention the music you play in the background is terrible. Why not play some classical music?? Your cheesecake is still amazing! But tell me am I suppose to drive 45 min away to get my pasta that you forgot? You obviously don&#39;t know what customer service is, too expensive for what you get, and strip mall quality environment. You are obviously ripping people off. So why not give back that money and get your act together. Try to bring back a touch of class. You have lost my service and respect as a business.. makes me sad cause you were my go to place.

Ugh. Why? Why does the majority of this great state think CF is the cat&#39;s pajamas? The wait is always ridiculous, no matter what time of day or night you go. The decor is tacky- what is it even supposed to be emulating? The music is way, WAY too loud, making the noise level unbearable. You can&#39;t even have a conversation with your dinner companions without shouting. The menu is huge- it&#39;s in a spiral bound book peppered with advertisements. Am I the only person who thinks it&#39;s odd to sell ad space in a menu? As I was saying, the restaurant has an extensive menu and the food is pretty okay, but it&#39;s over-priced. The cheesecake is good- some are pretty over the top, some are more traditional and simple. The environment in this place is enough to keep me away. If I absolutely must have Cheesecake Factory, I think I&#39;ll just order takeout.

I have had good service here from time to time. The wait is always really long. You wait forever on the food. The quality of the food is so so... I think it&#39;s way too expensive for what it is. Nothing is all that special about the Cheesecake Factory. I liked this place when it first opened, but the food has gone way down hill. I think they have cheapened it somehow and the prices keep going up on the food too. I don&#39;t know why people like this place. I think Red Rock is way better than this place. If I had a choice Red Rock will always win. So if you are thinking of eating here, I would suggest walking over to Red Rock instead.

Yeah, my review of this location is pretty spot on.  The Cheesecake is great and the Chicken Madera is really good as well but to have a really good experience you need set your expectations a little lower.

My parents love The Cheesecake Factory, so we go here more often than I would otherwise. Never had a bad experience, but never had anything that knocked my socks off.  It&#39;s always noisy, crowded and the service can be iffy. I&#39;ve tried many of the cheesecakes and they are all very good and that&#39;s why you come there anyway!

On, my experience was terrible.  We didn&#39;t have to wait long to get seated, but then the wait began.  Our dinner took 1.5 hours for three appetizers and cheesecake.  We had three restaurant personnel drop by and apologize for the slowness.  Even the couple next to us was surprised that how long it took.  Oh, I forgot, one of the appetizers they brought out was wrong and had to be redone.  To top it off I was sick for two days following.
Amazing place! Love the avocado egg rolls!!!! And the bread! Wow it was perfect!
the food was very very good, and the service was great as well.  It is quite noisy in there though if you&#39;re looking for a quiet place for dinner
Food taste good but the aftermath was no good.  Can&#39;t handle it.  A bit expensive too for what you get.

I didn&#39;t even get to eat at this location!  But the fact that you can&#39;t call ahead and put your name on the 90 minute waiting list is complete crap.  My wife and I frequented the Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki....HAWAII!  Surprisingly we would get in that location with no more than a 20 minute wait and the service was great!<br><br>Unfortunately, for some reason they overshoot your wait time and under deliver at this location.  I would have had better luck getting seated by buying a plane ticket back to O&#39;ahu before I ever got sat at this Salt Lake location.
Always really busy, so put your name down and go shop. Favs are the Luau Salad, Chicken Madiera, Bang Bang Chicken, Chicken di Pana, and Orange Chicken.

This location is always very busy, and they should staff accordingly. The service is slower than all the other CF&#39;s I&#39;ve been to, and I&#39;ve been to quite a few as we&#39;ve lived a lot of places and we travel a lot. The food is consistent and it is kept quite clean, but yeah, their service needs to be kicked up a notch.
Miso Salmon was great, as was the reeses cheesecake

I ate at this location last Sunday and although the wait was only 15 minutes, the service was horrible. We ordered chicken fettuccine alfredo and the sun dried tomato alfredo pasta for 2 of our entrees and after waiting what seemed like 20 minutes to order after she took the order she came back about 5 minutes later to let us know that they were out of alfredo sauce....What? That is why we went there. She suggested other pastas that are equally as good so we ordered those. We didn&#39;t get our food for over 30 minutes and in between that time the server never came to bring us bread or refill our drinks, we were STARVING! When our meals finally came out 4 of our 5 meals were horrible and I could have better food at home that evening for much cheaper. I told the server for the long wait, not having the food we came for, and then it being bad quality we would like a discount or cheesecake or something to make this visit somewhat worth it. She did nothing and it took her 20 minutes to get us our check to get out of this place. It is ridiculous that we were there for an hour and a half and left dissatisfied with our food and service and that they didn&#39;t care. I used to love this place, but don&#39;t know I will eat here again after such service,

Very noisy. You can&#39;t have a conversation. I sat within arms length of another couple. No privacy. Packed like sardines. So don&#39;t go if you want a quiet night out. Cheesecake is amazing, I had chicken Alfredo and got sick. Won&#39;t be going back anytime soon, except to buy a cheesecake.

After reading all the reviews about the wait, we ate dinner someplace else, and visited for dessert.  With the name focusing on Cheesecake, why not go just for dessert!   It was good!  I ordered the Godiva Sunday.  Rich and yummy!  Could have had one bit and been satisfied.  Paying $10 including tip for a bite of chocolate didn&#39;t make me too happy.  Great dessert, could have shared it with 4 people, it was that big!!!  Everyone on our table took home at least 1/2 of their dessert.(no one wanted to share.)  Didn&#39;t like the recomended LEMONCELLO CREAM TORTE too dry!!! Not enough strawberries.  The GODIVA CHOCOLATE BROWNIE SUNDAE is really good IF you like Chocolate, very rich and thick.  KAHLUA COCOA COFFEE CHEESECAKE is really good, heavy on the coffee flavor, but still really good!   <br>Would suggest going for dessert around 7:45!  We didn&#39;t wait at all! Althought it was a Tuesday night! :)
Huge over-salted and overpriced entrees that are lacking in flavor and creativity.  Their cheesecake is the only saving grace, the service is meh.

So I came here last week and after the experience I had I just felt like I needed to update my review. I went in on a Monday afternoon, 20 minute wait. It took 15-20 minutes for the waitress to even notice my mom and I to ask us what we would like to drink. When we told her we needed an extra minute to decide what to eat, she took 20 more minutes to come back and check if we were ready to order. I ended up getting the Teriyaki Chicken, it&#39;s my fave. It took 30 minutes for our food to come out. I started eating and couldn&#39;t help but notice that the rice was rock hard, the chicken tasted off, and there was hardly any sauce. It honestly tasted like it had been sitting around for a while. The restaurant was just really unorganized and nothing was going right. The couple next to us waited 45 minutes for their food. In their defense, the manager came over and offered to take my meal off the check. Overall, my mom and I spent 2 hours here. That&#39;s a little much for lunch on a Monday afternoon.
The 30th anniversary Triple Chocolate Cheesecake is a lil slice of life and love.

My wife and my favorite place to eat. So many choices and all done to near perfection. Not sure how they pull it off but glad they do. One of the few restaurant that we don&#39;t mind waiting an hour or two to get seated and it seems like others don&#39;t mind also. Not sure why so many seem to slam them with poor reviews. The lines and buzz  speak for themselves so if you have not tried it I would ignore the negative comments here and try it for your self. IT IS THAT AWSOME!

I have only been to the Cheesecake Factory like three times in my life... and each time I went, I swore I would never be back, but then I would try it again because so many people seem to like it, but not me, not until the 4th time I tried it.  I think anytime you have to wait in line for over an hour for food... well, you will always be disappointed, because after 45 minutes of standing in a crowded lobby being pushed by a zillion other people who are also waiting in line, well, you just get grumpy and really too annoyed to enjoy the food.   I was also annoyed on my previous visits, that after waiting in line for 90 minutes, I then had to then read through a menu that was about the size of a Harry Poter novel and attempt to choose something.  Fortunately for me, I have now found my perfect Cheesecake Factory companion who did all of the navigating and hard work for me, so I could just show up and enjoy the food.  He had been to the place dozens of times, and seemed to know just the right time to go so we wouldn&#39;t have to wait and just the right thing to order, so I really didn&#39;t even have to open that ridiculously obnoxious menu.  His recommendation was the Crispy Chicken Costoletta, and I must say, I am a fan.  It tasted much better than I expected it to and the portion was so large that I had enough for lunch the next day.  My favorite thing though was the small plate Endive Salad, it was delicious, and when I got home I searched the internet for a recipe for the dressing... but did not find it, so I will have to go back again, just for the salad.  We also ordered a piece of the Red Velvet Cheesecake, and it was good, but honestly, I could give or take the cheesecake, what I really cared about was that yummy Endive Salad.   Aside from the food, we also had one of the best waiters I have had in a really long time.  He was attentive, friendly, knowledgeable, and seemed to know what we needed before we had to say anything.  I wish I could remember his name, but he was great and we made sure to let the manager know how much we enjoyed his service.  <br>Overall, I am giving The Cheesecake Factory 3 stars, I would go back there again, but only with my Cheesecake Factory Companion ..... because I don&#39;t think I would have had such a great experience without him.  So, 3 Stars to Cheesecake Factory and 5 Stars to the friend I went with!

Yet another difficult one to rate: I opted to be positive and go with 4 stars.  Let&#39;s break this down shall we? Bad news first:<br><br>Bad:  Ok, so I was tempted to only give it 1 star based on the choice of background music alone.  At times it sounded like we were on an episode of Love Boat and at others, in a porno in Vegas.  It was horrible.  Luckily I went on a Sunday so there was no wait.  Every other time I&#39;ve attempted to eat there I gave up because the wait was over an hour.  Seriously Utahns, it&#39;s great but no restaurant is worth waiting an hour.  Call me impatient...  Basically the overall feel of the place was that it was trying to be something it was not.  The attempt was made for it to be a classy restaurant (building style, food, bar, etc) but it can&#39;t hide the fact that it is a family friendly chain restaurant.  Not necessarily a bad thing, if that&#39;s where you want to go.<br><br>Now for the good part! The reasons why I&#39;ll go there again.<br>Good:  The food is surprisingly tasty and is nicely presented.  The artichoke appetizer was probably one of the most amazing things I&#39;ve ever eaten.  Obviously the cheesecake is phenomenal and I definitely recommend the Chai Latte!  The service was great and even though the guy was a little creepy (the fact that I was sitting and he was standing and he looked directly into my eyes way too often possibly could have contributed to my uneasiness), we tipped him generously because he was very nice and very good at his job.  The menu is ridiculously long and there are a lot of choices.  Basically everyone could find something they like here.  The building is decorated nicely and the seats are comfortable, although the windows face the ugly parking lot which leaves something to be desired in the view.  I enjoyed myself thoroughly and I liked the food, so therefore I give it 4 stars.
Great food, but as always you get what you pay for. Is there anything wrong with this place? Yes, there is just too much to choose from

When you&#39;re with the family, you got to do the family thing. <br><br>I don&#39;t know what I am mortified by more: The screaming babies and mess-making toddlers at every table or hearing an easy listening cover of Depeche Mode&#39;s Enjoy the Silence sung by an unknown female vocalist.<br><br>Everyone&#39;s meal looked appetizing, but the servings were gargantuan. All dishes where good for two people. It is sad if the huge portions are a selling feature. These people are just as responsible as McDonald&#39;s for obesity. Even if patrons don&#39;t eat their whole portion, it is a lot of waste. I can&#39;t help but think if portions where smaller, 1) prices could be lower, 2) profits could be higher, 3) waste would be lower. G and I each ordered a salad--we could have ordered one and shared it with some left over. I liked my beet/spinach/goat cheese/and other things salad but...<br><br>I lost my appetite just a few bites into my salad when I heard the Depeche Mode cover.

The cheesecake is to die for! The rest of the food is good too. But the place is so loud and I feel so packed in, especially when I&#39;m seated at a 2 person table. Everyone is on top of each other at those tables. And don&#39;t try to get in on a Friday nite or anytime Saturday because you&#39;re gonna have a very long wait!
Meh, what a great word to describe this place.   If McDonald&#39;s tried to get into &#34;fine dining&#34; this, is what it would be.   The food is greasy and bland.

Food is as good as the others in the chain which is a plus. The mood is ruined by the throngs of children running around and screaming. Usually a long wait on weekends except Sunday. Whoever selected the music should be fired. Our waiter was very nice and actually pointed out the music to us which was a little odd. Our experience overall was fun and the food was good. Portion size is very large, be sure to take that into account when order appetizers and desert.
I wasn&#39;t impressed with the food here. I had heard great things about this place, but think it is overpriced for the quality you get. I doubt I will eat here again.
My wife and I like to try a new cheesecake every time we come here. We especially like the Godiva cheesecake.

I was simply shocked at the terrible lack of cleanliness- we were seated at a table where the appetizer plates AND silverware were dirty ( I don&#39;t mean they had been used, somebody had rinsed them but clearly had not cleaned them). The menus were dirty (smudged, dirty fingerprints). I usually really like the cheesecake factory (though I&#39;ve never been to this one before and never will again) but I had to just get up and go after the waiter told me it was &#34;no problem&#34; when I pointed the dirty dishes. No problem?!? Really ?!?

Last night I took my employees there for a holiday dinner.  There were only 7 that were able to attend so it was a small group.  This is something we do annually.<br><br>The management attention seemed to be good until there was a problem.  Our waitress was less than friendly from throwing things down on the table, to not taking drink order to leaving things on the table and not having it bussed until I asked. at which time her attitude became worse.<br><br>I order a steak (which I should know not to do), and ordered it Medium Rare.  The first time it came out it came Medium and they took it back, the second time it came back it was Medium Well.  The problem was that the manager came and argued with me as to the temperature and acted as if I did not know or understand what medium rare was.<br><br>A few times the general manager asked if there was anything they could do to make it right.  I am not the type of person to ask for &#34;freebies&#34; but I do expect the restaurant to make things right.  I told him it was ok and he took me at my word.  The only good thing was he did not charge me for two steaks which I did not eat.<br><br>We have taken our staff there every year since they opened with groups as large as 20.  This was our smallest year however, our bill was still several hundred dollars.  I am thinking this may be our last year do to the service.  Not only was it a negative experience for me but for my staff also, they all commented on the service.

&#34;Fathers Day Brunch Blunder&#34;  Stay clear of breakfast. Epic failure on the kitchen staffs part. Our food came out 45 minutes after we ordered, our food was cold under cooked and hard. I ordered French toast, to my surprise it came out soggy and un cooked dripping with egg all over the plate seeping from the bread. The potatoes that came with breakfast were hard, over cooked and cold. The eggs that came with the steak and eggs were all cold and rubbery. We sent back our food and ordered a bagel salmon platter, we thought that this would take a couple of minutes instead it took another 20 minutes. We cancelled the platter and then finally the manager came by and offered us free dessert, which we turned down and told him it was ok we just wanted him to be aware of the problem. We then had to wait again for 20 minutes for our bill. The server was awesome and should not be blamed for the kitchens epic failure or the management&#39;s. STAY CLEAR OF THE MURRAY LOCATION !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This location should be shut down, it&#39;s a disgrace to the brand.  Also, it&#39;s one of the worst restaurants I&#39;ve been to, service-wise.  CCF was one my favorite restaurants to go to regularly in the Bay Area, for date night, to hang with the girls, for special occasions, or just because.  But THE first week I moved to Utah, I visited this location and I was so disappointed!  The service was HORRIBLE!  The waitress was slow, not friendly at all, and did not pay attention to us or the table next to us.  I was so mad, but the food was good, so I gave this place another chance and came back a month later.  Something is wrong with the waitresses they hire, they don&#39;t know that they work for a tip!  I always tip well and add extra if you&#39;re good, but if you don&#39;t deserve it, you don&#39;t get it.  I boycotted this location for the next month, but decided since the service sucked I would just do curbside take out.  The first time I got curbside, they told me 20 minutes, after 25 minutes my food still wasn&#39;t ready.  The waiter was apologetic about it, but I was still upset.  The second time I ordered curbside, the same thing happened!  After 30 minutes still no food, I asked the waitress nicely why did it take so long.  She had the nerve to have an attitude with me, no apology, just snapped at me saying something about the kitchen.  I yelled back at her and told her she needs to get some customer service training and a new job, and left no tip of course.  Since then, I have not been back to my once favorite and frequently visited restaurant.  I wrote corporate about closing this location and the bad experiences I&#39;ve had or possibly getting new management or retraining the staff on customer service, but I have yet to get a response.  Do NOT eat at this location, once I get over it, I probably try downtown Salt Lake City, maybe.  Hopefully their service is better than this stupid restaurant&#39;s.

Cheesecake factory is nothing but pure disappointment.  Over the past three years, I&#39;ve been to three different Cheesecake Factories around Colorado and Utah.  Every time my food and my wife&#39;s food has been gross, period.  Here&#39;s some examples: sticky and hard pasta that was way overcooked and raw (and not in a good way) tuna.  I&#39;m not sure what the appeal of this overpriced chain is, but after our last visit we said never ever again.

The service was pretty good. They for sure serve you a ton of food, just a heads up don&#39;t order too much! By the time we got to dessert our stomach was stuffed! And we couldn&#39;t fit the best part.. the cheesecake. I do recommend the red velvet that one is delicious. Dessert is definitely better than the actual food though.
The food was good, but the service was not what I would expect from a restaurant of this caliber. Our entree&#39;s made it to the table before our appetizers.

Yes, it is a national chain, and yes, there is always a long line...this location is no different than others around the country. I marvel at how much money this place must rake in. However, at the same time, we always enjoy our visits here, that is, when our blood pressures can take battling all the other hungry customers. Service is very friendly, but ultimately you do feel that they are trying to move you along so they can seat the next customers. The food is the main attraction, or rather, the voluminous quantity of it. Prices are not cheap, but the selection is huge and they do most choices quite well. Usually, we are not able to save enough room for desert, but sometimes we splurge and take a slice of their wonderful cheesecake home.

who lines up for CHEESECAKE FACTORY?? <br>omg are you kidding me??<br>i was laughing in disbelieve that i had to see for myself wat is all the hype?<br>maybe they have model waitresses serving in SLC??<br><br>anyway, cheesecake factory is cheesecake factory.<br> <br>going to skip this one when im in town next time.

I&#39;ve had prior experiences with parties for 2-4 without reservations and been sat within 30 minutes without any problems. However, we had a large group this past Saturday and had made reservations for our party of 18. We called three hours prior to our arrival time and added 4 people to our original party so 22. They said that it would be an hour longer wait time. We said fine and told everyone we would be sat at 7:30 PM instead of 6:30 PM. We all arrived by 7:00 PM. We did not get sat down until 9:00 PM, despite our reservation and confirmation!! Worst service, they did not apologize, they did not offer any explanation, just said that the other party prior to us had not left yet, then what would they have done had we had our original plan. The food is good, the cheesecake is okay. The service at the host stand is awful. The ladies look like they would rather be somewhere else. They are not helpful.  So, the moral is, if you have a 2-4 top, you&#39;ll be fine, but don&#39;t EVER plan a family or work celebration because they are not equipped to handle it.
